texts.es: David, tiene la edad  de 33 años, está soltero,  vive con sus dos padres y tres hermanos y dos hermanas  actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar, almacigo de café y además insumos como abono  y plaguicidas. El tiene pensado comprar  café para sembrarlo en una propiedad que tiene y en este momento esta baldía y con los insumos  brindarle un excelente mantenimiento al café y  así poder generar ganancias en un futuro y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: David, 33, is single and lives with his parents, three brothers and two sisters.  He will use the loan to buy coffee seedlings as well as fertilizer and insecticide.  He is thinking about purchasing seedlings to plant on a piece of land that he has and that is currently not in use, and with these supplies he will have an excellent way of keeping up the coffee and generating earnings for the future.  This will give him a better quality of life and financial stability.  The loan will be the first one he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn’t had any financing from state banks in the past but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings

loans.name: Leofredo

texts.en:
Leofredo is always aiming for a better yield and a higher income from every crop. He strives to attain his aims. He doesn’t want his children to experience what he did before. Leofredo did not finish his elementary education, because his parents had no capacity to send him in school even though he wanted to attain a higher level of education. 

Leofredo is 43 years of age, married, and has four children. His three children are in school--that is, in the high school and college levels of education. Through farming and planting rice in his field, Leofredo is able to send his children to school. One of his children has already finished and pursues the degree through the profit he earns by farming.

Leofredo’s aims push him to strive and continue improving his techniques in farming. He is requesting a loan of P40,000 PHP to buy hybrid rice seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides that will he use in rice farming. He hopes that the loan will help him more in improving his techniques in farming.

loans.use: To buy hybrid rice seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides that he will use in rice farming.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is taking out another loan of KES 20,000 to restore stolen items in his cosmetic shop. He intends to purchase cosmetics for his shop. Since the previous loan, Mohammed's business has been operating very well until thieves broke into his shop and stole some of his items.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 54 years old. He lives in Telavi District with his wife, Liana, a housewife. Teimuraz works as an agricultural worker in the village, earning 100 Laris per month. His salary is too small for the family and they live in poverty. Teimuraz requested a loan to purchase calves. He used to have livestock but the business was stopped 8 years ago because of lack of funds. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

Teimuraz will use this loan to restart his business. He will purchase 6 calves and raise them. The calves will be placed in an old cattle shed located in the family yard. In six months, Teimuraz will sell the grown calves and get the income. For the first year, Teimuraz will reinvest the profit in the business to expand it and increase turnover. The family will get additional income, their living conditions will significantly improve and, in the future, they will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Adila

texts.ru:
Адиле 33 года, замужем, воспитывает 5 детей. Адила работает преподавателем в местной школе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Адила занимается заготовкой и реализацией  сельхозпродукции. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний  день  хозяйстве Адилы имеется 1,6 га орошаемой земли , где она выращивает перец, выручка в продажи которого приносит ей 8,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Адила обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку семян.  Доходы от кредита Адила планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Adila is 33 years old, married, and raising five children. She works as a teacher in a local school but for additional income for her family she also grows and sells produce. Having started the business with 10,000 som (KGS), she today owns 1.6 hectares of cultivated land on which she grows peppers. She earns 8,000 som (KGS) a month from sale of the produce.  

In order to further develop her business Adila came to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) for purchasing seed. She plans to invest income from the loan into future business development.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha wants to prove that even a woman can do farming activities. Alpha is 39 years old and married with four children who are in the college and high school levels of education. Alpha’s husband is a farmer and her partner in managing their farm. Alpha and her husband plant rice in their village.

Most of Alpha's earnings from farming went towards the education of her children. Alpha wants to gain a higher income from her farm to support further her children's education and raise their standard of living. Alpha is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor for her farming activities. She hopes to maintain her farming business and to be able to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor for her farming activities.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth operates a tailoring and embroidery shop in Nyahururu and has been in the business for the past 2 years. She is 29 years old and married with three children aged ten, eight and three years old.

This will be her first loan in the amount of 20,000 KES and she plans to use it to buy more stock of materials such as cotton and linen. This will enable her to make more tablecloths and table mats as well as dresses and therefore meet the demands of her clients.

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to grow her business and open a big tailoring business and supply materials and other tailoring items to other traders, hence make more income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more materials like cotton and linen to sew tablecloths, table mats and dresses.

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es: Juan, tiene la edad  de 26 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos que son su mayor prioridad. Él con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, almácigo y pagar mano de obra para la siembra y asistencia de café, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia en el manejo de café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Juan is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings, who are his main priority. With his loan, he plans to buy fertilizers, plant a seedling nursery, and pay for labor for planting and help with the coffee crop. This way he can be assured of doing the job right. What he wants to do is take advantage of the good climatic and soil conditions that are important for this crop and also put into practice his experience in managing it. He will also be able to buy the best products and the best quality so that his farm will develop well and healthily and have adequate production in the short run. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant coffee

loans.name: Art

texts.en:
Art is 38 years old. She is married and was blessed with five children. She and her husband are raising their family in a small village. She plants and harvests rice for sustenance and for sale, while her husband works as a carpenter, providing his services from their home in the Kompong Cham province.They aim to become financially stable so that they will be able to educate their children and give them a better life.

Due to financial constraints, Art is asking for a loan in the amount of KHR 1,500,000 in order to pay for the cost of land. She will use this land for planting potatoes, and she hopes that she will have a fruitful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: To pay for the cost of land for her farm.

loans.name: Sahr Jacom's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a Kiva partner based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of SLL 4,700,000 in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

Tamba (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. A native of Nimikoro, Tamba is 55 years old. He is married to a teacher, and the couple has five children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Tamba has been a teacher for 27 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for this children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en:
Sameh is a young 28-year-old man. He is married and father to one son. For more than two years, he has been operating a barber shop, which is the only source of income to the family and a profitable project, but also not enough to cover all of his costs.

Sameh is requesting a youth loan of $1000 to help him cover the costs of purchasing new barber kit and some of the necessities to his work, such as: hair and face creams, hairdryers, and hair brushes. This will improve the quality of his work and help to increase the family's income. 

Sameh is shown here in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase a new barber kit and necessities to improve his barber shop.

loans.name: Chawkat

texts.en: Chawkat is a 27-year-old married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and two children, both of whom are studying. He strives to work hard in order to cover his children's study fees. Chawkat started his own business as a barber in 2004. He’s a reputable man and has a fashionable and chic style. Today, he’s requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to enlarge his salon and change its interior decoration so that he will be able to  serve more clients. In the future, he plans to better develop his business and earn superior income.

loans.use: to enlarge his salon and change its interior decoration so he can serve more clients.

loans.name: Holali

texts.fr: Holali est une jeune femme de 31ans. Elle a 03 enfants (Le premier a 16ans et le dernier  03ans) 02 sont à l’école. Son conjoint est menuisier. En 2007, elle a démarré la vente de tonneaux vides à la maison. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter plus  de tonneaux vides pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Elle souhaite que son activité grandisse et qu’elle ait une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Holali is a young woman, 31 years old. She has three children. (The first child is 16 years old, and the last is 3.) Two of the children are in school. Her husband is a furniture maker. In 2007, Holali began selling empty barrels at the house. She is on her second WAGES loan and is requesting this loan to buy more empty barrels to satisfy her customers further. She would like her business to grow and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy empty barrels

loans.name: Alberto Carlos

texts.es:
ALBERTO CARLOS tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con losm padres en Montalvo Provincia de los Ríos.

Alberto Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de babano para exportar. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, abonos, cajas para empacar el banano. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario sin ninguna dificultad. Las Compras lo hará Montalvo.  El sueño es poder tener un camión.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las vías en mal estado.
En el tiempo libre le gusra descansar.
texts.en:
Alberto Carlos is 20 years old, single, and does not have children. He lives with his parents in Montalvo, Provincia de los Ríos.

Alberto Carlos works in agriculture, planting bananas for export. He is requesting the loan to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and boxes for packing the bananas. 

With the help of the loan, he will buy what he needs without any difficulty. He will make his purchases in Montalvo. His dream is to have a truck.

The challenge that he faces are the roads that are in bad condition.

In his free time he likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and boxes for packing bananas.

loans.name: Tawah

texts.en:
Tawah is 35 years old and lives in Compound #3 with her husband and children. She has four children, who are in school. For nine years now, she has been selling oil at the local market. Tawah started this business through her mother and learned it from friends. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more oil for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 57-year-old widow who is supporting two grandchildren aged 12 and 10 years.

Rose operates a dairy farming business, a business she has been doing for the last 3 years.  She makes a monthly income of 4,300 KES. She is taking her fourth loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy dairy feed. Her profits will be used to buy more dairy cows.

Her dream is to educate her grandchildren through to university.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed for her cows.

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Jacqueline es una pequeña comerciante, puesto que expresa que su maxima fuente de ingreso ha sido su oficio de costura y la realizacion de nacatamales que ella misma elabora con el fin de que sus ingresos sean mayores y asi de esta manera apoyar a su familia. Madre de tres hijos, dos de ellos ya independientes, pero solo uno de ellos depende económicamente de ella, por lo que se encuentra en periodo de escolaridad secundaria. Atraves de creditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar el inventario de su negocio comprando materia prima para el mismo. Sin embargo a raiz de la muerte de su señor esposo su proyecto principal para en este 2012 es inciar con hacerle mejoras a su vivienda es por ello el motivo del prestamo para llevar a cabo la construccion de un cuarto para alquilarlo mismo que le generara mas entradas a su economia en pro- de su familia. A pesar de las dificultades economicas producto a la muerte de su esposo expresa sentirse contenta por el apoyo incondicional de la institucion.
texts.en: Jacqueline is a small-scale merchant. She explains that her greatest source of income has been her sewing business and selling nacatamales, which she makes herself, with the purpose of increasing her income so she can support her family. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are already independent. Only one of them is economically dependent on her and is in middle school. Through previous loans she has been able to increase her business’s inventory, buying raw materials for it. However, due to her husband’s death, her main goal for 2012 is to begin making improvements to her house. Her motivation for taking the loan is to build a room to rent out, which will generate additional income for her family’s benefit. In spite of her economic difficulties, due to the death of her husband, she says that she feels content because of the institution’s unconditional support.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Edgar  Alan

texts.es: Edgar  es un  joven  emprendedor  que  día con   día  se  esfuerza  por  salir  adelante, actualmente   el  trabaja   en un rancho  además  de  dedicarse a  la venta  de  ropa   usada, de  esta  manera  obtiene   ingresos para  contribuir  con los   gastos  de  su  hogar,  en esta  ocasión  se  acerca a  la institución ya  que   requiere  de  nuestro  apoyo  para   comprar   ropa  para  vender, ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de hacer   crecer  su  negocio   generando  mayores  ingresos  por  lo  que  se  encuentra  muy  contento.
texts.en: Edgar is an entrepreneurial young man who works daily to get ahead. He currently works on a ranch, and also runs a used clothing sales business to help with household expenses and to provide for his family. He is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase clothing for resale. He sees this loan as an opportunity to grow his business and generate more income for his wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Monserrah

texts.en:
Monserrah is 40 years old and lives in Compound #3. She is married, with seven children aged 27 to five years old, all of whom live at home. Three attend school.

For five years now, Monserrah has been selling dried fish in the market. She learned this way of selling from her mother and enjoys the ways customers respond to her business. 

Monserrah is requesting a loan to purchase more dried fish for her business. She wants to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu lives in Compound #3. She is 31 years old, married, and has three children between one and 13 years old. Two are in school, and all of them live at home. 

For the past ten years, Musu has been operating a table in her community where she sells rice, pepper, and palm oil. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these items for her business. Her plan for the future is to build a house .

loans.use: To purchase more rice, pepper, and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a collection of accessories and spare computer parts to resell.

loans.name: Handful

texts.en:
Handful lives in Compound #3. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children between two and five years of age. They are in school and live at home.

For the past nine years, Handful has been operating a table, where she sells rice and palm oil. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these items for her business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Rodana

texts.en: Rodana is a 28-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and two working siblings. The whole family cooperates together to be able to live a better life and as it should be. Rodana started her own business as a hair dresser seven years ago. Today, she has the intention to take out a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new hair dressing tools for her salon. She notes that this will keep her up to date and allow her to attract additional customers as well. In the future, she plans to open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase new hair dressing tools for her salon

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis Ángel, tiene la edad  de 48 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y tío   actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar insumos como abonos y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado comprar todos estos insumos y además una máquina para limpiar el monte del café para que se mantenga en excelentes condiciones y hacerlo de una forma más ágil y rápida  y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Luis Ángel is 48 years old, and is married and lives with his wife and uncle. With the support from this loan, he intends to purchase agricultural products, such as manure, fertilizers, and pesticides to help with his farming. He plans to purchase these input items, and also to buy a machine to clean his coffee fields. 

This machine will help him to keep his crops in good condition and streamline the harvesting process, allowing him to generate more income and greater financial stability for his future. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and his first ever loan. FUDECOSUR has provided him this opportunity with many benefits and low interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase input agricultural products and utensils for his work.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
MARIA GLORIA tiene 37 años de edad vive en unión libre  tiene 2 hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos en Montalvo provincia de los Ríos.

María Gloria se dedica a la venta de interiores para damas y caballeros. Solicita el crédito para comprar interiores para niños y niñas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la mercadería que mucha falta le hacía para poder cumplir con los pedidos de las clientas.

 Las compras lo hace en Guayaquil cada fin de semana. 

El sueño es tener casa propia. Los desafíoas a los que se enfrenta son la falta de capital. En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar de los animales.
texts.en:
María Gloria is 37 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has two children. She lives with her husband and their children in Montalvo, Provincia de los Ríos.

María Gloria sells underwear for women and men. She is requesting the loan to buy underwear for boys and girls.

With the loan she will be able to buy the merchandise that she very much needs to fulfill the requests of her customers.

She makes her purchases in Guayaquil every weekend.

Her dream is to have her own house. The challenge she faces is a lack of capital. In her free time she likes to take care of animals.

loans.use: to buy underwear for boys and girls

loans.name: Etta

texts.en:
Etta lives in Compound #3. She is 45 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 18 and 29. They are in school and live at home.

For the past ten years, Etta has been operating a table where she sells fish and charcoal. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these items for her business. Her plan is to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a 30-year-old young man. He is married and a father, with one daughter aged six years old.

Ammar is employed and receives a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs and costs. He wants to replace the old refrigerator he has at home with a new one, especially now that Summer season is around the corner. The family wants to get a suitable cooling refrigerator to preserve food for a long time.

Ammar is requesting a loan to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new refrigerator for his home. This loan will afford Ammar and his family a suitable refrigerator to preserve food in healthy conditions as well as the opportunity to drink cool water during the summer season without any additional costs that could strain the family financially.   

Ammar is pictured next to the refrigerator he wants to purchase.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator for his home.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a married woman with two boys and two girls, all of whom are enrolled in school. She is engaged in a business of selling fish from her home, and she aspires to open a shop in the future. Zuhura owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her primary customers include the local residents. Other sources of livelihood includes her husband's earnings. She joined Yehu to get access to funds. 
With the Ksh. 20,000, she intends to purchase charcoal, cooking oil, and fish.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, cooking oil, and fish.

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana  es una mujer que tiene  37 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente, además  cuenta con 02 hijos que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Juana vive en casa propia en el caserío Wiracocha del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 90 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Juana es a la  crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral, ganado porcinos y cuyes, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Rosa cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Su  cónyuge lo apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Juana se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  la crianza, engorde y venta de animales menores, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1,000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión a la compra de alimentos balanceados, vitaminas, vacunas y mejoramiento de corrales de sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 37 years old. She lives with her partner. She also has 2 young children who are in her charge. She lives with her husband and children in their own house. She explains that the quality of life in her community is that of subsistence. The majority of the inhabitants are independent workers who work in commerce and raise small and large animals, and some also work in agriculture. Juana lives in her own house in the small town of Wiracocha, in the district of Tambogrande, in the department of Piura. She only has the basic service of electricity. She gets water from a well. She also mentions that in this small town there are approximately 90 families that live in these conditions.

Juana’s business is raising, fattening, and selling small animals such as: domestic fowl, pigs, and guinea pigs. She raises these animals in corrals outside her house. She explains that she sells her animals either in the local market or to wholesale buyers. Rosa has 5 years of experience in this business, which has allowed her to maintain her established clientele. Her husband supports her whole-heartedly in her work because they have a very good relationship.

Juana has proposed increasing the number of animals that she raises, fattens, and sells. This is because it is a very profitable business in the area. Because of these circumstances, she is requesting a new loan for 1,000.00 nuevos soles (PEN), which she will use to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and to make improvements to her animals’ corrals. Over time, this will allow her to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed for fattening her animals.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr:
Amélé est une femme âgé(e) de 23 ans. Elle est mariée å un  agent commercial et a 02 enfants dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 08ans et le dernier 04ans.
Amélé est revendeuse de pop corn depuis 2009. Elle le vend à toutes personnes dans un quartier de la place et achète le maïs à Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est la concurrence sur le marché.
Amélé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la machine à pop corn, du maïs et de l’huile végétale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, l’agrandir  et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Amélé is a 23-year old woman. She is married to a commercial agent and has 2 children, one of whom goes to school. Her children are 8 and 4 years old.
Amélé began selling popcorn in 2009. She sells her popcorn locally to all types of customers, and buys the corn in Lomé. At the moment, her biggest challenge is a competitive market.
Amélé has obtained her first loan from WAGES in order to buy a pop corn machine, corn, and vegetable oil. She wants to reinvest in and expand her business, and make her family happy.

loans.use: to buy a pop corn machine, corn, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Jose Eliseo

texts.es:
José, quiere mejorar el negocio en el servicio del car Wash, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de artículos para limpieza de autos, ambientales, silicón, detergentes y otros materiales que utiliza en el lavado de los vehículos.
Con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar la atención comprándose una máquina para lavar vehículos, agilizo el servicio  y le dio la oportunidad de crecer con el negocio.
texts.en:
José wants to improve his car wash business. He is requesting a new loan to invest in the purchase of items for cleaning cars such as air fresheners, silicone, detergents, and other supplies used for washing vehicles.

With his previous loan, José was able to improve service by purchasing a machine for washing vehicles. This streamlined his service and gave him the opportunity to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy air fresheners, silicone, detergents, and other car wash supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 36 años de edad, es un hombre muy entusiasta, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también por albergar a la Laguna de Huacachina, un oasis en medio del desierto el cual es visitado por muchos turistas. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y también en ocasiones le gusta disfrutar de su platillo favorito, el cual es el riquísimo Estofado de Res.

Con mucho entusiasmo Carlos trabaja diariamente en su negocio como chofer de taxi, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes al día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismático y siempre tiene un chiste que contar a sus clientes y ellos se sienten contentos con su servicio.

Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, así como también comprar una radio y unos parlantes para acondicionarlos a su vehículo, así podrá dar una mejor atención a los clientes , lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y así seguir trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Carlos is thirty-six years old and very enthusiastic. His home is located in the city of Ica, a city known for its warm climate throughout the year, as well as for being the home of the Laguna de Huacachina [Huacachina Lagoon], an oasis in the middle of the desert that many tourists visit. When he has free time, Carlos likes to listen to music and occasionally he likes to enjoy his favorite delicious dish, Beef Stew.

Carlos works enthusiastically everyday as a taxi driver. He works around ten hours a day, and can have up to twenty clients in a day. He thinks his business is doing well because he is very charismatic and always has a joke to tell his customers, and because his customers are always happy with his service.

Carlos is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because it is through their generosity that he will be able to give his vehicle a tune-up, as well as be able to purchase a radio and some speakers to improve his vehicle so that he can provide his customers with better service, which will help him to have better earnings and be able to work every day to realize his biggest dream: “To own [my] own home.”

loans.use: to give his vehicle a tune-up and to purchase a radio and speakers.

loans.name: María Irma

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 34 años, que es divorciada y vive con sus 4 hijos en "Los Bancos" que es un cantón rural de la Provincia de Pichincha, donde se encuentra la capital del Ecuador. Uno de los principales recursos "Los Bancos" es el hídrico ya que  en su territorio se originan un sin número de riachuelos y pequeñas vertientes que dan paso a ríos de considerable tamaño. Este cantón tiene un gran movimiento comercial que se desenvuelve en la calle principal, donde se encuentran hoteles, restaurantes y almacenes, sobre todo de productos agropecuarios, así como servicios veterinarios y tiendas para el consumo diario de la población.

Para mantener su hogar María se dedica a la crianza de pollos, actividad que la aprendió de familiares. Ella tiene un criadero al cual le dedica 8 horas al día; cuando los pollos ya son grandes su alimentación se vuelve dificultosa. Otra de las actividades que esta emprendedora considera complicada es la limpieza del suelo y en si mantener en buenas condiciones el criadero. Maria desea invertir comprando pollos bebé y alimento ya que tiene capacidad para más pollos de los que actualmente tiene. Con esto ella quiere incrementar sus ingresos y así poder dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Esperamos que con esta oportunidad de crédito María pueda cumplir sus tan anheladas metas y un día se convierta en una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
Maria is thirty-four years old, divorced, and lives with her four children in “Los Bancos,” a rural canton [district] in the Province of Pichincha, the home of Ecuador’s capital city. One of the main resources in Los Bancos is water. Many streams and small springs which lead to much larger rivers have their origin in the region. The canton is home to lots of commercial activity, which takes place on the main street where hotels, restaurants, and warehouses, mostly for agricultural products, as well as veterinary services and stores which provide items used daily by the general population are located.

To cover her living costs, Maria raises chickens. She learned this business from relatives. She has a hatchery where she works for eight hours a day. When the chickens are big, it is difficult to feed them. Another activity this enterprising woman considers complicated is cleaning the ground, which is necessary to keep the hatchery clean and productive. Maria would like to invest by purchasing baby chicks and feed since she has room for more chickens than she currently has. With this investment, she hopes to increase her earnings and be able to provide her children with a better quality of life. We hope that with this loan opportunity Maria will be able to achieve the goals she has set for herself, and one day become an important business owner.

loans.use: to purchase baby chicks and nutritious feed for her hatchery.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel de 34 años de edad tiene como profesion el ser docente, madre de un un pequeño de apenas de ocho años de edad. Su esposo quien es comerciante colabora junto a ella para cubrir gastos basicos del hogar. Expresa sentirse muy contenta en donde Afodenic ha sido una puerta al cambio e infraestructura de su vivienda. Con este su primer ciclo de credito se propone comprar: laminas de zinc, perlines, cemento, golosos, hierro, entre otros materiales de construccion y asi de esta forma llevar a cabo el plan de la construccion de paredes y entechado del hogar, misma infraestructura que reforzara la seguridad de su hogar y que en el invierno inmediato no tendrá problemas de goteras, ni humedad en su casa, ya que su prioridad es brindarle proteccion adecuada a su pequeño y mejor nivel de vida. Sus proyectos a futuro es seguir construyendo su vivienda.
texts.en:
Raquel is 34 years old, and is the mother of an 8-year-old son. She is a teacher, and her husband is a merchant, and they both work to provide for their family and household. She is grateful to Afodenic, as it has allowed her to repair and improve her house. In her first loan cycle she intends to purchase: zinc sheets, metal beams, cement, iron and other construction materials for completing the building plan for walls and roofing of her home. 

These improvements will also improve her home’s security, and in winter, will hopefully stop her roof from leaking, as well as decrease the humidity inside the house. Her priority is to provide a safe and comfortable home for her son, and to give him a better quality of life. Her future projects include continuing construction on her home.

loans.use: to build walls and a roof for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sewing thread and clothing materials.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza comenzó a trabajar el café junto con su esposo e hijos cuando recibió una parcela como herencia de su padre. Ella es una persona preocupada por el medio ambiente así que todo el café que produce es orgánico pues no utiliza fertilizantes que contengan compuestos químicos. Durante la última cosecha Esperanza y su familia produjeron un total de 10 toneladas y tiene como meta que en un lapso no mayor a 3 años esté produciendo un total de 18 toneladas, razón por la cual ella necesita un crédito pues tiene que comprar fertilizantes orgánicos y plantas nuevas ya que algunas con las que cuenta su parcela ya tienen bastantes años y por lo mismo no producen lo suficiente. Además del café Esperanza también es maestra en una escuela primaria de la localidad, lo cual le ayuda a tener a ella y su familia ingresos extras, los cuales cuando pueden los invierten en sus fincas de café pues sabe que toda buena inversión que haga le traerá beneficios a futuro. A esperanza le gustaría que sus 2 hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Esperanza began to work coffee with her husband and children when she received a plot of land as an inheritance from her father.  She is a person who is concerned about the environment, so all the coffee she products is organic because she does not use fertilizers that contain chemical compounds.

During the last harvest Esperanza and her family produced a total of 10 tons.  Her goal is that in a period of no more than three years she will be producing a total of 18 tons.  This is the reason she needs a loan: she has to buy organic fertilizer and new plants because some of the ones on her plot of land are very old and so they do not produce enough.

In addition to coffee, Esperanza also is an elementary school teacher in the community.  This helps her and her family to have extra income, which they invest in their coffee farms because she knows that any good investment she makes will bring profits in the future.

Esperanza would like her two children to have the opportunity to go to the university.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a food cart and ingredients for making meals.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy, tiene la edad  de 29 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa  y sus hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Él con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol y fertilizantes, además pagar mano de obra para la siembra y asistencia de la plantación, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Freddy, 29, is married and lives with his wife and children, who are his top priority. With his loan he plants to buy bean seeds and fertilizers, as well as to pay laborers to help with planting and other farm tasks. This will ensure that he does good work. He wants to take advantage of the good climate and soil conditions for this crop, and also to use his experience at managing basic grains. In addition he wants to buy the best, highest quality products so that his farm will grow and develop in a healthy way, and also have a good short-term production. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had loans with other state banks before this, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 42 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of Gurjaani District with her family, her husband Givi, mother-in-low (pensioner) and two children, a 21-year-old daughter who is unemployed and 19-year-old son who is a student. The family earns a living through agriculture. Irina has a milking (dairy) cow. She also has 2 hectares of land where Irina grows wheat and 1 hectare of vineyard. The family sells their agricultural product on the local open market. In addition, Irina is busy with a small scale poultry business. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Gel.

Irine requested a loan for purchasing pigs. She wants to raise them in the family farm and then sell them on the local open market after 5 months. Also part of the credit will be used for financing seasonal agricultural work in the family vineyard. The average monthly income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and drugs for treating vine trees for parasites

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a 57-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and eight children. Three of them are still studying while the others are working. Jamal has been working as a van driver in order to satisfy his family needs. He has been in this domain since the year 2000. Today, he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to perform necessary maintenance on his van. This will allow him to transport his clients safely without facing problems. In the future, he plans to buy a bigger van and serve a wider range of people.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on his van

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is is 32 years old, married to Pascal, and blessed with three children aged 12, nine, and seven years respectively. She owns a cosmetics & boutique shop which she has been operating for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase lady's shoes, lipsticks, necklaces, body lotions, and facial creams.

The profit she earns will aid her to feed her family. She dreams of having a big business one day and owning a vehicle of her own. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase lady's shoes, lipsticks, necklaces, body lotions, and facial creams.

loans.name: Bitumu

texts.en:
Bitumu is a married woman with one child who is still too young to be enrolled in school. She sells fish from home and has been doing so for the last two years. Bitumu describes market competition as being her major challenge and she aspires to open a retail shop in the future. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. She joined Yehu to access capital for her business.
With the loan of Ksh 20,000, she plans to purchase more inventory of fish and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to waterproof the roof.

loans.name: Elsi Noemi

texts.es:
Elsi, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad, ellos alquilan vivienda, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y de pollos, desde que se caso inicio con su esposo este negocio, tiene ya experiencia.
Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, pollos y pulimento, con esto estará aumentado sus granjas y tendrá alimento para poderlos continuar engordando, ya que le permitirá tener una mejor condición para generar ventas a futuro y poder aumentar las ganancias.
El objetivo de Elsi es tener una fuente de ingreso de la cual poder tener las condiciones económicas para darles el estudio a sus hijos y puedan ser profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Elsi lives in a rented house with her husband and two children, ages 5 and 7. She raises pigs and chickens. Elsi started her business when she got married, so she already has experience. She is currently requesting a loan to buy pigs, chickens, and polished rice hulls so that she can expand her farm and have feed to continue fattening her animals. This will provide better conditions for generating future sales so that she can increase her earnings.

Elsi's goal is to have a strong source of income so that her financial condition allows her to provide for her children's studies, thus enabling them to become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, and polished rice hulls.

loans.name: Ida Ismelda

texts.es:
Ida  es una mujer que tiene  49 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente, además  cuenta con 01 hijo que es menor de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Ida vive en casa propia en el caserío Tres Puentes del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 80 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Ida es la  venta de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, menestras, huevos, leche, aceite, fideos, detergentes, golosinas, etc., esta pequeña bodega la tiene instalada en su propio domicilio, donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidel- izados; así mismo también esta dedicada a la  crianza de ganado vacuno lechero, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de leche la realiza en forma diaria en el mercado local , cabe destacar que en esta actividad Ida cuenta con 8 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en ambos negocios. Su  cónyuge lo apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente  Ida se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial (bodega) y a la crianza de ganado lechero, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 2000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de mercadería (abarrotes); y así mismo la compra de alimentos balanceados, vitaminas, vacunas y mejoramiento de potreros para su ganado lechero; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Ida, 49, is married and has one dependent child. She lives with her partner and son in the home they own. In her community, people live a subsistence lifestyle. The majority are self-employed, working as merchants or in small animal husbandry. Some are also farmers. Ida lives in a home in the village of Tres Puentes in the district of Tambogrande, department of Piura. She has basic electricity. About 80 families live in this village. 

Ida sells basic goods like rice, sugar, lentils, eggs, milk, oil, noodles, detergent, snacks, etc. She has a small store in her home where she attends to her loyal customers. She also raises dairy cows in corrals outside her home and sells the milk daily in the local market. Ida has 8 years of experience with this work, which has allowed her to maintain her established customers in both business. Her husband arduously supports her in her businesses, and they have a good relationship.

Currently Ida has proposed to increase her inventory in relation to both her store and the dairy cows, because it's a profitable activity in her area. She is asking for a new loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy merchandise (groceries) and also to buy balanced feed, vitamins, vaccinations and improve the pastures for her cattle. In time, this will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store and balanced feed for her dairy cow.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 47 years old. She lives with her two children (15 and 17 years old) who are still going to school in the village Akhasheni, district of Gurjaani. The family earns a living through agriculture. She has a vineyard and owns a small plot of land where peaches are grown. Manana is a very hard working woman. Along with her agricultural activities, Manana is busy with pedagogical work. She teaches math to local children. Total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris.

Manana is trying to expand her business and needs money to buy apricot saplings and plant them. In a couple of years Manana will harvest the apricots. Her sales of fruits will increase and it will positively influence the income of the family. With the increased income she will be able to finance her children’s studies and to improve their living conditions.

Manana is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase apricot saplings for planting in the garden

loans.name: Thelesphore

texts.en:
Thelesphore is married with four children aged between 6 and 22. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for seven years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and support his labor costs for better harvests.

loans.name: Marcia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Marcia es una mujer con metas a futuro. Hace nueve años aproximadamente que se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada teniendo a su vez otras entradas a su economia. En esta ocasión el credito lo ocupara para el entechado de su casa ya que su inquietud es que se aproxima el invierno y pues desea que ella junto con su familia gocen de mejores comodidades y mejores condiciones de salud. Con este nuevo ciclo de credito comprara laminas de zinc, estribos, golosos, clavos con tapagotera, cuartones de madera entre otros materiales de construccion. Agradece la oportunidad de pertenecer a la familia de creditos de la micro-financiera que realizara gran cambio en su vida y por el continuo apoyo al mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en: Marcia is a woman with goals for her future. She has been selling new and used clothing for around nine years and also has other sources of income. On this occasion she will use the loan to to put a roof on her house - she is worried because winter is coming and she wants her family to be more comfortable and have better conditions for their health. With his new credit cycle she will buy tin sheeting, supports, bolts, nails with leak protection, and wood beams, among other construction materials. She is grateful for the opportunity to be part of the micro-finance family. She will make a big change in her life with this support to improve her home.

loans.use: to roof her home.

loans.name: Luís Baltazar

texts.es:
Luís tiene 27 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura, debido a la falta de empleo, esta es su fuente de trabajo e ingresos para mantener a su grupo familiar. Este trabajo lo aprendió con un amigo que lo empleaba como jornal en sus cultivos. 

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, él aborda un autobús en su comunidad y viaja durante cuarenta minutos a la ciudad  y otros cuarenta minutos de vuelta a su casa. 

Luís esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 8 sacos de formula a $60 dólares cada uno, 2 galones de veneno a $20 dólares cada uno, 50 libras de semilla a $150 dólares, plaguicidas a $22 dólares, preparación de la tierra y pago de mano de obra para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.  

Con el préstamo comprara todos los insumos de una sola vez, así obtendrá precios más bajos. Además, estará seguro de tener todo a la mano para desarrollar mejor su cultivo, de esta manera tendrá un mejor rendimiento y mayores ingresos.

Él planea trabajar mayor cantidad de tierra y aumentar sus ingresos para brindarles el estudio a sus cuatro hijos que aún están pequeños.
texts.en:
Luís is 27 years old and has 4 children with his common-law wife. Since the age of 15 he has been a farmer.  Due to the lack of other employment opportunities, this is his only source of work and income to take care of his family. He learned to farm from a friend who had hired him as a laborer. 

To buy his farming supplies, he takes a bus and travels 40 minutes to the city and another 40 minutes to get back to his house. 

Luís is seeking a loan from Fundación Campo to purchase 8 sacks of fertilizer at $60 each, 2 gallons of pesticide at $20 each, 50 pounds of seed at $150, and fungicide for $22.  He also has to pay laborers to prepare 14,000 square meters of land so corn can be planted. 

With this loan, he will buy all these supplies at once, so that he will get better prices. Further, he will have everything on hand in order to grow his cornand get a better harvest and increased income. 

He plans to farm more land and increase his earnings so that he can provide an education for his 4 children, who are still young.

loans.use: to purchase 8 sacks of fertilizer at $60 each, 2 gallons of pesticide at $20 each, 50 pounds of seed at $150, and fungicide for $22.  He also has to pay laborers to prepare 14,000 square meters of land so corn can be planted.

loans.name: Carlos Rafael

texts.es: Carlos, tiene la edad  de 28 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. Él con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, semilla de frijol y pagar mano de obra para la siembra y asistencia de la plantación, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos is 28 years old and is married. His relationship with his wife is his highest priority. With this loan he intends to buy fertilizer and beans to plant.  He also needs to pay laborers to help him plant the seed; in this manner he will be sure to do a good job. 

He intends to take advantage of the good climate and soil and also put into practice  his basic experience in farm management.   Also, he will be able to buy better products of higher quality for his farm so that he can maintain the health of the farm and get a good harvest in the short term. 

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not taken other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has enabled him to more easily obtain this loan and has given him a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy beans for planting.

loans.name: Hasifah

texts.en:
Hasifah is 26 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children; 1 of them is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Hasifah has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Hasifah has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts for resale and will help Hasifah to generate greater profits and increase more clients. Hasifah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business . 

Hasifah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hasifah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is married with one child aged 2. The child is still too young to go school. His wife is a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 3 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output. In the future, he would like to own a machine for cultivation.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and support labor costs for better harvests.

loans.name: Stevens Malkins

texts.es:
Stevens vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también por albergar a la Laguna de Huacachina, un oasis en medio del desierto el cual es visitado por muchos turistas. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta reparar cosas, asimismo le gusta comer uno de sus platos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Seco de Cabrito. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar Ingeniería Mecánica.

Con mucho entusiasmo día a día Stevens sale a trabajar en su negocio como gasfitero y electricista; el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día según la dificultad de la reparación, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy minucioso y sobre todo responsable y cumplido con su trabajo.

Stevens está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar herramientas para la realización de su trabajo como rota martillos Bosh, con esta mejora podrá dar una mejor atención a sus clientes ya que tendrá los implementos necesarios; así el seguirá luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa de gasfitería y electricidad”.
texts.en:
Stevens lives in the city of Ica, which is characterized by its year-round hot climate and also is famous for hosting Laguna de Huacachina, an oasis in the middle of the desert that is visited by many tourists. 

When he has free time he likes to repair things, and also likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, Seco de Cabrito. He only completed high school, but would have liked to study mechanical engineering. 

Every day he enthusiastically goes to work in his business as a plumber and electrician. He works around 8 hours per day and can serve up to 10 customers, depending on the difficuly of the repair job. He believes his business is going well and is very diligent and above all very responsible in his work. 

Stevens is very thankful for the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help he haas been able to buy tools for his business such as Bosh rotohammers. He is thus able to provide better service to his customers. He will continue to fight every day to make his dream a reality: "to have a plumbing and electricity business."

loans.use: to buy a rotohammer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She operates a grocery and also sells water as her side job. She has been operating the kiosk for the last two years. Zuhura dreams of expanding the business to wholesale. She describes seasonality as her major challenge and says that she spends more on food over the month. She plans to use the loan of KES 20000 to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Jean  Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is married with four children aged between 1 and 7. Two of them are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 19 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor which will help him with rice farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a solar home system to her replace diesel-powered generator.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is 39 years old and married. Her husband works as a warehouse supervisor. They have two sons.

Amal is known among her neighbors and friends for her delicious pastries. Everyone used to ask her to help when they had an occasion. Recently she decided to turn what she is good at into a business that can bring her profit. So she started making pastries and selling them, already baked or not, based on what the customer wants.

Now she has applied for this loan to buy a new oven and a few kitchen tools that will allow her to make a larger quantity at a time to accelerate the process.

loans.use: to buy a new oven and kitchen tools

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 32 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children who are currently in school. For the past 11 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en:
Sylvester is married with three children aged between 15 and 23. All of them attend school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 11 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and pay for support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output. In the future, he would like to have a machine to help on his rice plantation.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pay for labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: El señor Joel hombre responsable y trabajador. Hace varios años que su labor es de Guarda de Seguridad, un trabajo de mucho sacrificio y responsabilidad. Junto a su esposa han logrado ir mejorando dia a dia su vivienda. Como objetivo principal ha sido la construccion de su casa que ha venido haciendo con ahorros propios y mediante micro-creditos financiados por la institucion a la que una vez mas acude. Hoy en dia va a repellar paredes internas y  levantar pared de frente de su vivienda, lo que comprara materiales de construcción, para poder comenzar, todo esto gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic y Kiva han dado, en donde ha avanzado más rápido, ya que todo está a altos costos, y que le es favorable pagar a plazos ya que se equilibra en los gastos y demas obligaciones que tiene para con su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Joel is responsible, working man.  For many years he has been working as a Security Guard, a job that involves a great deal of sacrifice and responsibility.  Along with his wife they have been bettering their home each day.  His main objective has been the construction of his house which he has been doing using both his own savings and through micro-credit loans financed by the same institution that is funding him once more.  

At the present time he will plaster the internal walls and build a wall in front of his house, for which he will buy construction materials to start.  All of this is thanks to the loans that Afodenic and Kiva have given him.  He is progressing more quickly now, since everything is so expensive and it is preferable for him to pay in installments so that he can balance his spending with the other obligations that he has to his family.

loans.use: To plaster and construct walls [of his home].

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha, 33 years old, is a married lady who has a son and a daughter.

Maha bought a number of pieces of equipment and started a small beauty salon at home. Having the experience from before, and a nice personality, has given her the advantage to attract the females in the neighborhood.

Now Maha has applied for this loan to buy a few tools like new brushes and a hairdryer and to add a new section for makeup.

loans.use: to buy tools like new brushes and a hairdryer

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed, 30 years old, is married and has a daughter and a son.

Raed has a computer store where he sells electronics, mainly computer parts, repairs computers, and does programming. The store has been working for over five years.

Now Raed wants to open a new section for establishing an internet café. He wants to start by adding a few PCs. For that reason, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy a few PCs to start an internet cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Sakher

texts.en:
Sakher, 22 years old, is single and the oldest among six brothers and sisters.

Sakher is a mathematics university student who hopes to get his Bachelor's degree as soon as possible and enroll in the teaching path.

He has applied for this loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Karima

texts.en:
Karima, 42 years old, is a housewife. She is a conservative person and for that reason, she has asked her son to take her place in the photo, as he is the one she is taking the loan for.

Karima has four sons and a daughter and her husband is an accountant. Her oldest is Abdul-Rahman, 22 years old and single, who is working and studying at the same time. Abdul-Rahman works in a hospital as a laboratory samples transformer, and at the same time, he goes to the university to get a Bachelor's degree so he can improve his position level or get a new job.
 
Now Karima has applied for this loan so she can help her son and pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled, 23 years old, is a single guy who has three brothers.
 
Now the family has two members that are studying at the university, which is difficult to afford. Khaled is majoring in industrial engineering, and he is almost in his last year. After getting a Bachelor's degree, Khaled wants to apply for a Master's degree, but for now, he has applied for this loan so he can pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 24 years old, is single and the youngest among five brothers and one sister.

Mohammad has been going to the University for the last three years to study computer science. After getting his degree, Mohammad wants to look for a suitable job in a technical company so he can apply what he has learned. For now, he has applied for this loan in order to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Othman

texts.en:
Othman, 23 years old, is a university student majoring in computer science. He studied hard in high school to be able to enroll in a governmental university to save money.

Being the oldest among six brothers and sister is a hard thing since he has to be a good role model for them, So, Othman is trying as hard as he can to always succeed in whatever he does.
 
Today Othman has applied for this educational loan so he can pay for his semester fees to graduate as soon as possible and start working to help the family financially.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.fr:
Mimi fait partie du groupe Umoja et   habite à  Ngozi. Elle  a 29 ans et est mariée à Benjamin, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants, dont 2 étudient .Les enfants sont âgés  de  3 à  8 ans.
Elle a sous sa  charge, son frère qui étudie à l’école secondaire  et un orphelin.

Elle est commerçante des habits de bébés, des  draps, couvre-lits… depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de couvre-lits à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter une voiture de transport pour son mari.
texts.en:
Mimi is a member of the Umoja grouop, and she lives in Ngozi. She is 29 years old, and married to Benjamin, a driver. Together they have 3 children, 2 of whom are in school. The children are between 3 and 8 years old.
She is also financially responsible for her brother, who is studying at secondary school, and an orphan. She is a trader of baby clothing, bedding and bedcovers... she has been doing this for 6 years. This is her eleventh loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she is seeking, she will increase her working capital, purchasing a large quantity of bedcovers to resell, in order to increase her income.
In the coming years, she would like to buy a taxi for her husband.

loans.use: to increase her working capital, buying many bed covers to sell in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr:
Aby est une jeune dame âgée de 32 ans qui fait du commerce depuis 2 ans. Elle gère une cantine de produits de mercerie. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle vient solliciter pour la première fois un crédit de 200000FCFA pour renforcer son stock. Elle va acheter du fil, des rubans, de la popeline, de la laine etc...
Avec le crédit, elle va pouvoir diversifier ses produits et services.
Aby supporte les charges de location de sa cantine mais aussi les factures d’électricité.
Elle aimerait ouvrir une autre boutique dans le marché du quartier pour augmenter son potentiel client.
texts.en:
Aby is a 32 year old young lady who has been in business for 2 years. She runs a small haberdashery store. She is married and a mother. She is seeking a loan for the first time - of 200,000F CFA in order to increase her stock.
She will purchase thread, ribbons, poplin, wool etc... With the proceeds of the loan, she will be able to broaden her products and services. 
Aby covers the costs of renting the store, and also the electricity bills. She would like to open another store in the local marketplace, to increase her potential customer base.

loans.use: to purchase haberdashery items (cotton thread, cotton fabric, wool, trimmings).

loans.name: Djaria

texts.fr: Djaria est une jeune femme de 30ans. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique et au marché depuis 2009. Son conjoint est revendeur et elle a 02 enfants dont 01 à L’école. L’ainé a 06ans et le dernier 03ans.  Elle sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter des produits d’alimentation. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et avoir une famille heureuse et bien éduquée.
texts.en: Djaria is a young woman who is 30 years old. She has had an income-generating activity selling groceries in a shop and on the market since 2009. Her husband is a retailer and she has two children, one of whom is at school. The eldest child is six years old and the younger one three years old. She is requesting this second loan to buy groceries. She wants to reinvest in her business and have a happy and well educated family.

loans.use: to buy general groceries

loans.name: Assimahedou

texts.fr:
Assimahedou est une femme âgé(e) de 38 ans. Elle est mariée  å un militaire.  Elle a 04 enfants, dont 03 à l’école. Le premier a 14 ans et le dernier a 02ans.
Assimahedou travaille comme revendeuse de céréales depuis 2009. Elle vend avec une personne et s’approvisionne à Anié.
Assimahedou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales.
Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait diversifier les produits et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: Assimahedou is a 38-year old woman, who is married to a soldier. She has four children, three of whom are at school. The eldest child is 14 years old and the youngest two years old. Assimahedou has been working as a retailer of cereals since 2009. She sells with another person and gets her supplies in Anié. She has requested her first loan from WAGES so that she can buy cereals. In the next few years, she would like to diversify her range of products and provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Rosa Indiana

texts.es:
Rosa  es una mujer que tiene  22 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente, además  cuenta con 01 hijita que es menor de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Rosa vive en casa propia en el caserío Chica Alta del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 120 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Rosa es la  venta de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, menestras, huevos, leche, aceite, fideos, detergentes, golosinas, etc., esta pequeña bodega la tiene instalada en su propio domicilio, donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidelizados; así mismo también esta dedicada a la  crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral, ganado porcinos, caprinos, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Rosa cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en ambos negocios. Su  cónyuge lo apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente  Rosa se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial (bodega) y a la crianza, engorde y venta de animales menores, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1,500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de mercadería (abarrotes) y 02 estantes para este negocio; y así mismo la compra de alimentos balanceados, vitaminas, vacunas y mejoramiento de corrales de sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 22 year old woman with a domestic partner and one daughter for whom she is the caregiver.  She lives with her partner and her daughter in their own house.  The quality of life in the community is that of basic subsistence.  The majority of the inhabitants are independent workers who work in the selling and care of small animals and some also work in agriculture.  Rosa lives in her own house in the farm area Chica Alta of the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura.  She only has basic electricity.
