It is also worth mentioning that in this farm area approximately 120 families live under these conditions.

Rosa devotes herself to the commercial activity of selling primary necessity products such as: rice, sugar, vegetable stew, eggs, milk, oil, noodles, detergent, sweets, etc.  She has a small store installed in her own house, where she attends to her loyal customers.  She is also devoted to the raising, fattening, and selling of small animals such as: fowl, pig livestock, goats.  These animals are raised in external corrals outside her house.  However, she sells them in the local market and/or to wholesale animal buyers.  It is worth mentioning that Rosa has 4 years of experience with this activity, which has allowed her to maintain an established clientele in both businesses.  Her domestic partner arduously supports her in the activities he does, and there is a good family relationship between the two of them.  

Currently, Rosa has proposed the expansion of her inventory in her commercial establishment (store) and the raising, fattening, and selling of small animals.  The reason for this is that it is a very profitable activity in this area.  Thus, she is asking for a new loan for a total of S/.1,500 nuevos soles, which will be used to invest in the purchase of merchandise (groceries) and 2 shelves for this business.  Also she will buy nutritionally balanced food, vitamins, and vaccinations and better the corrals where her animals live.  In time this will allow her to better her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (groceries), shelves for her business, and nutritionally balanced food for her animals

loans.name: Férouce

texts.fr: Mariée à un agent d’une ONG, Ferouce est une jeune dame de 33ans. Elle a 04 enfants dont 03 à l’école. Le premier a 11ans et dernier 02ans. Pour venir en aide à son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle a commencé par vendre les charbons de bois depuis 2000 à domicile. Son approvisionnement se fait  à Lomé et dans les localités du pays. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, une personne l’aide. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle veut agrandir son activité et diversifier les marchandises par la vente des ignames. Elle souhaite que ses enfants grandissent dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: Ferouce, who is married to an NGO officer, is a young lady who is 33 years old. She has four children, three of whom are at school. The eldest child is 11 years old and the youngest two. In order to help out her husband with the household expenses, she began selling charcoal from home in 2000. She gets her supplies in Lomé and from other towns in the country. In order to be able to respond better to customer demand, she has another person helping her. She is on her second loan from WAGES and is requesting it to buy sacks of charcoal. She wants to expand her business and diversify by selling yams. She would like her children to grow up under good conditions.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Monica Liliana

texts.es:
Mónica, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para su negocio, pues considera que seguirá creciendo mediante esta ayuda, ella comprara maíz y leña, que son los materiales necesarios para el trabajo que a diario realiza, esta compra le ayuda mucho, pues adquiere por mayor los productos para conseguir un mejor precio.
Manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logro realizar la inversión para el mantenimiento del negocio, manteniéndose con lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Mónica is requesting a new loan for her activity, because she thinks that thanks to this help her activity will keep on growing. She will buy maize and firewood, materials she needs for her daily job. This purchase will help her a lot, as she buys products at wholesale price to get a better price.
She says that thanks to her previous loan she has succeeded in investing in the maintenance of her shop, while providing her family with their basic needs.

loans.use: To buy maize and firewood.

loans.name: Alex Antonio

texts.es:
ALEX ANTONIO tiene 29 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Montalvo provinccia de los Ríos.

ALEX ANTONIO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de ,maíz, además realiza trabajos de construcción.

 Solicita el crédito para poder comprar insumos, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas y comprar un terreno.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes. Las compras lo hará en Montalvo.

El sueño es poder comprar un carro. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es falta de dinero. En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Alex Antonio, 29, is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in Montalvo, in the province of Los Ríos.  He is a farmer who grows corn; and he also works in construction.

He is requesting a loan to buy suppliers, fertilizers, urea and insecticides, and to buy land.  He will be able to buy fertilizers with the loan, and will make his purchases in Montalvo.

His goal is to buy a car.  The main challenge he is up against is lack of money.  In his free time he likes to take it easy.

loans.use: To buy supplies, fertilizers, urea, and insecticides, and to buy land.

loans.name: Juan Rafael

texts.es: Don Juan Rafael, jefe de familia tiene la edad de 46 años con dos hermosos hijos de los cuales solo uno de ellos esta estudiando y depende de el, desde hace varios años trabaja como contador. Su esposa quien es secretaria le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Juntos es como ellos han podido ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda mediante ahorros y ayuda de micro-creditos. Con este su tercer ciclo de financiamiento en Afodenic siendo siempre su principal proposito el hacerle mejoras a su vivienda acude una vez mas  a la institucion para llevar a cabo el embaldozado y cerrar parte frontal de su casa, misma construccion que requerira la compra de los siguientes materiales de construccion: bolsas de cemento, bloques, arena, piedrin, alambre de amarre, hierro entre otros y asi comenzar la obra. Con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos decide comprar un taxi y asi de esta forma tener una entrada mas a su economia y cumplir con sus compromisos de pago.
texts.en: Juan Rafael, 46, is a head of household with two beautiful children, only one of whom is in school and in his care.  For several years he has worked as an accountant.  His wife is a secretary and helps cover household expenses.  Together they have been able to renovate their home little by little with their savings and the help of micro-loans.  For a third time he is requesting a loan through Afodenic to continue home improvements.  He will finish with the tile and front of the house.  The construction materials he needs to begin work are: bags of cement, blocks, sand, gravel, wire, and iron among other items.  In an effort to increase his income he has decided to buy a taxi which will improve his economy so he can pay off debts.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es: María es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “La Amistad” la cual está conformado por 10 socios, con 01 años de antigüedad. María de 37 años es conviviente con 03 hijos la cual sigue apoyándolos. Hace más de 06 años que María cuenta con una bodega en su domicilio, comenzó este negocio con la idea de obtener ganancias, poco a poco ha mejorado su negocio. Con sus trabajos que ha realizado y con la ayuda de su pareja compraron una moto taxi la cual lo trabaja uno de sus hijos, obteniendo  un ingreso extra para su hogar. El crédito que solicito lo invertirá en su bodega comprando mercaderías como gaseosas, golosinas, tubérculos, etc y de esta manera tener surtida su negocio. A futuro le gustaría comprarse otra moto taxi para que también lo alquile como servicio de transporte. María al igual que todos los socios de la Alcancía Comunal “La Amistad” agradecen el crédito brindado. María está ubicada al lado derecho, viste una chompa blanca y pantalón plomo.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank "La Amistad", which is one year old and comprised of 10 members.  María, 37, lives with her common-law husband and three children.  For over six years she has been running a store from her home.  She set up the business to earn a profit, and little by little has been expanding the business.   Through her work and with the help of her husband, she bought a motor-taxi for one of her children, which adds extra income to the household.

The loan she has requested is to invest in the store.  She plans to buy goods such as sodas, sweets, tubers, etc., so she can re-stock the business.  In the future she would like to buy another motor-taxi to rent out for transporation services.  Like the other members of the communal bank "La Amistad", María is grateful for the loan.  In the photograph, she is on the right in a white sweater and grey trousers.

loans.use: To buy sodas, sweets and tubers.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es: Cecilio, tiene la edad  de 59 años, está casado,  vive con su  hijo, su esposa y una hermana de su esposa. El con el crédito va comprar una vaca para la producción de leche. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de estos animales, el cuenta ya con varios animales pero quiere aumentar la producción de leche. El tiene como meta generar un aumento en la producción y tener mayores ingresos para su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Cecilio is fifty-nine years old, married, and lives with his son, his wife, and one of his wife's sisters. With the loan he is going to buy a dairy cow. He has a suitable lot for cultivating these animals and already has several of them but wants to increase their milk production. Generating an increase in their production and having a greater income for his family's well-being are goals of his. This is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur. He hadn't had other loans with state banks before, but Fudecosur has given him the loan with greater ease and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aîcha

texts.fr: Aïcha est une femme de 28ans. Elle est mariée à un enseignant. Elle est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale à la maison. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et sa difficulté principale est la concurrence sur le marché. Elle est à son premier crédit de WAGES et sollicite cet argent pour acheter de la marchandise. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, avoir des boutiques de vente de produits d’alimentation générale et avoir plus tard des enfants et mieux prendre soin d'eux.
texts.en: Aïcha is a 28 year old woman. She is married to a teacher. She is a vendor of grocery products from her home. She buys her stock in Lomé, and her main problem is competition in the marketplace. This is her first loan with WAGES and she is seeking these funds to purchase merchandise. She wants to invest in the business, to have small grocery store outlets, and later to have children that she will be able to look after.

loans.use: to purchase general grocery items

loans.name: Juan María

texts.es:
Juan María es un adulto mayor  tiene 82 años de edad y es un trabajador constante,  vive con su familia en una comunidad  llamada Cartagena, en la provincia de Guanacaste. La economía de esta provincia se fundamenta principalmente en la ganadería, aunque también en esta región se practican la apicultura y acuacultura.

Juan María necesita reparar su vehículo, ya que es el único medio con el que él se gana la vida transportando personas de la comunidad de un lugar a otro .  El está solicitando  un crédito por seiscientos mil colones (¢600.000) para comprar los repuestos del vehículo y pintarlo para continuar dando este servicio ya que con esto se garantiza un ingreso para cubrir sus necesidades básicas.

Juan María es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Cartagena, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y está muy feliz porque encontró una excelente  forma de financiamiento para reparar su vehículo y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Juan María is an older adult of 82 years of age and a constant worker. He lives with his family in a community called Cartagena in the province of Guanacaste. This province's economy is based principally off of livestock, although beekeeping and aquaculture are also carried out in this region.

Juan María needs to repair his vehicle as it's the only means by which he makes a living, transporting the community's people from one place to another. He is requesting a loan for six hundred thousand colones (¢600.000) to buy the vehicle's spare parts and paint it. This is so that he can continue offering this service since with this it guarantees an income to cover his basic necessities.

Juan María is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Cartagena (Communal Loan Business of Cartagena), one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. He is very happy because he found an excellent form of financing in order to repair his vehicle and continue working.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the vehicle that he uses as a taxi.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Akouvi est une femme âgé(e) de 45 ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et a 02 enfants dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 22ans et le dernier 17ans.
Akouvi travaille comme revendeuse de fruits et amuse-gueules depuis 1998. Elle exerce seule son activité à la devanture d’un bar et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Akouvi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des fruits, de la farine de blé, d’huile, de sucre pour la préparation d’amuse-gueules. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Akouvi is a 45 year old woman. She is married to a driver and has 2 children, 1 of whom is in school. The elder is 22 and the younger 17 years old. Akouvi has worked as a fruit and snack seller since 1998. She works on her own, at the front of a bar - and she buys her raw materials in Lomé. Akouvi is seeking her first loan with WAGES in order to buy fruit, flour, oil and sugar for making snacks. She wants to invest in her business, and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, flour, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Judith Georgina

texts.es: La Señorita Judith tiene 22 años y es soltera, se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa,   la señorita tiene su tienda en una de las avenidas más  concurridas y estratégicas de la ciudad de La Paz este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Judith va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de mercadería variedad de ropa de temporada para surtir su tienda, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incrementar su capital de trabajo. Judith enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia pero tiene una ventaja ya que ella vende ropa de temporada y tiene más stock y utilizara los beneficios compra de más ropa para su stock, su deseo para su negocio es crecer y  repartir ropa en otras tiendas al por mayor, ella es una joven emprendedora luchadora se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Judith is 22 years old and she in single. She sells clothes, and she owns a shop located in one of the most busy and strategic streets of the town of La Paz. This is her first loan with our institution, and Judith will use it to buy a variety of seasonal clothes to stock up her shop. She is therefore requesting a loan to increase her working capital. Judith has to face many challenges with her activity, notably competition, but she has an advantage upon her competitors: she sells seasonal clothes, she is better stocked up and she will use the loan to buy more clothes for her inventory. She hopes that her activity will grow and to be able to become a supplier, distributing clothes to other shop at wholesale price. She is a young and resourceful entrepreneur and she is happy and thankful for the opportunity she has been granted.

loans.use: To buy a variety of seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a washer and dryer.

loans.name: Erika Pamela

texts.es:
Erika es una joven de 30 años, madre de 3 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 12,7 y 1 añito; son su mayor adoración y el regalo más grande que Dios le ha podido dar, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, así como también por ser la cuna de grande glorias de deporte peruano, así como también la rica sazón que tienen para la preparación de los platillos. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho estar al lado de sus hijos, así como también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pato”.

Con mucho entusiasmo Erika trabaja en su negocio de venta de dulce como mazamorra morada, arroz con leche, y también la venta de salchipollo; ella se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 45 clientes en el día; ella cree que el va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene una buena sazón para los dulces.

Erika esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ay que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un carrito sanguchero y con esta mejora poder mejorar sus ventas ya que tiene mucho pedidos de sus clientes, así ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño: “Tener su casa propia y crecer en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Erika is 30 years old. She is mother of 3 children aged 12, 7 and 1: she adores them and she thinks they are the best gift that she has received from God. She lives in Chincha, a town characterized by its warm and welcoming climate, as well as for being the birthplace of great Peruvian sportspeople; it is also known for the tasty flavors used to prepare food. Whenever she has some free time, she deeply enjoys spending time with her children, as well as eating one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Arroz con pato” (duck with rice).

Erika engages in her activity with deep enthusiasm: she sells sweets such as purple “mazamorra” (corn porridge), rice pudding, and she also sells “salchipollo” (fried potatoes served with fried chicken and sauces). She works for about 8 hours a day and she can serve up to 45 customers per day. She thinks her activity is going well because she is very kind with her customers and above all because she has a good flavor she uses for her sweets.

Erika is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to buy a small food cart. Thanks to this investment, she will be able to increase her sales, since she has received many orders from her customers; and as her income will consequently increase and she will be able to keep on fighting to make her biggest dream come true: “To have a house of her own and to make her activity grow”.

loans.use: To buy a small food cart.

loans.name: Beatriz Del Carmen

texts.es:
BEATRIZ DEL CARMEN tiene 40 años de edad es divorciada tiene 4 hijos, vive con los hijos en Montalvo provincia de los Ríos.
BEATRIZ DEL CARMEN se dedica a la venta de frutas tropicales, además cría animales.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar frutas cómo piñas, uvas, papayas, naranja. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la mercadería. Las compras lo hace en Guayaquil cada semana. 

el sueño es tenert un negocio propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es es los altos precios de los productos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar los animales que tiene.
texts.en:
Beatriz del Carmen, 40, is divorced, has four children and lives with them in Montalvo, province of Los Ríos.  She sells tropical fruits for a living and also raises animals.

She is requesting a loan to buy fruits, such as pineapple, grapes, papayas, and oranges.  The loan will enable her to buy the merchandise.  She goes to Guayaquil every week for her purchases.

Her goal is to have her own business.  The challenges she is up against are the high prices of the products.

In her free time she enjoys caring for her animals.

loans.use: To buy fruits, such as pineapple, grapes, papayas, and oranges.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her small business which sells clothes and shoes. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and shoes for reselling and will help Margret to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to start trading up to other countries. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes for reselling.

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es:
La señora Aura es originaria de Granada, casada, tiene dos hijas una de 23 años y la otra de 12 años de edad ambas se encuentran estudiando, ella es comerciante en el negocio de pulpería. Inicio su actividad debido a que veía la necesidad de estar más cerca de sus hijas  ya que  anteriormente se dedicaba a vender en el mercado el cual  le quitaba mucho tiempo y descuidaba a sus hijas. Pero actualmente en este negocio  la apoya su hija y su esposo, no tiene otros ingresos pues solo cuenta con las ganancias que le genera la pulpería. Solicito el  crédito para compra de mercadería tales como arroz, Azúcar, pan, aceite y  gaseosas. Este crédito le ayudara en gran manera ya que le permitirá  incrementar sus ventas  y surtir su inventario. Le gustaría seguir trabajando y tiene como expectativa alquilar cuartos para hospedaje así obtener otros  ingresos.
Se  considera una persona con ganas de salir adelante para tener un mejor nivel de vida tanto ella como su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Aura is originally from Granada. She is married and has two daughters, ages 23 and 12, both of whom are studying. Aura is a merchant who manages a store. She started her business because she needed to be closer to her daughters. Aura previously sold at the market, but this required too much of her time at the expense of daughters. This business currently supports her daughters and her husband since she has no other income. She relies solely on the revenue generated from her store.

Aura is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, bread, oil, and sodas. This loan will help in a great way so that she can increase her sales and restock her inventory. Aura would like to continue working and has plans to rent out rooms to earn additional income. She is considered to be a person who has the drive to succeed so that she and her family can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bread, oil, and sodas.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is married with three children aged between 14 and 18. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. 

He has been a rice farmer for five years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and support labor costs in the production of rice.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is married with three children aged between 3 and 18. Two of them are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. 

He has been a rice farmer for four years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Ramazan

texts.en:
Ramazan is married with four children aged between 2 and 11. Two of them are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. 

He has been a rice farmer for 12 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and support labor costs for better rice production.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya and has been in farming for ten years; producing and selling maize, beans and milk, which are sold within the local market. He is married with three children aged 22, 20 and 18 and all are still schooling.

Stephen has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. He says the venture into poultry farming will boost his farming income and enable him to offer the best college education for his three children, as well as improve the living standards of his family.

He says the challenge remains poor roads networks, which makes access to markets difficult.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Chinzorig

texts.en:
Chinzorig is 25 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife is employed and his children are school students. 

He started his taxi service business in early 2010 with his own car. His car is in excellent condition and his customers are very satisfied with his service. However, his income is not stable. Therefore, he is requesting 400,000 MNT to register with a taxi company. By doing so, he will get the benefit of a stable income. 

He is a hardworking young man who says "If I could register, I would finally be able to support my children"

loans.use: To register with a taxi company

loans.name: Altanbagana

texts.en:
Altanbagana is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is a driver, her two eldest children are school students and the youngest one is in kindergarten.

She started her felt (compressed wool) boot-making business in 2009. Her boots are natural and affordable. During the summer, felt prices drop. Therefore, she needs to save in order to run her business successfully. 

She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy raw materials for her boot-making business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her boot-making business

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya is 23 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is a carpenter and her son is in kindergarten. 

She started her sewing business in 2010. Her mother is a professional tailor and she picked up her skills from her mother. Her sewing skills are well known around her neighborhood. However, due to her old sewing machine, she is having trouble with the sewing. 

She is a sharp young woman who says "Due to my machine, it is decreasing my performance drastically. If I use a new one, my quality and performance would be twice as good as now". She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy a new sewing machine and some raw materials.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and some raw materials

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya is 52 years old and lives with her two children and daughter-in-law in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Darhan-uul province, Mongolia. Her eldest child is employed and the younger one is a college student. 

She started her bakery retailing business in 1999 by renting a counter in the market. Over the years she has gained many regular customers. Now that her daughter is in college, she has to increase her income by renting another counter. 

She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says" It has been hard since my husband passed away. However, I have no time to feel sorry for myself". She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy additional supplies.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer muy optimista y entusiasta, tiene 3 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero los ama mucho y ellos a ella también, su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú, este distrito se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, así como también por la amabilidad de sus pobladores; también se realiza la agricultura y se cultiva el algodón.  Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta conversar con sus vecinas y amigas del barrio; asimismo le gusta preparar su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo Ceviche. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Enfermería.

Con mucho entusiasmo Martha trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes y productos de belleza; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 25 clientes en el dia; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque tiene mucha fe y eso la ayuda a salir adelante.

Martha está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, entre otros) y productos de belleza, con lo cual tendrá mayor variedad de productos y así podrá mejorar sus ingresos para poder seguir adelante y hacer realidad su más grande sueño: “Crecer en su negocio y que este sea más grande”.
texts.en:
Martha is a very optimistic and enthusiastic woman.  She has three children who are already adults but she loves them a lot, as they do her.  Martha's home is located in Parcona district, Ica, Peru.  This district is noted for its hot climate and for the kindness of its inhabitants.  Agriculture is an important business here, as is cotton growing.  Whenever she has any free time, Martha enjoys chatting to her friends and neighbors in her neighborhood.  She also likes to prepare her favorite dish which is the delicious 'ceviche' (fish marinated in citrus juice).  Martha only managed to complete her secondary education but she would have liked to have studied to become a nurse.

Martha works in her business selling groceries and beauty products with a lot of enthusiasm.  She works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 25 customers a day.  She believes that her business is doing well because she is very kind to her customers and also because she has a lot of faith and this helps her to make progress.

Martha is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help that they give her, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as groceries (rice, sugar, noodles, canned food, etc.) and beauty products.  This will give her a larger variety of products to sell and she will be able to improve her income so that she can make progress and fulfill her biggest dream of growing in her business and making it bigger.

loans.use: to buy groceries and beauty products

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren is a 48-year-old man who lives with his wife and four daughters in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife is a server and three of his daughters study at secondary schools. The oldest daughter goes to college. 

Davaasuren has been running a meat retail business for 17 years. He already has a well-located shop counter and now has many regular customers. He purchases the meat from the neighboring villages. 

Davaasuren is a hardworking and active man who says that "I would like to develop the business activities by purchasing supplies in large quantities. I am planning to save for my three daughters' college fees". The total amount he is requesting is 2,800,000 MNT to buy more meat.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Heudy

texts.es:
Yeudy es un joven emprendedor de 34 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada Cartagena, en la provincia de Guanacaste. La economía de esta provincia de Guanacaste se fundamenta principalmente en la ganadería, aunque también en esta región se practican la apicultura y acuacultura.
Yeudy  es una persona discapacitada, solo se puede trasladar en silla de ruedas , ya que sus piernas  no tienen movimiento , él tiene una pequeña pulpería , que es el único medio con el que se gana la vida, ayuda económicamente a su familia y  suple sus necesidades  económicas a través de este negocio.
El está solicitando  un crédito por seiscientos mil colones (¢600.000) para comprar productos y surtir  más su  pulpería,  desea de esta forma mejorar su  negocio y su calidad de vida, además de colaborar económicamente con su familia.
Yeudy es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Cartagena, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y está muy feliz porque encontró una excelente forma de financiamiento para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Yeudy is a young entrepreneur of 34.  He lives with his family in a community called Cartagena, in Guanacaste province.  This province's economy is based mainly on livestock raising, though beekeeping and aquaculture are also common.

Yeudy is a disabled person who is only able to get about in a wheelchair because he does not have any movement in his legs.  He has a small grocery store which is his only source of income.  He helps his family financially and covers his own financial needs through this business.

Yeudy is requesting a loan for 600,000 colones to buy products so that he can further stock his grocery store.  He would like, in this way, to improve his business and his quality of life.  He would also like to contribute financially toward his family.

Yeudy is a member of the Cartagena Community Loan Company, one of EDESA's 150 member organizations in Costa Rica.  He is very happy because he has found an excellent way of obtaining financing so that he can grow his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is 52 years old and living together with her family in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a local farmer who grows rice crops along with her husband for generating income. Keo has been blessed with eight children, three of whom have started their new families, living separately around the province. And currently, one of Keo’s daughter works for a shoes factory in Phnom Penh city to help the family.

Keo is looking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to add to her capital to buy a plot of land with a house for personal living of the family. Keo is very happy that HKL can help provide the loan to her family while she is in need. This is her first loan with HKL. She is confident to pay her loan back regularly and punctually.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land and a house for the family's use.

loans.name: Mubeena's Group

texts.en:
Mubeena is a 43-years old married woman. She has three children: two sons and one daughter. Only her eldest son is getting education while others are too young to attend to school.  

She herself owns and operates a sewing business. Her work is home based which she does to supplement the income of her family. Mubeena’s husband is a teacher and he teaches students. 

Mubeena has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. She will invest the loan in buying clothes, thread and scissors which enable her to sew clothes with good quality. She is hopeful that her sewing business will be improved a lot after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy clothes, thread and scissors for a sewing business.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon, 60, has spent most of her lifetime dedicated to rice husbandry, from which she is able to make a proper living for her family, consisting of four children. Chuon has been in this business for 12 years. She is very a hard working mother, who works tirelessly in the field because she wants to provide education to school age children. To share responsibilities for the family, Chuon's husband produces and sells smoking tobacco for profit.

Chuon would like to take out a loan from HKL and Kiva to add to her capital to pay house construction costs. With the leftover amount, she will buy a used motorcycle for home use as well as for the family’s businesses. For her future prospects, she hopes to save money to for the family's emergencies and for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for house construction costs.

loans.name: Luatasi

texts.en: Luatasi is a 36-year-old woman who is married with a large family. She runs a business making elei (Samoan hand printed fabric) in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Luatasi has requested a loan to buy items such as paints, brushes, design boards, fabrics, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD two years ago to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy items such as paints, brushes, design boards, fabric, etc

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat is 28 years old and married to a widower, living in Reussey Keo district, a suburb area of Phnom Penh. She is responsible for four children. Two among them are her step daughters who currently work for a garment factory and get their salary monthly to share with the family to cover the living needs. She is hard-working and always looking after the welfare for her family. She is in the business of rice farming.

Sat is experiencing financial difficulties pertaining to the renovation her house. Sat is requesting her second loan from HKL for $300, which she will use to purchase construction supplies and pay for the laborers. She hopes to have a comfortable shelter through using this loan. She is confident that she will be able to repay her loan to our lenders punctually.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies and pay for the laborers.

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en: Fenumiai is 65 years old and a widow with 12 children. She owns and operates a small store selling items such as mats, fabrics, jewelry, etc. She has been doing this for five years. Fenumiai needs a loan of $2500 to buy more items for consumer's needs and wants such as jewelry, mats, etc. She hopes to use her profits to improve and expand the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Tuuloto

texts.en:
Tuuloto is a 27-year-old married woman with one child. 

She has a small plantation and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Tuuloto has requested a loan to buy farming tools and pay for her child's school fees.
 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Tuuloto hopes to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy farming tools/chemicals as well as using for kids education

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en: Ioana is 30 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling pork buns in her community and has been doing this for five years. Ioana has requested a loan of $2450 to buy timbers, sand, cement, etc to renovate her home. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ioana will expand the business.

loans.use: to renovate her home

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Virgie requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit stove. 

She is getting the envirofit stove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Virgie is aware that by using the envirofit stove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an envirofit cook stove.

loans.name: Fhevie

texts.en:
This is Fhevie, 45, resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Willie, a driver, and is the mother of two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Fhevie operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Aside from this she also raises pigs in her compound. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 18,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan in her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Fhevie hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap materials she needs in her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a retail peanut business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years.

Jocelyn has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of peanuts to sell.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
This is Maricel, 35, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, her business partner. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maricel maintains a direct selling business and a stall in the mall. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers count on as their income. She also operate a stall in the mall were she also sell her merchandise items.Her regular customers are mall goers,her neighbors and the local community.She earns a minimum of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maricel, hopes to grow her business and increase her clients in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a fingerlings retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Lydia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more fingerlings(young fish) to sell.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fingerlings (young fish) to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Tiny

texts.en:
Ma. Tiny works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari (general) store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Tiny requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store like shampoo, canned goods, detergent and other miscellaneous items.

She has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Ma. Tiny would like to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store like shampoo, canned goods, detergent and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Cruz Esperanza

texts.es:
Cruz  es una mujer que tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera, además cuenta con 03 hijos que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería, artesanía y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados al comercio. Cruz vive en casa propia en el caserío San Martín del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 120 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Cruz es la  venta de productos Naturales , este pequeño negocio la tiene instalada en su propio domicilio, donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidelizados; así mismo también esta dedicada a la  crianza de aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio y lo comercializa en el mercado local de su caserío; sin embargo se menciona que ella también es profesora nombrada en la zona donde le permite tener ingresos adicionales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Cruz cuenta con 7 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en ambos negocios. Su  cónyuge lo apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Cruz se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial (pequeño negocio) y a la crianza, engorde y venta de aves de corral, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 3000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de mercadería (productos naturales), adquisición de 02 mostradores; y así mismo realizar mejoras en su domicilio; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Cruz is a 36-year-old woman.  She is single and has three children in her care.  She lives with her husband and children in her own home.  Cruz mentions that the quality of life in her community is one of subsistence.  Most of the residents are self-employed people who farm, raise livestock, make handicrafts and raise small animals.  Some of them also work in commerce.  Cruz lives in her own home in the small village of San Martín, in Tambogrande province, in Piura department.  The only basic service she receives is electricity.  She says that approximately 120 families live in this community in these conditions.

Cruz' business activity is selling natural products.  Her small business is located in her home and this is where she serves her loyal customers.  She also raises farmyard birds in pens outside her home.  She sells the animals in the local market in her village.  However, she mentions that she is also a tenured teacher in her area which makes her additional income.  We should point out that Cruz has seven years experience.  This has allowed her to gain an established customer base in both of her businesses.  Her husband supports her a lot in her business activities.  They have a good family relationship.

Cruz currently plans to expand the inventory of her small sales business and also her business raising, fattening and selling farmyard birds because this is a very profitable activity in her area.  She is requesting this new loan for 3,000 soles to invest in buying merchandise (natural products) and two counters.  She will also make some improvements to her home.  This will allow her to continue improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (natural products), buy counters and make some improvements to her home

loans.name: Merry Cris

texts.en:
Merry Cris is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Merry Cris has a pigpen and she sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to buy animal feeds for the pigs like hog grower, hog starter and hog finisher.

Merry Cris has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Merry Cris hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds like hog grower, hog starter and hog finisher

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.

Rosalia has a a unit of multi cab used to transport passengers from their village to downtown  where his husband is the driver.. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy tools for repair and maintenance of the multi cab and also for  the payment of gasoline consumption.

Rosalia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children and for the family needs.

loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance and to pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Christine est une jeune femme agée de 35 ans, célibataire, mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 1 à 7 ans et d'entre eux vont déjà à l'école. Elle vend les fruits et légumes dans un marché de la place depuis 15 ans déjà. Son activité fonctionne à merveille, elle a conquis sa clientèle au fil des années, mais manque le souvant de capital pour la satisfaire parce qu'elle achète des marchandises tout le tremps  en petite quantité. grace à ce crédit, elle augmentera son capital et son stock de vivres et légumes et le bénéfice lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants dont elle a la charge, il lui permettra aussi avec le temps d'agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Christine is a young 35-year-old single mother of four children aged 1 to 7, some of whom attend school. She has been selling fruits and vegetables at the local market for the past 15 years. Her business is booming, as she has won over her customers year after year. However, she is often short on capital to meet customer demand because she always buys her merchandise in small quantities. 

This loan will allow her to increase her working capital and replenish her stock of merchandise, and the profits earned will help to support herself and her children. Over time, she also expects to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ankadignongne Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Ankadignongne  sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames, ont  en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes le village de Zenguela dans la commune rurale de Sakoïba, région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente du lait, du mil,  des condiments et du sucre. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe décident de collaborer avec  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame, Penda (femme debout au milieu sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de céréales dans le village de Zenguela. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de mil à la foire de Gassola. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, à domicile, au village. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Penda  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17 500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et épargner.
texts.en:
The seven women who belong to the Ankadignongne group are married and live mainly in monogamous families.  They have an average age of 36 and have, on average, three children each.  They all live in the village of Zenguela, in the rural district of Sakoïba, in Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali).  They know each other through neighborhood ties, kinship and marriage.  They buy and sell milk, millet, seasonings and sugar.

With the aim of increasing their business capital, the group's members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso.  This is their first group loan.

Penda (the lady standing in the middle of the photo) is a cereal seller in the village of Zenguela.  She plans to use her loan to buy three sacks of millet at Gassola market.  She will re-sell the produce for cash and on credit to a customer base of both men and women.  She will deliver her produce to customers' homes and also sell it in the village.  Penda hopes to make an average monthly profit of 17,500 CFA francs, some of which she will re-invest in her business and some of which she will save.

loans.use: to buy millet

loans.name: Dulguun

texts.en:
Dulguun is 24 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband works as a flight attendant. 

Dulguun started her construction materials retailing business in early 2010. Her location is excellent and her sales are stable. Even though she's fairly new to the business, she has gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. 

Now that construction season is approaching, her product demand will increase. Therefore, she needs to be ready in order to increase her profits. She's requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more construction supplies. 

Dulguun is a sharp and hardworking woman. "Due to my lack of experience, I almost became bankrupt last year," she says. "I won't let it happen again."

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies for her business.

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi lives in the coastal town of Malindi in Kenya. She is a single mother of one child. She runs a food stall, which she has been operating for the last 10 months. She obtained start-up capital from the informal savings scheme commonly referred to as a "merry-go-round," a process where a number of people pool contributions and lend to each person in rounds.

Mapenzi is applying for a loan of 10,650 KES to purchase cooking and serving utensils as well as foodstuffs for her business. The challenges she faces in her current business are a lack of constant clients and price fluctuations.

Her ambition is to own a restaurant that is well-stocked with all the necessary items. She will save the extra income from this loan so she can work toward achieving this goal.

loans.use: To buy cooking and serving utensils as well as foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Las Manzanas Group

texts.en:
Ten very cheerful women belong to Las Manzanas Trust Bank, which is located in the small community of Panimá, Totonicapan, Guatemala. Totonicapán is one of the leading producers of crafts in Guatemala. Crafts are in high demand because of the quality and uniqueness of the products. 

Las Manzanas Trust Bank is in its sixth loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and is composed of some original members and a few new recruits. The women welcome all visitors to their community with the following words: "Totonicapán – land of apples, and pines, and beautiful women."

One of the group members, who is as enthusiastic as all of her Trust Bank members combined, is Santos. Named after holy week in Guatemala -- because that was when she was born -- Santos is 62 years old and has nine children. 

Santos purchases plain, raw yarn and then makes her own dyes to create a variety of colored yarn, which she then sells. She started her business 24 years ago after learning the trade from her husband’s family. Santos then taught her children the technique, so now they also participate in the business. 

Santos is planning to use her new micro-loan to buy raw materials in bulk because the price is much better in bulk, and demand for her products is growing. In fact, one customer, who lives three and a half hours away, is requesting to have orders delivered every 15 days. Santos is thrilled with how well her business is going and now regularly employs three people. She hopes that if she continues to grow her business, she will be able to hire more employees.  

Santos is very thankful to all the KIVA lenders for giving her the opportunity to improve her business, which not only helps her but also benefits her children. Las Manzanas Trust Bank is grateful to the KIVA investors for the loans. Thanks to the financial "hand up," the Trust Bank members can move forward with their businesses even in tough economic times.

loans.use: To buy raw materials in bulk.

loans.name: Choqui Group

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking woman who is always looking for ways to improve her and her family’s quality of life. Josefina is 38 years old and has been married for 22 years. She has eight children (six girls and two boys), four of whom are currently in school. 

With only two years of formal education, Josefina created a textile business that produces typical skirts made with a foot loom.  The business has been around for nearly a decade. She and her family spend at least six days a week working to complete their orders, and Josefina travels one and a half hours via bus once a week to deliver the orders to clients. 

Josefina is starting her third loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. Her daughter, Maria, has also joined Josefina’s Trust Bank for her first loan cycle. Maria is completing her teaching degree while building up her small business. 

Josefina is very excited about her new loan with Friendship Bridge because she will be able to purchase a variety of yarn and thread for her textile business. Josefina's vision is to grow her business enough so that she does not need to take out loans in the future. Josefina also wants her children to stay in school and continue their studies in college. She was not able to continue with her schooling because her family needed her to work. “Before I joined Friendship Bridge, I did think that my girls' education was important, but now I know that they need to stay in school,” she says.  “By staying in school, they will be able to increase their knowledge and be more successful.” 

Josefina, Maria and 12 other women are part of the Choqui Trust Bank. The Trust Bank members are all from the village of Chipuac, a fairly rural area outside of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Many of the women in the Choqui Trust Bank have animal husbandry businesses, such as raising chickens, while several other members are involved in the textile industry. Each member of the Trust Bank has a different story but they all share a common vision: to be successful and to improve their lives and the lives of their families and community members. The 14 women appreciate the moral and financial support KIVA lenders provide, and they are impressed that technology can unite people from around the world with Totonicapán’s communities.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of yarn and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente est  membre du groupe Tuungane, âgée de 32 ans, jeune veuve, mère de 2 enfants, son mari est décédé suite à une courte maladie circonstancielle. Tous ses enfants étudient à l’école primaire.  Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce le petit commerce  d’habillement et articles divers. Elle a commence avec ses fonds propre reçu de son mari avant sa mort. Elle expose ses marchandises dans le marché central de Virunga. Ce nouveau crédit va lui permettre d’augmenter  son chiffre d’affaire en achetant  4 douzaines d’habits juniors et 6 pantalons, 6 chemises pour adultes, 10 jupes, robes, etc. Le grand obstacle est qu’elle vend parfois en crédit  et que certains clients ne lui payent pas ou parfois payent avec retard. En plus, elle est souvent victime de pillage au long de la route. Elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et préparer leur avenir meilleur. La cliente remercie  Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client is a member of the group Tuungane. She is a young 32-year-old widow and mother of two children. Her husband died following a brief illness. Both children go to primary school. She has been working in small trade for five years selling clothing and various items. She started this activity using capital given by her husband before he died. She displays her merchandise at the central market of Virunga. 

This new loan will allow her to bolster her sales by purchasing 4 dozen children’s outfits, 6 pairs of pants, 6 adult shirts, 10 skirts, a few dresses, etc. 
Her main hurdle is that she sometimes sells on credit, and some customers pay late or not at all. She also gets robbed on the road fairly often. 

She wants to see her children grow up and ensure a better future for them. She wishes to thank Hekima for its efforts to help poor women who don’t have access to traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy 4 dozen children’s outfits, 6 pairs of pants, 6 adult shirts, 10 skirts, a few dresses, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Yiriwaton Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes du groupe Yiriwaton sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont  en moyenne 49 ans et 6 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes le village de Zenguela dans la commune rurale de Sakoïba et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente des condiments, du bois de chauffe, des mortiers de la pâte d’arachide, des allumettes etc. 
Dans le but de satisfaire leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses, elles adhèrent à Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame, Fatoumata (2ème femme assise sur la photo de la droite vers la gauche) est une grande vendeuse de  pâte d’arachide  dans le village de Zenguela et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 142 kg d’arachide à la foire de Gassola pour les transformer en pâte. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments. A l’image des autres femmes du groupe, elle a pour objectif de consolider son activité génératrice de revenu dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
NB : Pour des raisons sociales, Djeneba Ganasse et Kadia               Tangara    sont  absentes de la photo de groupe.
texts.en:
The 10 women who make up the Yiriwaton group are mostly married and live in monogamous families. They have an average age of 49, and have an average of six children each. All of the women live in the village of Zenguela in the rural area of Sakoïba, and are either relatives, neighbors or related through marriage. They buy and sell seasonings, firewood, mortars for making peanut paste, matches, etc.
To satisfy the needs of their growing customer base, the women have joined Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan.
Fatoumata (the second woman seated from right to left in the photo) is a successful peanut paste seller in the village of Zenguela and the surrounding area. She plans to use her loan to purchase 142 kg of peanuts at Gassola market, which she will grind to make paste. She sells her products on a cash and credit basis to customers who are both male and female. With the loan, Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which she plans to reinvest in her business and meet her family’s needs for seasoning. Just like the other women in the group, Fatoumata plans to consolidate her business through her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.
NB: For social reasons, two of the women from the group are absent from the photo.

loans.use: To buy peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente est membre du groupe de crédit  Ephata, jeune femme  dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 22 ans, sans enfant, nouvellement mariée. Elle est  vendeuse dans sa propre quincaillerie. Elle s’entraide avec son mari qui est quincailleur. Avant de se marier, elle fut initiée par son père qui est aussi quincailleur. Ainsi, donc, cette cliente maitrise parfaitement ce secteur de matériaux de construction et ferraillerie, car elle a grandi dans sa famille biologique au dépend de ce commerce. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  4eme  crédit.  Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  un lot de matériels électriques.  En plus, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle dans le futur entant donné qu’ils sont encore de nouveaux mariés. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en: The client is a member of the Ephata loan group.  She is a dynamic young entrepreneur who is 22 years old, newly married, and doesn't have any children.  She works in her own hardware business, helping her husband who is a hardware dealer.  Before she got married, she learned the trade from her father who is in the same business, therefore this client is an expert in the field of selling building supplies and hardware.  She grew up in her biological family depending on this business.  The profits she makes from her business help her to save and buy food.  She is taking out her fourth loan.  Over the course of her previous loans, the client has seen her business thrive.  For this reason, she decided to increase her loan amount this time round.  She will use this new loan to stock up with electrical supplies.  In addition, she hopes to buy a plot of land in the future as she and her husband are still newly weds.  The client thanks Hekima for empowering poor women with low incomes.  We feel we should point out that [in the photo] some clients are holding their babies.

loans.use: to buy a batch of electrical supplies

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Bougoufié de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Château Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habillements (brodés, bazins,) des boissons (eau et jus), du lait en poudre et des miches de pain. 
Dans le but de satisfaire les besoins de la clientèle de plus en plus croissante, les membres du groupe ont connu intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (1ère femme assise sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est connue à Bougoufié et dans le marché Château Ségou pour la vente d’une bonne qualité de pain. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 000 baguettes de pain à la boulangerie. La revente se fait en détail au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché Château Ségou en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Fatoumata compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité, épargner et se ravitailler de temps en temps en denrées de première nécessité.
texts.en:
The five women who make up the Benkadi group are mostly married in monogamous families, with an average age of 39 and an average of four children. They all live in the Bougoufié neighborhood of Ségou (the fourth-largest administrative region in Mali), and know each other because they are family or related through marriage, or through their work in the Château Ségou market. The members of the group sell clothing (embroidered fabric, damask, etc.), drinks (water and juice), powdered milk and bread rolls.
To satisfy the needs of their growing customer base, the women joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third group loan.
Fatoumata (the first woman seated from left to right in the photo) is known in Bougoufié and Château Ségou market for the high quality bread she sells. She plans to use her loan to buy 1,000 baguettes from the bakery. She sells her produce on a cash and retail basis at home and in the Château Ségou market to a mixed clientele. Fatoumata hopes that the loan will allow her to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which she plans to reinvest in her business, increase her savings and purchase supplies of staple foodstuffs from time to time.

loans.use: To buy baguettes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, conseillère du groupe de crédit  Tuimizane, Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 33 ans, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuse des  souliers au marché urbain de CADECO. Son mari est actuellement chômeur. Elle commença son business vers les années 2000 avec de fonds propres reçu de son mari. Elle fut initiée par ses pairs de lors qu’elle s’installa dans la ville de Goma.  Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité pour ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  8eme  cycle de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Grâce aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé l’achat de la parcelle. Ainsi, elle a décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  30 paires de souliers.  En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir en douceur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: The client, who leads the Tuimizane group, is a dynamic entrepreneur. She is 33 years of age, and is a mother to seven children who are all at school. She sells shoes in the Cadeco town market, and her husband is currently unemployed. She started her business in approximately the year 2000, with funds she received from her husband, and was introduced to the business by her peers when she moved to the town of Goma. She uses the money she earns for savings, food and her children’s education. She has just obtained her eighth loan. Since she started her business it has grown, and thanks to her loans from Hekima, she has bought a plot of land. She has decided to increase her loan amount for this new loan cycle, and plans to use the money to buy 30 pairs of shoes. She also hopes to see her children grow up in comfort. She would like to thank Hekima for helping poor women with low incomes to become autonomous.

loans.use: to buy 30 pairs of shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Las Positivas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Positivas” es un grupo conformado por 08 socios responsables y comprometidos con el Programa- Prosperidad siendo Marisol una de los integrantes. Marisol tiene 36 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a  03 de ellos. Marisol se dedica a la elaboración de postres como pasteles, empanadas, queques, etc. la cual trabaja sobre pedidos.  Ella comenzó trabajando con un familiar en una panadería, pues con los conocimientos que adquirió decide emprender su propio negocio. Aparte trabaja brindando servicios domésticos. Gracias a su trabajo y dedicación Marisol ha podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su objetivo a futuro es de poner su propia panadería donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. Con el crédito que solicito va a comprar insumos como harina, azúcar, leche y moldes para su negocio. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Positivas” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Marisol está ubicada al lado derecho, es la primera  viste polo color plomo con rayas negras y pantalón blanco.
texts.en: The 'Las Positivas' community bank has eight responsible and committed members who are working within the Prosperity Program.  Marisol is one of the members of this group.  She is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has four children.  She is currently still supporting three of her children.  Marisol's business is making desserts such as pies, empanadas, cakes, etc. to order.  She started out working with a family member in a bakery and decided to use the knowledge that she gained to start her own business.  She also works providing domestic services.  Thanks to her work and dedication, Marisol has been able to help her husband with their household expenses.  Her goal for the future is to set up her own bakery where she can sell her products.  She will use the loan that she has requested to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, milk and molds for her business.  The 'Las Positivas' community bank are grateful for the loan that they are receiving and pledge to continue working well.  [In the photo], Marisol is the person on the far right.  she is wearing a gray top with black stripes, and white pants.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk and molds

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
With 25 years of experience in business, Teresa moved to the greater Boston area from Ecuador in 1999 with a wealth of experience and a passion to start her own business. 

When she first arrived in the United States, Teresa knew very little English; however she did not let this hold her back. She started her own daycare business that operated out of her home and began forming a dedicated clientele. Soon she became very well known throughout the area and began to grow her business. She now has the ability to employ three employees to help her operate at a larger capacity. 

Her client, Ana, states, “I left my son in Teresa’s care when he was just three months. Every day when I dropped him off, I had a feeling of ease knowing that my son would be nurtured and cared for. I had a deep level of trust for Teresa and her employees that never faltered. My son, who is now four and in pre-school, continues to visit Teresa to receive hugs and exchange smiles.” 

Teresa is a repeat Accion borrower and is once again asking for a loan to help maintain continuous cash flow through her business during the slower months of June through August. During this time many of her clients take their children out of daycare to attend summer camps or family vacations. This loan would help Teresa uphold the commitment she has made to her employees.

loans.use: to support her business through the slower summer months.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 60 years of age and is blessed with three adult children. She lives with one of her children because she is separated from her husband due to family conflicts and problems. Despite this, she has the determination to uplift their status of living and support her children to give them a better life. She involves herself in raising hogs to generate income. She has been in this business for almost 15 years and usually earns a profits of PHP 12,000 a month that she uses for their daily consumption and to save for future emergencies. 

She plans to acquire additional piglets to raise and sell in the future, but having inadequate capital, she wants to ask for an additional PHP 40,000 to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise.

Being a hardworking mother, she believes that she can improve the business and become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel  es un hombre  que tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, además  cuenta con 03 hijos que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Manuel vive en casa propia en el caserío Cerro Teodoro del distrito de Olmos del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica y el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de un pozo artesanal; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 100 familias bajo estas condiciones.
