La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Manuel es el comercio, crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral, ganado porcinos, caprinos y  ovinos, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, cabe destacar que en esta actividad Manuel cuenta con 3 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Su  cónyuge lo apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Manuel se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente al engorge y comercialización de animales menores, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 2,000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la comercializaciòn de màs animales (porcinos,ovinos, caprinos, aves de corral), alimentos balanceados,  y mejoramiento de corrales de sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 39-year-old man.  He lives with his partner and has three children in his care.  He lives with his partner and children in his own home.  He tells us that the quality of life in his community is one of subsistence.  Most of the residents are self-employed people who work in commerce and raise livestock.  Some also work in agriculture.  Manuel lives in his own home in the small village of Cerro Teodoro, in Olmos district, in Lambayeque department.  The only basic service he receives is electricity.  He gets his drinking water from an artesian well.  He says that there are approximately 100 families who live in the same conditions in his village.

Manuel's business activity is raising, fattening and selling animals such as farmyard birds, pigs, goats and sheep.  He raises these animals in pens outside his home.  He tells us that he sells the animals either in the local market or to animal wholesalers.  We should point out that Manuel has three years experience in this business.  This means that he already has an established customer base.  His partner supports him in his activities.  They have a good family relationship.

Manuel currently plans to expand the inventory of his livestock business because this is a very profitable business in his area.  He is requesting a new loan for 2,000 soles to buy more animals (pigs, sheep, goats and farmyard birds) and nutritionally-balanced feed.  He will also make improvements to his animal pens.  Over time, this will allow him to continue improving his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animals and fix some animal pens

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima, age 59, is a business woman in the village of Gonzaga. She has been managing her fish and rice retailing for over 14 years because she  realizes that without a source of income she would not be survive. Her business is a great help in improving her life, so she devotes herself to it. 

Recently, she has had high customer demand because her services and products satisfy her customers. Moreover, her humility and honesty bring customers looking for her. The high demand requires her to add more goods, so she is asking additional capital to purchase rice and equipment to  maintain her fishing boats. 

Her husband is very supportive in her business to the extent that he also goes in the river to catch fish. She just hopes that her husband will continue his virtues in order that their seven children will finish all their education. Through their sacrifices and great effort, she hopes for a comfortable living soon.

loans.use: to purchase rice and equipment to maintain her fishing boats.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and has four children. She is 41 and lives in the Philippines. 

Lolita operates a transportation service to earn a living. She's been doing this for two years and every month she earns 3,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

Just this year, Lolita joined GDMPC. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Yaye Diaré

texts.fr: Yaye Diaré est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de quatre enfants dont les trois vont à l'école.Elle tient au marché de sa localité une boutique de vente de tissus et de denrées alimentaires. Elle voyage en Gambie pour s'approvisionner en gros et revend les tissus au détail. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins de femmes mais aussi et surtout de suppléer de temps en temps  son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses alimentaires de la famille. Afin d'effectuer un nouveau voyage, il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en achetant 10 rouleaux de tissus. Son ambition est d'acquérir une nouvelle boutique pour séparer ses deux types de commerce.
texts.en: Yaye Diaré is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. She has a store at the local market where she sells fabric and food products. She travels to The Gambia to buy at wholesale and then sell fabric at retail. This allows her to meet her own needs  but also to occasionally assist her husband in meeting the costs of feeding her family. In order to make another trip to The Gambia, Yaye is asking for a loan of 200,000 francs to increase her working capital by purchasing 10 rolls of fabric. Her goal is to obtain a new store so that she can separate her two businesses.

loans.use: to buy 10 rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Janine April

texts.en:
Janine April is 21 years old and resides at Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has a child.  

Janine April cultivates a banana plantation to earn a living and she's been two years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer. 

Recently, Janine April joined GDMPC. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is from Catadman, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 year old and widowed. To make a living, Teofila owns and operates a transport service, which she has been doing for three years.  She earns 2,000 PHP a month. 

Teofila is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to repair her bicycle and buy accessories. Teofila recently joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her bicycle and buy accessories.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 41 years old and lives in Baligatan province of Isabela. He started this business seven years ago. He studied to be an electrician, which helped him to obtain his own workshop. He achieved this and carries out the role of electrician.

He is married with children and his wife manages their store. He works hard every day with great effort. In the future he longs to make his business bigger. He has difficulty with delinquent payments. With the loan he requested amounting PHP 10,000 he will buy tools and materials.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and materials for his business

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Ganchimeg is a 45-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her children study at the college and secondary school. 

She has been running a garment retail business since 2010. She started the business by trading the livestock she had. Now the business is stable. 

Ganchimeg is a hardworking woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the supplies in large quantities. I have a further plan to save for my children." 

The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy garments to sell.

loans.use: To buy garments.

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en:
Phoeurn is 55 years old. She is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice and fattening pigs for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a village leader who earns about $3 per day. All of her children are employed. They are construction workers and garment workers. They earn about $20 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Phoeurn is requesting a loan of $1,400 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on transportation expenses to support her family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel, aged 40, has a high school education and has suffered quite a lot financially.  He used to be unable to provide the necessities of his family.  But through his ability and industriousness, he has become a good businessman now. He is currently managing to buy and resell fruits and vegetables as a source of income. He is providing a living for his family through this business. He doesn’t want his family to feel the cruelty of life that he experienced before. With inspiration, he has passed through the hardships of life. 


Presently, Manuel is requesting PHP 50,000 as additional capital to further grow his business. This may be a great help in developing his business and can allow him to save funds for the educational purposes of his four children. It will be used to purchase tomatoes, "pechay", cabbage, root crops and cucumbers.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, "pechay", cabbage, root crops and cucumbers

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von is 63 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than three years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband runs motor taxi service. He earns about $3 per day. Her children are employed. They are a garment worker and a motor taxi driver. They earn about $6 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Von is requesting a loan of $1000 to raise the working capital in her business to buy more vegetables to sell. This money will help her expand her business and earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and build a new house next year.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She runs a beauty parlor located in the public market, which she has been doing for 24 years.  She patiently beautifies customers. She enjoys her work and at the same time is earning for her family.  

Evelyn is requesting a loan for 35,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase MSE, Avon, and Natash products, scissors, hair blower, and hair coloring and straightening products. She wants to upgrade her business in order to attract more customers. She knows that providing satisfaction to her customers leads to business improvement. She hopes to improve her business in order to continue earning and saving for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase MSE, Avon, and Natash products, scissors, hair blower, and hair coloring and straightening products.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo, tiene la edad de 65 años, es casado y vive con su esposa. El quiere  comprar  4000 plantas de café e insumos  para Sembrar en  finca de  de su propiedad.   Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer y también desea que su finca sea muy productiva. Es el segundo  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No  ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales o Cooperativas, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El  también tiene el deseo de mejorar su situación económica poniendo a producir más su finca y poder hacer un ahorro para su futuro.
texts.en: Domingo is 65 years old, married, and lives with his wife.  He would like to buy 4,000 coffee plants and supplies  so that he can sow on a plantation that he owns.  He has been working on his plantation for for several years and would like to grow his business.  He would also like his plantation to be very productive.  This is the second loan that Domingo has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received other loans from State banks or co-operatives but FUDECOSUR have given him loans with better terms and much lower interest rates.  He would like to improve his financial situation, produce more on his plantation, and be able to save up for his future.

loans.use: to buy 4,000 coffee plants

loans.name: Kim Leang

texts.en:
Kim Leang is 49 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in agricultural business for more than three years, has an extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up animals. She earns about $9 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed as construction workers. They earn about $12 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Kim Leang is requesting a loan of $1,400 to purchase piglets to breed in order to resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn additional income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her pig farm and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Dioan

texts.en:
Dioan is a widow who has a child. She is 48 years old and resides at Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Dioan owns and operates a coconut production to earn a living, and she's been six years in this business. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Earlier this year, Dioan joined GDMPC. In the future, Dioan wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella, 47, lives with her husband and their two children in their own home. 

She sells a variety of curtains and clothing at their municipal market. Now she wants to add a new source of income and that is to sell fish, specifically, tilapia. This causes Bella to request a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy curtains, clothing and equipment to build her store for selling fish. 

She hopes that her dream business will become true in order to gain higher income and save for her family. She knows that with her kindness and humbleness she can build a good business, and she knows that success comes from putting in great effort and dedication and that those are her best tools to get ahead in her occupation.

loans.use: to buy curtains, clothing and equipment to build a store for selling fish.

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en:
Noeurn is 42 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than 10 years, earning approximately $3 per day. One of her children is employed in a factory. She earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Noeurn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to resell. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her grocery store and help her youngest son to earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 50 years old. She is a mother who has a great ambition to provide for her family and she was gifted with one child. Julia lives happily with her family in a rural community planting and harvesting rice and vegetables to sell. Because of the high cost of commodities and school fees, she is also involved in hog-raising to generate additional income. 

Julia is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She believes that her loan will enable her to improve her business and increase her profits to support the education of her child who is now at the college level. Julia hopes she will be successful in working out her plan.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and piglets to raise

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema is 32 years old and married with two children. For the past ten years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables at the public market. Rema earns about 5,000 PHP each month and her income goes for meals and school expenses. She hopes to improve her sales but needs additional capital. 

Rema is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy bananas, cabbages, beans, and potatoes to sell. Her loan will help increase her sales capacity and boost up her profits, too. Someday, with enough savings, she will be able to send her children to college to earn their degrees.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cabbages, beans, and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 59 years old, married and has three children. She sells various home products such as soaps and fire extinguishers to earn an income. She has been selling them for over five years now and earns about P5,000 each month. She would like to sell more merchandise so she is now asking for a loan of P12,000 to buy more soap, fabric conditioners and fire extinguishers to sell. 

Someday, she hopes to diversify her business so she can keep generating good profits from it. She also hopes to establish a small retail store to earn consistent profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy soap, fabric conditioners and fire extinguishers to sell

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is 32, married and has one school-aged child. He aims to improve and strengthen his business to make it a viable source of income AND satisfy his family needs. He is engaged in snack vending and hog-raising businesses to generate income. He has been in this business for almost eight years earning a profit of Php 10,000 a month that he usually spends for their food, clothing and allowances for his child in school.

To increase his income, Cirilo planned to acquire more piglets to raise but due to insufficient capital, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He believes that this loan will help him  improve the business and hopes that he will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is from Bagumbayan and sells cosmetics to her neighbors and friends. Claire is 31 years old and has three children. She is still pursuing her college education while her three children are in elementary school. Though she is married already, she still wants to finish a degree to have a better employment someday. She is now asking for a loan of P14,000 to buy perfumes, cosmetics, beauty soaps and lotions to sell. This will help increase sales and profits from the business and she will be able to pay other expenses in school. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics, beauty soaps and lotions to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a responsible mother who is engaged in selling grocery items to the people in their village. She is a single mother and carries the burden alone in providing for the needs of her child. She had been running her store for almost five years. She is now asking for a loan of P8,000  to buy canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits and eggs to sell.

She is very happy meeting her customers' demand for the affordable prices she offers.  Someday, she hopes to make her business more profitable to achieve the desired improvement in her family life. She also hopes to provide the best education for her child.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits and eggs to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is requesting another 20,000 KES Kiva loan to purchase supplies and increase her business stock as she anticipates an increase in demand of goods. Since her previous loan, Mary's income has doubled and she has been able to increase her stock. 

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase supplies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 70,000 to boost her existing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase M-pesa money float on M-pesa mobile money transfer.  The previous loan enabled her to increase her profits and open a new business of selling second-hand clothes. Susan aspires to open a boutique in future. Since her last loan, her living standards have really improved, through enough food supply to the family and good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase  money float for M-pesa mobile money transfer.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 32 years old, comes from Nakuru, and is married to Dishon. They have three children who are all in school.

Beatrice is a tailor and has been in this business for the past four years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more fabrics and textiles for making clothes. Beatrice has a great demand from her clients and she wants to be able to meet those demands.

She hopes to buy a plot of land in the near future and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and textiles

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a farmer besides owning a grocery store.

This  is her fourth loan from  KADET LTD. She repaid her previous loans well and in good time. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting on her farm.

She hopes to expand her farming to enable her to see her children through their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and comes from Nakuru. He is married and a father of one child who is four years old and in preparatory school.

Samuel has a business selling bread which he has been doing for the past five years and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, to enable him to buy more bread and be able to supply it to his clients and meet their demand.

He hopes to open a distribution store in a neighboring town.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
To generate additional income, Juanito is involved in a hog-raising business in their community. He is 48 years old and a father of three. Being a father, he is responsible to educate his children and give them a better life. Despite financial difficulty, he has the determination to continue sending his children to school and he provides their daily needs. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and usually earns an income of Ph10,000 a month that he utilizes for the daily consumption and allowances of his children. 

He plans to strengthen his hog-raising business and to make it a viable source of income. He is asking for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising. He hopes that someday, he will improve their standard of living and their children will have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising

loans.name: Majd

texts.en:
Majd is a 21-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan, and a mother of one child.
Majd sells blankets and is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to purchase more blankets for trading purposes. She is looking to improve her income and her family's living conditions.
As Majd is under 30 years old her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase blankets for trading purposes.

loans.name: Narjes

texts.en:
Narjes is a 30-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, and a mother of two children. She sells cosmetics, and sometimes clothes, and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase new quantities of cosmetics and clothes for trading purposes.

Narjes is looking to establish a store for her business and insure her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Sana'a

texts.en:
Sana'a is a conservative woman, so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.
Sana'a is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to buy groceries for her mini market.
Sana'a is a 29-year-old married woman; she lives in Al Aqaba, Jordan. Sana'a is under 30 years old so her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her mini-market

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old single guy. He is a brother for five boys and one girl.

Ahmad is a university student majoring in accounting in his fourth year. He has applied for this loan to pay for his semester fees so he can graduate and look for a job to support himself and help in the family income.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen is a conservative woman. For that reason, she has asked her husband, for whom she is applying for this loan, to take her place in the photo.

Shireen, 29 years old, is married with two young daughters. 

Shireen works as a librarian in one of the Jordanian universities. Her husband Firas also works there as an electrician. At the same time, Firas is majoring in college business administration and is in his second year. Recently, Firas faced some financial issues that did not allow him to pay for his studies. Shireen decided to help her husband and applied for this loan to pay for his semester fees so he can graduate with a degree and find a new suitable job.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's semester fees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 20 years old, is single. He has five brothers and sisters, all living in the same house with their parent.

Ahmad is a university student majoring in geography.  He has applied for this loan to pay the fees to register for the next semester and continue until graduation.

loans.use: to pay the fees to register for the next semester

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 22 years old and single. He is the eldest among six brothers and sisters.

Ali is a university student majoring in computer information systems. Being the eldest is very hard as he wants to be a good role model for his brothers and sisters.
 
Now Ali has applied for this loan in order to pay for his semester fees so he can graduate, help his parent support the family and get the rest of the family into the university.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Mark Anthony

texts.en:
Mark Anthony lives at Capatan with his spouse and a child. To make a living, he provides a motorcycle transport service to the people in his village. Mark Anthony has been doing this for almost five years. Although he only generates minimal income from his business he is happy to provide this service. 

Mark Anthony is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to buy gasoline, oil, and tires for his motorcycle. He needs to ensure safe travel for his passengers and he needs capital to maintain his vehicle. Someday, Mark Anthony would like to start up a small hog raising business to provide an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy oil, gasoline, and tires for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a 45-year-old married man with six children living in Bundibugyo,Uganda. He deals in cocoa sales and his business has been very lucrative. Ezekiel’s business challenges include customers not paying on time and the seasonal nature of his product.

Ezekiel is requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell. His personal goal is to build a permanent commercial house in town and expand his business into new areas.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Nanci

texts.en:
Nanci is a conservative woman, so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Nanci is a 27-year-old married woman, a mother of 4 children. She lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.

Nanci is looking to have a loan of 500 JDs so she can buy new furniture for her house. Nanci is under  30 years old so her loan is considered a  youth loan.

loans.use: to improve living conditions in her house

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en:
Ghadeer is a 24-year-old married woman, a mother of 2 children, and she lives in Al Zarqa, Jordan.

Ghadeer is looking to have a loan of 400 JDs so she can purchase clothes and sell them to people so she can continue her university studies.

Ghadeer is under 30 years of age so her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and sell them

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam, 26 years old, is single and still living with her parent.
 
Tamam has recently opened a gift shop. She included in the shop accessories, body spa products and some perfumes. 

Now Tamam wants to add more  gifts, toys and accessories to the store to increase her revenue. For that reason,she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to add more gift items, toys and accessories to the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more gas canisters to increase his revenue.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 22-year-old single man who lives in Ibb, Yemen. His educational background is secondary school. 

He started his business because it was a good way to make money. He needs to provide for his family. He has been selling perfumes, cosmetics and also shoes to make extra money for four years. He was helped by his father and also has taken a previous loan from AMB. 

He likes his work and it has gone well. He requests a youth loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy handbags, perfumes, cosmetics, etc., in order to continue increasing his income. In the future, he would like to have a bigger business, buy a car and get married.

loans.use: to buy handbags, perfumes and cosmetics for his business.

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en:
Hadeel is a 21-year-old single lady with one younger sister and two brothers. 

Hadeel is a university student who is eager to graduate and get herself in the busy working life by obtaining a suitable job. 

She has applied now for this loan in order to pay for her semester fees and start preparing for her graduation papers.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Hasnaa

texts.en:
Hasnaa is a 21-year-old married lady. Her husband works as a plumber and they have one baby daughter.

Hasnaa decided to turn her hobby into a small business that brings her revenue. She started making and selling her handmade crafts like baskets, decorated mirrors and trays, and other decoration pieces.
 
Now she has applied for a youth loan to buy more material and beads to start making new crafts.

loans.use: to buy more material and beads.

loans.name: Tasneem

texts.en:
Tasneem is a 23-year-old single woman. She is part of of a seven-member family.
Tasneem enrolled in a nursing college as she finds joy in helping sick people. She has now applied for this loan so she can pay and prepare for her graduation semesters.

loans.use: pay and prepare for her graduation semesters.

loans.name: Shefa

texts.en:
Shefa is a 45-year-old married woman, who has two sons and two daughters. Her husband has recently retired from the military.
To support the family, Shefa works on farms. As she was not able to finish school, Shefa wants to make sure that all of her children attend school and even gain higher degrees. Now that her eldest is preparing to enter university, Shefa has decided to apply for this loan to pay his registration fees. She will also use some of the money to pay her other children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay her son's registration fees.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 21-year-old single woman. She has five sisters and two brothers, who all live together with their parents. Her father supports the family from his retirement salary, with the help of her mother who works as a tailor.
Malak is a university student majoring in finance and banking. It is very hard for her parents supporting the whole family financially, so Malak is trying hard to graduate as soon as possible to start working so she can help to support the family. She has applied for this loan to pay her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees.

loans.name: Asem

texts.en:
Asem is a 22-year-old single man. He is the oldest among his three brothers. 
Asem is a university student majoring in health studies. He has applied for this loan to pay his semester fees. He hopes to graduate as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 21-year-old single woman. She has a younger sister, and they both live in a rented house with their parent.
Maryam is attending a private university to study graphic design. She has applied for this loan to pay her semester fees so she can continue until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees.

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy is 19 years old and a married woman. A mother of one child, she lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.

Sandy is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her father.

Sandy is looking to have a loan of 600 JDs so she can improve her home living conditions to be more healthy and she want to buy some new furniture.

Sandy is under 30 years old so her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to fix up her home and buy furniture

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en:
Tahani is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Tahani is 18 years old and a married woman; she lives in Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan.

Tahani is looking to have a loan of 600 JDs so she can improve her home living conditions and make her house more healthy. Tahani is under 30 years old thus her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to fix up her house and improve her home living conditions

loans.name: Majdaleen

texts.en:
Majdleen is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Majdleen is 25 years old and a married woman. A mother of one child, she lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Majdleen is looking to have a loan of 400 JDs so she can increase her income by buying raw materials for straw handicrafts. Majdleen is under 30 years old so her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for weaving straw crafts

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 24-year-old single man. He is the only brother to six sisters who are all living with their mother. Their father passed away.

To be able to register himself at the university, Omar had to look for a job that could support him and pay for his university fees. He found a job in a café making and serving coffee in the afternoon. During the day, Omar is attending the university to study economics in hopes that after graduation he can find a suitable professional job to support his sisters and mom.

Now, Omar has applied for this loan so he can pay for his semester fees to get a Bachelor's degree in economics.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a conservative person, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Rawan is a 24-year-old married lady; she has one daughter. Her husband Ali serves in the military.

Rawan has a small retail business. She buys and sells home decoration items such as frames, centerpieces, and straw decoration pieces. Now Rawan has applied for a youth loan in order to bring in new decorations such as vases to sell.

loans.use: to bring in new decorations such as vases to sell.

loans.name: Om Kream Group

texts.en:
This group is called OM KAREM and it consists of four members: Jasmine, Loul, Fndiah and Rawyh. They are all female and live in Aden, Yemen. This group works in different businesses in order to improve their living conditions. They took out a loan of 190,000 YER.

Rawyh is the leader of group and she lives in Aden, Yemen. She is 26 years old.  She has been selling different things as a business for four years. She is married and has five children. She started her business by taking an amount from her husband`s salary then went ahead to operate her business well.  She puts forth a lot of effort to increase her profit so that she can apply it to her family`s needs.

She applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy goods for her business such as clothes, ladies' fabrics and incense, etc. She hopes to expand her business and enroll her children in private schools.

loans.use: to buy goods for her business such as clothes, ladies' fabrics and incense, etc.

loans.name: Nahawand

texts.en:
Nahawand is a 44-year-old conservative mother, and she asked her daughter Walaa to take her place in the photo.

Nahawand is a housewife, married to a civil engineer and they have five sons and daughters. They live in a rented house.

One of their children is Walaa, a 21-year-old single lady who has been admitted to the university to study English literature. Nahawand has applied for this loan to pay her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Thamer

texts.en:
Thamer, 21 years old, is single and has one older brother and two younger sisters. After his father passed away, the responsibilities of the family fell on  Thamer and his brother. So his brother has joined the military and Thamer started working in a supermarket as an accountant.

Besides working, Thamer has registered at a private university to study business administration to find another job after graduation with a better salary. Now Thamer has applied for this loan to pay for his semester fees so he can graduate as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Ohoud

texts.en:
Ohoud, 22 years old, is a married lady. Her husband serves in the military. They have a son and a daughter. 

Ohoud attends the university to study counseling. She has applied for this loan to pay for her semester fees so she can graduate as soon as possible and get a job to help her husband improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada, 22 years old and a single lady, has three brothers and two sisters. Her father has his own business, and her mother is a government employee.

Nada is a university student majoring in computer information systems in her last year. She has applied for this loan so she can pay her semester fees and graduate soon to help the family by getting a good suitable job.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 23 years, and married.

Akram has owned a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3,000 as a “youth loan” in order to purchase refrigerators and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase refrigerators and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, 22, is from Iraq and is married. Since 2008, he has owned a shop repairing and maintaining cars. He has sufficient experience in this field with a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas. Ali is requesting a $1200 loan to purchase an electrical generator. He hopes to gain more profits to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 27, is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is single and lives with three family members, two of whom work.

Since 2009, Ali has owned a computer and photocopying business. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He has applied for $2400 as a “youth loan” to redecorate his shop. He hopes to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 30 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives with five family members, one of whom works.

Amir has owned a coffee shop since 2008, offering fast food and drinks. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He applied for $2200 as a “youth loan” in order to renovate the walls and floors of his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate the walls and floors of his shop.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is a 42-year-old resident of Catadman, Ozamis City. She has six children. For the past three years, she has earned 5,000 PHP monthly running her own barbecue business. Maria Teresa uses her income to supplement her husband’s income. She joined GDMPC his year.

Maria Teresa is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to buy more products such as hot dogs, chicken, and other supplies. In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, chicken, and other ingredients

loans.name: Maushi

texts.en: Maushi is requesting another 25,000 KES loan. She will use this loan to pay school fees for her daughter. Her previous loan increased her monthly income by over 50 percent and improved her family’s living standards. In the future, Maushi dreams of having another motorbike.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Maram

texts.en:
Maram is 28 years old and married with two children. She lives in Baqa'a, Jordan.

Maram is looking to have a loan of 800 JD. She buys and sells blankets and clothes. She hopes to open her own store in the future.

Maram is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan..

loans.use: to buy blankets and clothes to sell

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 27-year-old married man, a father of 2 children. He lives in Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan.

Mohammed is looking to have a loan of 400 JDs so he can buy some furniture for his home. Mohammed is under 30 years old so his loan is considered a  youth loan.

loans.use: to improve living conditions in his house and buy some furniture

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 35-year-old man from Migori who is married to Esther. The couple has three children between two and 10 years old. For the last eight years, John has been baking bricks in his home area. He earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

John is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD to buy a brick-cutting machine. He will use the profits from his loan to pay school fees for his children. In the future, John dreams of improving his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a brick-cutting machine

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is 40 years old and is married to Bernard. She is blessed with five children, ages 18, 20, 22, 24 and 26. For the past eight years, Josphine has been selling clothing and she earns a monthly income of 45,000 KES. 

Josphine is requesting a 40,000 KES loan with KADET to purchase two bales of children’s wear and three bales of ladies trousers and skirts. This will be her second KADET loan. She will use her anticipated profit to help repay her loan and buy more stock for her business. Josphine’s dream is to become a great entrepreneur and give her children the best education possible.

loans.use: to purchase children's wear and women's trousers and skirts to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on internet. The photo is of her son.

Mariam is 50 years old and married. She lives in Irbid, Jordan and is a mother of six children.

Mariam is looking for a loan of 300 JD so she can improve her living conditions by buying and repairing some furniture.

loans.use: to improve her living conditions by buying and repairing some furniture

loans.name: Wardeh

texts.en:
Wardeh is 42 years old and single. She lives in Irbid, Jordan.
Wardeh is a consrvative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her mother.
Wardeh is looking to have a loan of 400 JD so she can purchase raw material to make cheese products.

loans.use: to buy raw material for cheese products

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La Sra. Gregoria  tiene 41 años y es madre soltera con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 15, 12, 8, 1 años, la Sra. Gregoria se dedica a la venta y  elaboración de comida, este  préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Sra. Gregoria utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de insumos, como arroz papa para la elaboración de sus riquísimas comidas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es quiere aprovechar la compra en cantidad de insumos para su negocio, la Sra. Gregoria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el no tener un puestos fijo y  va a utilizar los beneficios de crédito la compra de un puesto fijo en el mercado de su zona, ya que este es su más grande deseo, la Sra. Gregoria es una persona muy trabajadora que con esta actividad saca a sus hijos adelante sola. en la foto esta en compañia de sus hijita de ocho añitos.
texts.en:
Gregoria, age 41, is the single mother of four children, ages 15, 12, 8, and 1.  

Gregoria makes and sells food.  This is her first loan cycle with the institution.  Gregoria will use this loan to buy supplies like rice and potatoes to make her delicious food.  Her reason for requesting this loan is that she wants to take advantage of the benefits of buying supplies for her business in large quantities.

Gregoria faces a challenge in her business; she does not have a fixed sales location.

She will use the profits from the loan to buy a fixed stand at the market in her area.  This is her biggest wish.  

Gregoria is a very hard-working person.  Through this business activity she, alone, gets her children ahead.

She is accompanied in the photo by her eight year old daughter.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice and potatoes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 19 years old and single. He has a retail shop in Nakuru town and has operated it for one year. He sells various items in his shop and it has been very profitable.

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan to buy more stocks of household goods such as plastic jugs and basins, as well as flour, cooking oil, sugar, and rice.

In the future, John hopes to grow his business, open a wholesale shop, earn more income, and hence have a good education and a good family life, too.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of goods such as plastic jugs and basins, flour, cooking oil, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Hiam

texts.en:
Hiam is a conservative woman and she is unwilling to upload her photo on the Internet. The photo is of her father-in-law.

Hiam is 33-year-old married woman who lives in Al Karak, Jordan.

Hiam is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD, so she can buy raw material to make milk products to sell.

loans.use: to buy raw material for milk products to sell

loans.name: Souran

texts.en:
Souran is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has two children.

Souran has owned a shop since 2010, selling women’s perfumes and cosmetics. He has sufficient experience in this field, has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

Souran is requesting a $3,000 loan to extend his shop and to install more shelves. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to extend his shop and to install more shelves.

loans.name: Wazma

texts.en:
Living in an isolated area has given Wazma the courage to start a small food products store. All of her neighbors in the area come to buy from her. They even make some special orders for her to get from the city. This has helped her to know what types of food products they need and will use it to enhance her service. 
 
Her previous loan was used to add variation to her products which allowed her to prepare a small room in the house for expanding the store. Now she has applied for another loan so she can fill the store with more food products and try to build a few shelves to organize what she has.

loans.use: to buy more food products and build shelves

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a conservative young lady. She asked her husband Yazan to take her place in the photo.

Samah, 19 years old, is a housewife. Her husband Yazan has a small business selling mirrors, frames, and different shaped hanging paintings. At the moment, his business is located at home. They want to be able to open a small separate store to sell the items.
 
So Samah has applied for a youth loan to help her husband in renting a store where they can move the business and start expanding.

loans.use: to rent a small store for the frames and paintings her husband sells

loans.name: Jorge Cristian

texts.es: Jorge Cistrian, tiene la edad de 25 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres. El quiere  comprar, Cemento, Varillas y Block para ampliar un porqueriza en  finca de  de su padre.   Tiene varios años que se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, quiere crecer y también desea que su actividad sea muy productiva. Es el segundo  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No  ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales o Cooperativas, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El  también tiene el deseo de mejorar su situación económica poniendo a producir más la finca y poder hacer un ahorro para su futuro y también ayudarle a su padre.
texts.en:
Jorge Cistrian, age 25, is single and lives with his parents.

He wants to buy cement, rebar, and concrete blocks to expand a pigpen on his father’s farm.  He has devoted himself to raising pigs for several years.  He wants to grow, and he also wants his business activity to be more productive.

This is the second loan that he has received from FUDESCOSUR.  He has not had other loans with state banks or cooperatives.  FUDESCOSUR offered the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

He also wants to improve his financial situation by having the farm produce more.  Then he would be able to save for his future, and he would also be able to help his father.

loans.use: to buy cement, rebar, and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 44 years old, married, and blessed with 10 children between the ages of 4 and 16 years old. His spouse is a civil servant and supports him in meeting some of their family’s financial needs. Wilson runs a transport business in Kabarnet town and he has been in this business for the last four years. From this business he earns an average income of KES 25,000 a month.

Wilson has borrowed his first loan with KADET of KES 30,000. He intends to use the whole amount to purchase spare parts and repair his transport vans. With the anticipated profits, he intends to use part of the money to maintain his vans well and to pay school fees for his children. 

His future plan is to buy a plot of land for building his business and opening a spare auto parts shop.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his transport vans.

loans.name: Marinel

texts.en:
Marinel's priority in life is to provide a good education for her children. She is 40 years old, married, and together she and her husband raise their two children to be responsible and humble. She has a house rental business. She has been offering it to students for almost three years. 

She is now asking for this loan in order to reconstruct another part of the house. It will help increase her income. She is asking for PHP 20,000 to buy gravel, sand, cement, and plywood to use in her house rental business. She promises to pay back her loan in full. She is praying for consistent profits from her small business.

loans.use: to buy gravel, sand, cement, and plywood to use in her house rental business.

loans.name: Jakelyn

texts.en:
Jakelyn is 23 years old and married to Jonathan, a tricycle driver. They have two children. 

Since they got married, Jakelyn established a store to sell grocery items and earn income from it. In her business, she earns about PHP 300 daily. It is just enough for the family's daily consumption.  She is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to increase her stocks of merchandise. She will buy sugar, milk, bottles of vinegar, and cooking oil to sell. This will help increase her income and she is hoping to achieve consistent profits to pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, bottles of vinegar, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en: Mary-Ann's priority in life is to achieve a fortunate life for her family. She is 29 years old and has two children, whom she is sending to elementary school. From the retail business she operates, she earns about PHP 4,000 each month. Mary Ann is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy sardines, noodles, bread, and eggs to sell. This way, she will increase her sales capacity and upgrade her income too. Someday, she prays for good profits for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sardines, noodles, bread, and eggs to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a business man.  Jane has been selling cereals as a primary business and farming as a secondary business for 11 years.  Her monthly income is 7,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

Jane is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to pay school fees for her three children.  Her dream is to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her three children.

loans.name: Abdulqahr

texts.en:
Abdulqahr is a good person. He is 45 years old, and he is married and has five children who live together in Taiz, Yemen. He studied for a bachelor's degree. 

He purchased land, then he built a house. He would like to add another room, so he is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER to cover the costs of purchasing construction supplies such as irons and cement. He hopes to have a big house to cover his family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of purchasing construction supplies such as irons and cement for adding a room to his house.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 27-year-old lady from Kisumu City and is married to Charles who is a driver. They have one child who is 3 years old.

Nancy operates a tailoring business, which she has been doing for the last eight years.  She earns a monthly income of KES 45,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy textile materials for making dresses. She will use her profits to pay school fees.

Her dream is to have a successful business and family.

loans.use: To buy textile materials.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 39 years old, married, and blessed with four children ages 6, 8, 10 and 12. She practices farming, which she ventured into 20 years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

She has requested for a loan of KES 100,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer in preparation for the planting season. 

The anticipated profit will help her educate her children and purchase household assets. Her dream is to see her farming expand to greater levels and to purchase more land for farming. This is her third loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for the planting season.

loans.name: Zambgh Group

texts.en:
This group is called ZAMBGH and is made up of seven members: Yusra, Ameera, Fatin, Fatma, Ghzal, Samih and Muna, dedicated to various disciplines, including: dresses, fabrics and other tasks. All of them live in Aden, Yemen. They took out a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB.

Yusra is the president of the group and is the second person seated from the left side of the group photo. She works on a hairdresser's flexible schedule, since her tasks vary depending upon customer orders. She started her business in her house. She is a professional in her business. She purchases her input materials directly from distributors. She took out a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. With the support from this loan she plans to buy cosmetics for her business.
 
Yusra lives in Sana`a, Yemen with her two children, ages 5 and 10. One of her personal dreams is to open a big beauty salon and offer higher quality service to her clients.

With the support from this loan she will be able to invest in her business and continue developing her skills as she works toward her goals.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 29 years old, married and has two children.

Alaa is a carpenter; in 1996 he opened his carpentry workshop. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3000 as a "youth loan" in order to repair and fix the floors of his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to repair and fix the floors of his workshop

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac used his previous loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on his farm. He was able to plant and harvest, and it was very profitable. He paid back the whole loan amount in good time.

This will be his second loan and he plans to buy fertilizer, maize, and potato seeds for planting during this planting season. With the anticipated profits, he plans to buy another plot of land and hence to boost his farming business.

In the future, Isaac hopes to improve his farming methods by planting on a large scale and to make more income and thereby improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, maize, and potato seeds.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a hard working mother who helps her husband in managing their farm lots by planting vegetables and root crops to sell. They plan to increase their production and income to satisfy their necessities and finance the education of their two children. They have been farmers for almost nine years and earn a profits of PHP 10,000 a month, which they usually spend on food, clothing, and allowances for their children in school. 

Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, they plan to plant more vegetables to sell. Wilma is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production. She and her husband believe that they can increase their yields and income through their patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en:
Kefa is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, he has worked hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Kefa has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He will use this loan to buy more essential commodities to sell, and this will help him generate greater profits and improve his family's living standards. He hopes that in the future he will be able to open another retail shop. 

Kefa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kefa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more commodities to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is forty-three years old, and lives in Barnersville with her four children and husband. For the past five years she has been running a shop where she sells drinks (soda drinks, soft drinks), alcoholic drinks (beer, stout, wine, gin and others), rice, oil and other items. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more alcoholic drinks (beer, stout, wine, gin and others), soft drinks, rice, oil, and other items for her business. Her plans is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic drinks, soft drinks, rice, oil and other items for her business.

loans.name: Haga S

texts.en:
Haga live in Gardnersville with her husband and four children.  For 5 years now she has been running a shop where she sells charcoal.  A problem she faces is that she has not enough income to supply her customers.  She is happy for her business because its sustain her family.  

Haga is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.  In the future, she want to build a house for her children.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Buchanan.  She is 50 years old and did not go to school.  She is married and has eight children between the ages of 18 and 30 that are living on their own, working and attending school.

She has been selling fish for 10 years now.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy more fish for her business.  She started this business from her husband’s savings.   Her plan is to send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Isrrael

texts.es:
Isrrael  es un hombre  que tiene  45 años de edad, de estado civil casado, además  cuenta con 03 hijos que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Isrrael  vive en casa propia en el  distrito de distrito de Zaña, departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica, agua y desagüe; también se menciona que en este distrito viven aproximadamente unas 800  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Isrrael es al transporte público de mototaxi el recorrido lo realiza entre las zonas de Zaña – Cayalti y visciversa. Su cónyuge se dedica a la crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral, ganado porcinos, caprinos, ovinos y cuyes, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, apoyándole en la canasta familiar; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  de transporte público Isrrael cuenta con 6 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. 
Actualmente Isrrael esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 2,000 nuevos soles que será para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo y compra de SOAT, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Isrrael, age 45, is married and has three minor children under his care.  His lives with his wife and children in his own house.  He tells us that the quality of life in his community is one of subsistence. Most of the residents are self-employed people who work in commerce and agriculture. Some also raise livestock.

Isrrael lives in his own house in the Zaña district in the Lambayeque department.  His house has the basic electrical, water, and sewage services.  He also says that approximately 800 families live in this district under these conditions.

Isrrael uses a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) to provide public transportation.  He travels between the  Zaña – Cayalti zones and vice versa.  His wife raises, fattens, and sells small animals like poultry, pigs, goats, sheep, and guinea pigs.  She raises these animals in pens outside of her house.  

He says that she makes her sales at the local market and or to wholesale animal buyers.  This helps him with the family’s living expenses.  

It is worth mentioning that Isrrael has six years of experience in his business activity of public transportation.  This has allowed him to keep his established clientele in this business.

Isrrael is currently requesting a new loan for 2,000 soles for maintenance of his vehicle and to  to purchase SOAT Compulsory Automobile Accident Insurance.  This is a very profitable business activity in the area.  In time it will allow him to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his vehicle and to purchase SOAT Compulsory Automobile Accident Insurance.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en: Veronicah is 40 years old, married and the mother of three children. She earns a living by selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for the past three years and earns 6,500 shillings a month. She is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use it to buy more clothes to sell. With the profits made possible by this loan, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Waccema

texts.en: Waccema is 32 years old, married and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for her children by running a general store. She is applying for a loan for PHP 13,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She has been in business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soap, coffee, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama is married and works hard to support her family by running a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan from NWTF to buy ingredients she can use to make more food to sell. She has been in this line of work for 10 years, and would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make more food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: José Arnoldo

texts.es:
Don José tiene 42  años de edad, es casado y tiene once hijos. Desde muy pequeño se dedica a la agricultura y fue su papá quine le enseño. También trabaja como ayudante de un albañil. 

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar semilla, plaguicidas, fertilizantes y para pago de mano de obra, para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.  

Con la inversión obtendrá mayor producción, una parte de esta la vende y la otra es para consumo de su familia. Lo que desea es generar mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old, married, and has eleven children.  He has been farming since he was very young and it was his dad who taught him how.  He also works as a builder's assistant.

José is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers, and to pay laborers to grow 14,000 square meters of corn.

As a result of this investment, José's production will increase.  He will sell some of his crops and use the rest for his family's own consumption.  What he would like is to make more income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers, and to pay laborers to grow 14,000 square meters of corn

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 39 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, she has worked hard to manage her beauty salon, where she does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use this loan to buy more supplies, which will help her generate greater profits and improve her family's living standards.

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Marío Dagoberto

texts.es:
Don Mario tiene 49  años de edad, es padre soltero de dos hijos varones, uno asiste a séptimo grado y el otro a cuarto grado en la escuela. Él es empleado en la Alcaldía Municipal y su trabajo darle mantenimiento al parque y al cementerio. 

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para cancelar cuatro meses de alquiler de la casa en donde vive junto a sus hijos. 

Con el préstamo satisfará la necesidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos vivienda ya que de no realizar el pago tiene el peligro de los saquen de ahí y lo que Mario desea es tener un lugar seguro donde vivir.
texts.en:
Mario is 49 years old.  He is the single father of two sons.  One of his sons is in seventh grade and the other is in fourth grade.  Mario works for the town council and his job is maintaining the park and cemetery.  

Mario is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to pay four months' rent on the house where he lives together with his children.

This loan will enable Mario to satisfy the need to provide his children with a home because, if he doesn't make the payment, he runs the risk of them being kicked out.  What Mario would like is a secure place in which to live.

loans.use: to pay four months' rent on the house where he lives together with his children

loans.name: La Pampa Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento La Pampa está compuesto por ocho integrantes, seis mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es La Sra. Nancy tiene 44 años, no es casada pero convive con su pareja con el que tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 10 y 17 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, ella es   Panadera desde hace ya varios años, su panadería se encuentra en la localidad de El Torno este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Nancy utilizara este préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, levadura y manteca para la elaboración de pan su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de insumos por mayor ya que es más barato comprar por cantidad, La Sra. Nancy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener más clientela y así de esta manera generar más ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en brindar  una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: The 'La Pampa' community bank has eight members: six women and two men.  The bank's president is 44-year-old Nancy.  She is not married but lives with her partner.  The couple have two children who are 10 and 17 years old.  Nancy's business is making and selling bread.  She has been working as a baker for several years.  Her bakery is located in the town of El Torno.  This is her first loan with the institution.  Nancy will use her loan to buy supplies such as flour, yeast and butter for making bread.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies wholesale as it works out cheaper to buy in bulk.  Nancy faces challenges in her business such as trying to attract more customers so that she can make more income.  She will use the profits from her business to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, yeast and butter

loans.name: Pedro Miguel

texts.es:
Pedro   es un hombre  que tiene  44 años de edad, de estado civil separado, además  cuenta con 01 hijo menor de edad a su cargo, vive con su hijo en casa de sus padres. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Pedro  vive en caserío Malingas  en el  distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura; así mismo no cuenta con los servicios básicos; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 80  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Pedro es a fabricar y vender ladrillos, realiza estas actividades en un terreno cerca de su domicilio. Así mismo también se dedica a la crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral, ganado porcinos, caprinos,  la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos de sus padres y también cuenta  con el apoyo de ellos; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  de Pedro cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este  tipo de negocio. Adicionalmente en campaña de cosecha de mango (meses de Diciembre, enero, febrero y marzo de cada año) Pedro trabaja como personal de seguridad en una fábrica.
Actualmente Pedro esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 3,000 nuevos soles que será para la compra de potreros, de donde saca leña para fabricar sus ladrillos, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 44-year-old man.  He is separated and has one dependent child in his care.  He lives with his son in his parents' home.  Pedro tells us that the quality of life in his community is one of subsistence.  Most of the residents are self-employed people who work in commerce, agriculture and livestock raising.  Pedro lives in the small village of Malingas, in Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  His home lacks basic services.  He tells us that approximately 80 families live in these conditions in his village.

Pedro's business activity is making and selling bricks.  He carries out this business on a plot of land near his home.  He also raises, fattens and sells livestock such as farmyard birds, pigs and goats.  He raises these animals in pens outside his parents' home.  He has his parents' support.  He tells us that he sells his animals either in the local market or to people who buy animals wholesale.  We should mention that Pedro has 10 years experience which has allowed him to build up a customer base for his businesses.  In addition, during the mango harvest season (the months of December, January, February and March each year) Pedro works as a security guard in a factory.

Pedro is currently requesting a new loan for 3,000 soles to buy fields from which he will get firewood that he needs for making his bricks.  This is a very profitable business in his area.  Over time, it will allow him to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fields from which he will get firewood that he needs to make his bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his retail business by increasing the inventory of goods

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is 43 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amalia has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. Amalia requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. Amalia has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Amalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Joylen

texts.en: Joylen is 28 years old, married, and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Joylen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell. Joylen has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo, noodles, snack foods, etc. In the future Joylen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 60 years old, married to Mary, and blessed with children. His youngest child is 13. He sells herbal medicine, a business he started ten years ago. He earns a monthly income of 3,000 KES. 

He has requested a loan of 35,000 KES to purchase herbal medicine for resale. The profit he makes will help him acquire a permanent location for his business. His dream is to lead a better life in the future. This is his second loan.

loans.use: To purchase herbal medicine for resale.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 29 years old, married, and has one child in school. Cristina works very hard to provide for them. Cristina runs a sari-sari store (variety store) in the Philippines. She has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, shampoo, snack foods, and other groceries. In the future Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 30 years old and single. He sells sweets and eggs. He has been in the business for one year now. His monthly income is 7,000 KES. This will be his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy more sweets and eggs for sale. The profits will be used to enlarge his business. In the future he wants to have a chain of businesses.

loans.use: to buy more sweets and eggs then open a new location

loans.name: Maria Mavel

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para mejorar su inventario en el negocio, pues comprara dos fardos de ropa y más zapatos, su intensión es poder a través de los prestamos ir mejorando su disponibilidad en el negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar variedad y que sus clientes le consumieran más mercadería, le aumentaron sus ventas y la clientela.
texts.en: María is requesting a new loan to improve the inventory of her business.  She will buy two bundles of clothing and more shoes.  Her intention is to improve the availability of products in her business.  With her previous loan, she improved her variety and her customers purchased more merchandise.  Her sales and her clientele have increased.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of clothing and more shoes.

loans.name: Las Talentosas Group

texts.es: Dora es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Las Talentosas” grupo conformado por 08 socios entusiastas y responsables siendo la gran mayoría vecinos de la zona. La Sra. Dora de 69 años es separada con 04 hijos independientes. Dora trabaja en un kiosco en la venta de golosinas en un colegio, trabaja de esa manera hace 04 años. A sus 69 años Dora a cumplidos algunos de sus objetivos como mejorar su vivienda y apoyar con la educación a sus hijos. Actualmente el dinero que percibe lo destina para alimentos.
