María has a business selling food such as pickled and cooked vegetables, stewed corn, cheese, ground hot pepper, ground peanuts, etc. in the main market of the town.  She has had this business for 15 years.

The goal of the loan is to buy merchandise (corn to make the stewed corn).

She is very grateful to the institution for the trust they have shown her.  She is a person who wants to succeed, always striving for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to increase her capital selling stewed corn.

loans.name: Rosa Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven de 27 años, es muy entusiasta y trabajadora, sobre todo porque es madre de 2 pequeño de 6 y 9 años de edad a los cuales cría sola porque por razones ajenas el padre de sus pequeños la abandono y desde ese entonces se ha vuelto padre y madre para ellos, pero a pesar de ello, ha logrado con esfuerzo salir adelante y demostrar que su amor de madre puede más que cualquier problema. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor en cualquier época del año, asimismo se realiza la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago entre otros. 

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Rosa se dedica a su negocio como Chofer de mototaxi, ella nos demuestra que las madres pueden hacer de todo con tal de sacar adelante a sus hijos, se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ha demostrado responsabilidad y sobre todo amabilidad a los clientes.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá dar mantenimiento a su vehículo y también comprar una pequeña radio y unos parlantes, con lo cual dará mayor comodidad a los clientes y así ella seguirá trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Rosa is a young woman of 27.  She is very enthusiastic and hardworking, mostly because she is the mother of two little ones who are six and nine years old.  She takes care of them on her own for reasons beyond her control; the father of her little ones left her and since then she has been both mother and father to them.  In spite of that, through great efforts she has been able to get ahead and show that her motherly love is more powerful than any problem.  Her home is in the city of Ica, which is known for having a hot, comfortable climate year-round.  It is also a place where agriculture is practiced, particularly the planting of cotton, grapes, and asparagus, among others.

Rosa works at her business as a mototaxi driver with great effort and dedication.  She shows us that mother can do anything in order to get her children ahead.  She spends about 10 hours at work and she serves up to 30 customer per day.  She believes that her business is going well because she has proven to be responsible and, above all, friendly to her customers. 

Rosa is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to the help they have given her that she will be able to perform maintenance on her car and also buy a small radio and some speakers.  This will allow her to offer her customers more comfort and she will keep working to make her greatest dream a reality: to give her children a profession.

loans.use: to perform maintenance and to buy a radio and speakers

loans.name: Luz Fanny

texts.es:
Luz Fanny es una persona que ha tenido que superar muchas dificultades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante. Separada de su esposo y madre soltera de sus 2 hijos, Luz Fanny tiene como única fuente de ingresos un taller de reparación de zapatos el cual tiene desde hace aproximadamente 2 años, sin embargo, su experiencia en la actividad es cercana a los 10 años, pues durante mucho tiempo trabajó para una empresa y dado a que sentía que su trabajo no era bien remunerado decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller. Gracias a este negocio tiene la oportunidad de generar ingresos para su hogar con los cuales puede ofrecerles las necesidades básicas a sus hijos y además de pagarles sus estudios universitarios. Debido a que su trabajo tiene la reputación de ser de muy buena calidad, sus ventas en estos dos años han venido aumentando considerablemente, y es por esto que ahora busca un préstamo que le permita comprar materias primas para su taller de reparación de calzado como son pegantes, cauchos, suelas, entre otros más.
De esta manera podrá seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes un buen trabajo y así cada vez podrá captar un mayor número de clientes para su negocio, de modo que sus ventas aumenten y sus ingresos cada vez aumenten de igual forma; así sus hijos podrán seguir teniendo una buena calidad de vida y seguir estudiando sus carreras universitarias.
texts.en:
Luz Fanny is someone who has had to overcome many challenges in her life, yet she has always had the strength to get ahead.  Separated from her husband and single mother to her two children, Luz Fanny's only source of income is her shoe repair shop, which she has had for about two years.  However, she has around 10 years of experience in this work, as she worked for a business for a long time, but she felt that she wasn't being paid well enough and decided to set out on her own and start her own shop.  Thanks to this business, she has the opportunity to generate income for her household and offer her children the basic necessities, as well as pay for their university education.  Because she has a reputation for doing very good work, her sales have increase considerably over the past two years.  This is why she is looking for a loan; to buy raw materials for her shoe repair shop, such as adhesive, rubber, and soles, among other things.

This will allow her to keep offering her customers good work and, in this way, she will be able to keep getting more customers for her business.  This will make her sales increase and her income will increase along with it, allowing her children to keep their good quality of life and finish their university studies.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her shoe repair shop, such as adhesive, rubber, and soles, among other things.

loans.name: Asunciòn

texts.es:
Asunción   es un hombre que tiene 44  años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente, además  cuenta con 06 hijos que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Asunción vive en  el caserío Francisco Bolognesi del distrito de Las Lomas del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 100 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Asunción  es la crianza y venta de Ovinos, porcinos, caprinos y aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Asunción  cuenta con 6 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. Así mismo él trabaja en su chacra donde tiene instalado  1.0 has de limón lo cual esta en producción y cosecha semanalmente lo que le permite tener ingresos adicionales; su cónyuge también le apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente  Asunción se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 2000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados y arreglo de corrales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia
texts.en:
Asunción, 44, is in a common-law relationship and has 6 children, all dependents under his care. He lives with his partner and son in his own house. It is mentioned that the quality of life is that of subsistence as most of the inhabitants are independent workers in the commerce and farming of small animals and some of them are agricultural farmers
Asunción lives in the hamlet of Francisco Bolognesi of the Las Lomas district in the department of Piura; this area has only one basic service: electricity. There are approximately 100 families who live under these conditions.
Asunción raises and sells sheep, pigs, goats and fowl. He raises the animals in corrals outside his home. He has 6 years of experience in this line of work, and as such, has been able to maintain a loyal clientele.
He also works in the field where he has 1.0 hectare of lemons in production and that he sows every week, which allows him some extra income; his partner supports him and helps him in his work, as they have a very good relationship between them.
Currently, Asunción wants to expand his inventory of animals because this line of work is very lucrative in this area. He is requesting a loan for 2000 soles to invest in balanced animal feed and corral maintenance, which in time, will help him improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: buy balanced animal feed and make repairs to the corrals.

loans.name: Cesar Calixto

texts.es:
Cesar es un joven de 25 años de edad, el cual es muy trabajador y entusiasta, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor en cualquier época del año, asimismo se realiza la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta salir a correr ya que lo relaja y le ayuda a despejar la mente. Debido a su gran optimismo y lucha  el logro estudiar la carrea de educación Física.

Día a día Cesar sale a trabajar en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi, el se animo a tener este tipo de trabajo porque no encontraba un empleo a fin a lo que el estudio por ello tuvo la iniciativa y actualmente trabaja como chofer; él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 12 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque brinda un buen servicio a los clientes.

Cesar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo  así como también comprar un juego de llantas; esta mejora le permitirá conducir un vehículo en buen estado y sobre todo con seguridad para los clientes y el mismo, así seguirá luchando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño: “Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Cesar is an enthusiastic and hardworking young man of twenty-five.  His residence is in the city of Ica, characterized by its year-round  warm and welcoming climate.  There's agricultural, too, including cotton, grapes, asparagus, etc.   In his free time, Cesar likes to go out for a walk because it relaxes him and helps clear his mind.  His great optimism and effort enabled him to get a degree in physical education.

Cesar goes to work every day as a a motor taxi driver.  He was motivated to get this type of job because he wasn't able to find work after getting out of school, so he took the initiative and now he's a driver.  He works at his business around twelve hours per day and is able to serve nearly twenty clients.  He thinks business is going well because he provides good customer service.  

Cesar is really grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help they've provided, he'll be able to do maintenance on his vehicle and buy a set of tires.  The improvements will allow him to drive a vehicle that's in good condition, and, above all, safe for his clients and himself.  This way he can keep fighting day by day to realize his greatest dream which is, "to have a house of his own."

loans.use: for general vehicle maintenance and to buy tires.

loans.name: Genny Martha

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por las extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Genny, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 12, 9 y 2 años de edad,  los dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es taxista. 

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local y trabaja todos los días,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil o a Quito cada vez necesite. Tiene más de seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Este es su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy amables y confiables. 

Su sueño es que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Progresistas” (Progressive Women) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the “Sultana del Café” for its extensive plantations of incomparably flavored coffee, for its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

Genny, 35, lives in this place.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three children who are 12, 9 and 2 years old.  The two older ones attend secondary and elementary school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

She is a very good housewife who with the intention of earning her own income to help her husband with household expenses sells all types of clothes door to door and also at home where she has a small space and works every day.  She sells on credit and collects every fifteen days.  She goes to Guayaquil or to Quito to buy merchandise whenever she needs to.  She has more than six years in this activity and she does very well.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  This is her fifth cycle in the communal bank and likes it because her fellow members are very nice and trustworthy.  Her dream is that her children never lack anything.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Las Chicas Del Rio Group

texts.es:
LAS CHICAS DEL RIO ES UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO DE CREDITUYO QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN SU CUARTO CICLO, EL GRUPO LLEVA ESE NOMBRE POQUE PASA UN ARROYO CERCA DE DONDE CELEBRAN SUS REUNIONES SEMANALES AL ESTE DE LA CIUDAD DE MONTERREY Y ESTA FORMADO POR 6 INTEGRANTES.

ERIKA ES UNA DE LAS INTREGRANTES DEL GRUPO, TIENE 27 AÑOS, ESTA CASADA Y AUN NO TIENE HIJOS. DURANTE EL DIA, LA SEÑORA ERIKA TRABAJA COMO AYUDANTE EN UNA LAVANDERIA Y POR LAS TARDES; ELLA, SU MAMA Y SU ESPOSO ATIENDEN DESDE HACE YA UN AÑO UN PUESTO DE COMIDAS AHI EN SU COLONIA. ERIKA Y SU FAMILIA VENDEN CENAS COMO TACOS, GORDITAS, HAMBURGUESAS, ETC. LA SEÑORA ERIKA QUIERE SU PRESTAMO PARA CAMBIAR EL PUESTO DONDE VENDE YA QUE SE ENCUENTRA ALGO DETERIORADO Y ADEMAS PIENSA SURTIR INSUMOS PARA PODER AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS. A LARGO PLAZO, ERIKA QUIERE QUE SU NEGOCIO CREZCA Y PIENSA ESTABLECERSE EN UN LOCAL CERCA DEL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD.
texts.en:
The “Las Chicas del Río” (The Young Girls from the River) is a Credituyo group in its fourth cycle.  The group has that name because a stream goes by the place in the east part of the city of Monterrey where they hold their weekly meetings; it has six members.

Erika is one of the group members.  She’s 27 years old, married and has no children yet.  During the day Erika works as a helper in a laundry and in the evenings she, her husband and her mother run a food stand in their neighborhood.  Erika and her family sell dinners like tacos, “gorditas” [stuffed corn griddle cakes], hamburgers, etc.

Erika wants the loan to replace the food stand they sell in because it’s a bit deteriorated and she also plans to stock up on ingredients to increase her sales.  In the long run, Erika wants her business to grow and she plans to set herself up in a local near downtown.

loans.use: to buy a new food stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as pants, shoes, sandals, and tops

loans.name: Blanca Leonor

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Blanca, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos  mayores de edad y la menor tiene 11 años, dos de sus hijos estudian uno en universidad y la menor en colegio, todos sus hijos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es mecánico.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de víveres como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras, frutas, carnes, queso, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan de vez en cuando aunque la mayor parte de las veces es ella quien está en su negocio pues dice que le encanta estar allí, ya que se distrae y también su gana su dinero sin salir de su casa.  Lleva 6 años con su negocio y lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco comunal.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros artículos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 años y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio y esto ha mejorado mucho su vida. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Progresistas” (Progressive Women) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as “La Sultana del Café” because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

We met Blanca, 48, here.  She’s married and has four children.  Three of them are adults and the youngest is 11 years old.  Two of her children are studying, one in the university and the youngest in secondary school.  All of her children still live with her and her husband’s a mechanic.

She has a home-based grocery store where she sells all types of groceries like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, legumes, vegetables, fruit, meats and cheese, among others.  She works every day from 6am until 9pm and sometimes even later.  Her children help her once in a while although most of the time it’s she who is in charge of the store because she loves being there because she entertains herself and also earns money without having to leave home.  She’s had the store for six years and started it with the first loan she got from the communal bank.

She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar and oil among other basic staple items.  She’s been in the communal bank for six years and likes it because she started her business with loans and this has improved her life very much.  Her goal is to continue forward.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Violetas Group

texts.es:
Las Violetas son un grupo solidario que vive en la ciudad de Monterrey compuesto por seis mujeres emprendedoras que está cumpliendo con su tercer ciclo en esta institución. Ellas decidieron escoger el nombre de Violetas porque a todas les gustan estas flores.
Alicia es una de las mujeres del grupo. Ella tiene 53 años y vive en unión libre. Tiene 8 hijos pero ya todos son adultos y trabajan por su cuenta. Alicia se dedica a la venta de gorditas y antojitos. Ella comenzó su negocio hace 2 años y lo hizo con una pequeña parrilla en su casa. A raíz de su éxito  puso un pequeño puesto en una avenida para así poder atraer a más clientes. 
Alicia necesita el crédito porque quiere empezar a vender mariscos y necesita comprar un congelador, copas de cristal y los mariscos para poder comenzar a la venta. Ella sueña con algún día poder llegar a tener un restaurante propio para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Las Violetas are a solidarity group made up of six enterprising women who live in the city of Monterrey.  The group is completing its third loan cycle with this institution.  They decided to choose the name Violetas because all of them like this flower.

Alicia is one of the women in the group.  She is 53 years old and lives in a common-law relationship.  She has eight children, but they are all adults already and work on their own.  Alicia sells "gorditas" [cornmeal cakes stuffed with beans, meat, cheese, and other fillings] and snacks.  She began this business two years ago and did it will a small grill in her house.  As a result of her success she set up a small stand on an avenue to be able to attract more customers.

Alicia needs the loan because she wants to begin to sell shellfish and she needs to buy a freezer, glass stemware, and the shellfish to be able to begin selling.

She dreams that one day she will be able to have her own restaurant to give her customers better service.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, glass stemware, and shellfish.

loans.name: Hilsa Hiralda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por las extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Hilsa, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, aun viven con ella y estudian en universidad. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella para salir adelante junto a su familia y así con sus ganancias poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras, frutas, carnes y otros productos, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden y están desocupados. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 9 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ha mejorado su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Progresistas [Progressive Women] Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Cantón Jipijapa, called "The Sultan of Coffee" for its expansive fields of incomparably flavored coffee.  The region is also known for its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Here we meet Hilsa, who is forty-nine and married with three children, who are all grown, although they live with her and are in college.  Her husband is a driver.

To get herself and her family ahead, and so she can help her husband out with household expenses, Hilsa has a grocery store in her house.  She sells all manner of products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, beans, vegetables, fruits, meats, and other products.  She works every day from 6AM until 8PM, sometimes later.  Her husband and children help her with the business when they're able and not busy.  She's been in business for more than ten years and it's going very well.
 
Hilsa is going to use her loan to stock up her store.  She'll buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, sausages, and other basic necessity itmes.  She's been with the communal bank for nine years and she likes it because she has used the loans to improve her business.

Hilsa's goal to to get ahead in business and for the store to grow more and more every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, detergent, sausages, and other basic necessity merchandise.

loans.name: Jina Pelly

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por las extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora Jina, tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera de  un  hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad e independiente. Lleva 11 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes en su negocio, ya que con el primer crédito lo empezó y es así como se gana su sustento diario. 

Ella para salir adelante junto a su familia y así con sus ganancias poder solventar los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, carnes y  helados, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, trabaja con la ayuda de una prima que vive en su casa y es quien la acompaña, Tiene más de 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes entre otros productos de primera necesidad. 

Sus metas son tener buena salud y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Progresistas Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known as the Sultana of Coffee because of its extensive coffee crops that have an incomparable taste.  Is it also known for its gastronomy and for the warmth of its people.

This is where we met Jina.  She is 58 years and the single mother of one son who is now an adult and on his own.  She has been with the communal bank for 11 years and she likes it because the loans are very important to her business, as she started it with her first loan and it is how she supports herself daily.
 
She is a shopkeeper for a living in order to get herself and her family ahead and to cover her household expenses with her earnings.  She has a food store in her home where she sells all kinds of products, such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, vegetables, meat, and ice cream.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and sometimes even later.  She works with the help of a cousin who lives at her house and keeps her company.  She has had her business for over 11 years and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to stock her store more; she is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, and detergents, among other essential products.

Her goals are to be in good health and to grow her business every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other essential products

loans.name: Karina Del Rocio

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karina, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos,  dos mayores de edad y el menor de 11 años, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa dos estudian en universidad y el menor en colegio. Su esposo es mecánico.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatos, sandalias y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días de dos a tres horas diarias, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 13  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que los  zapatos tienen mucha salida ya que son de muy buena calidad.
	
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, sandalias, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Lleva 14 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio que le ha dado mucho en su vida. 

Su sueño ese tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Mujeres Progresistas' [Progressive Women] meets every two weeks in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as “La Sultana del Café” because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

This is where we met Karina, who is 40 years old, married and has three children. Two of her children are adults and the youngest is 11 years old. All of her children still live at home, two of them are studying in the university and the other in elementary school. Her husband is a mechanic. 

She is a very good housewife, who also works in order to have her own spending money and to help her husband with the household expenses. She earns income by selling shoes, sandals, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She works two or three hours a day, leaving her products on credit with her customers and collecting payments once a week. She has been doing this for over 13 years and is doing very well. She told us that she sells shoes quickly and that they are of high quality. 

This loan is to buy shoes, sandals, perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and under garments. She has been a member of the communal bank for 14 years. She likes it because it was with one of her first loans through the communal bank that she was able to start her business, which has greatly improved her life. 

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and under garments.

loans.name: Bernarda De Jesús

texts.es: Bernarda de Jesús de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida, Ella posee dentro del mercado principal de la zona donde vive, un local en el que vende comida, bebidas, conchas, camarones entre otras cosas ricas al paladar; Espera a sus clientes para la hora del desayuno, almuerzo y entre comidas, ella siempre esta ocupada puesto que es una persona muy reconocida en el lugar por sus platillos que prepara deliciosos y son elaborados con material de primera calidad además que los precios son muy accesibles, el servicio es único recibe a la clientela con gran amabilidad; Bernarda es una mujer emprendedora con muchas metas a futuro una de ellas es hacer crecer su negocio y está completamente decidida a lograrlo, piensa que entre más difícil sea su camino más grande será su recompensa cuando llegue al final, esto la impulso a solicitarle a INTEGRAL dado que cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo de créditos con uno nuevo que le permita comprar granos básicos, quesos, carnes, bebida. Bernarda de Jesús tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bernarda de Jesus, 43-years-old, lives with her life companion. In the principal market of the zone where she lives, Bernarda has a stall in which she sells meals, drinks, conch, and shrimp, among other rich and tasty foods. Bernarda's stall is always occupied because she is very well known in the area for her delicious plates prepared with first-quality ingredients at very accessible prices. The service is unique; she always receives her clientèle with grand amiability.

Bernarda is an enterprising woman with many future goals, one of which is to expand her business. And she is totally determined to accomplish this. Bernarda thinks that the most difficult obstacle along the road will be her compensation while she  pursues her goals. This concern motivated her to request a loan through INTEGRAL. Bernarda can count on much experience in managing past loans. With this new loan, she will buy basic grains, cheeses, meats, and drinks. 

Bernarda de Jesus has confidence that in this manner, she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy basic grain, cheese, meat, drinks, and shell fish to sell.

loans.name: Olga Victoria

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por las extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Olga, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 15 y 8 años de edad, en la actualidad está embarazada de su cuarto hijo, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena esposa que para ayudar a su esposo en la dura tarea de mantener el hogar realiza el crédito para que él  lo invierta en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta al por mayor de pescado, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que él realiza hasta tres viajes por semana a Manta o a Santa Rosa lugares donde compra el mejor pescado para luego trasladarlo al mercado local y vender a los comerciantes minoristas de la ciudad, lleva más de 18 años dedicado a esta actividad y gracias a esto él ha podido darles lo necesario a  ella y a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten ayudar de esta forma a su marido para salir adelante.
 
Sus sueños comprar un carro para que su esposo realice sus viajes ya que hasta ahora tiene que pagar fletes cada vez que viaja y esto se le lleva parte de su ganancia.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Progresistas Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known as the Sultana of Coffee because of its extensive coffee crops with their incomparable taste.  It is also known for its gastronomy and for the warmth of its people.

This is where we met Olga.  She is 31 years old, married, and has three children who are 16, 15, and 8 years old.  She is currently pregnant with her fourth child.  Her two older children are in high school and her youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband is a trader.
 
She is a very good wife who wants to help her husband with the hard work of maintaining their home.  She is asking for this loan for him to invest in his business.  He sells fish wholesale and our friend Olga tells us that he makes up to three trips a week to Manta or Santa Rosa, where he buys the best fish to bring back to the local market and sell it to retailers in the city.  He has been in this business for more than 18 years and, thanks to it, he has been able to give her and their children what they need.

This loan is to buy fish.  She has been in the communal bank for six years and she likes it because the loans allow her to help her husband so they can get ahead.

Her dream is to get a car for her husband to make his trips, as for the time being he has to pay rental fees every time he makes a trip and this takes away from his profits.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Rosa Danny

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija la misma que ya es  mayor de edad y está realizando la tesis,  para ser una profesional. Su esposo trabaja en una universidad de la localidad.

Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos, desde víveres como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras, frutas, carnes, además de esto allí sus clientes también pueden encontrar cierto artículos de bazar, medicinas y útiles escolares, nos cuenta que le gusta tener de todo un poco para que sus clientes no se vayan a otro lugar es por eso que tiene muchos clientes,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados. Nuestra amiga lleva más de 15 años con su negocio y le va muy bien ya que siempre esta mejorándolo con el paso de los días.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, otros víveres y sobretodo útiles escolares que es lo más necesita en la actualidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 años y le gusta porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo. 

Su sueño es que su hija sea una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Progresistas” (Progressive Women) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as “La Sultana del Café” because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

We met Rosa, 51, here.  She’s married and has a daughter who is now an adult and working on her thesis to become a professional.  Her husband works at a local university.

She has a home-based general store.  She sells all sorts of products there from groceries like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, legumes, vegetables, fruit and meat.  In addition to these, her customers can also find certain housewares, medicines and school supplies there.  She tells us that she likes having a little bit of everything so that her customers won’t have to go elsewhere and this is why she has so many customers.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  Her daughter and her husband help with her work when they aren’t busy.  Our friend has had her store for more than 15 years and does very well because she’s always improving as time passes.

She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil and other groceries and above all school supplies which is what she most needs right now.  She’s been in the communal bank for six years and likes it because she’s made many friends in the group.  Her dream is that her daughter becomes a great professional.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, other food items and school supplies.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida es una señora de 46 años de edad, vive con su esposo  y sus tres  hijos  en la comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Santa Cruz de Guanacaste. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería. El turismo es grande en esta zona principalmente por las hermosas playas que tiene  esta provincia.

Adelaida se dedica a las labores  del hogar y atender a su esposo y a  sus hijos, también realiza actividades varias que le permiten ganar algún dinero y  colaborar con los gastos diarios del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) para comprar materiales de construcción y pagar mano de obra, necesita reparar el  techo, el piso y algunas paredes, pintar la casa y terminar el cuarto de pilas.
 
Su deseo es arreglar su vivienda antes de que llegue la época lluviosa para no tener problemas  con el duro clima que se acerca.

Adelaida es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Florida S.A, una de las más de 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA. Este será su primer préstamo con la empresa y  con él espera mejorar las condiciones físicas de su vivienda y vivir cómodamente al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Adelaida, 46, lives with her husband and three children in a community in the south of Costa Rica located in Santa Cruz de Guanacaste.  The local economy is based on farming and animal husbandry where growing tubers, coffee, corn and beans and raising livestock stand out.  Tourism is notable in the zone because of the beautiful beaches this province has.

Adelaida does domestic chores and tends to her husband and children but also carries out activities that make it possible for her to earn money and help with daily household expenses.  She’s asking for a one million colones (¢1.000.000) loan to buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs because she needs to repair the roof, the floor and some walls; to paint the house and to finish the washroom.  Her wish is to repair her house before the rainy season starts in order not to have any problems due to the severe weather that’s approaching.

Adelaida is a member of the Florida S.A. communal credit firm, one of EDESA’s 150 member organizations.  This will be her first loan with the firm and with it she hopes to improve the physical conditions of her home and to live comfortably alongside her family.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Guadalupe Cecilia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por las extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Guadalupe, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11 y 6 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es chofer.
 
Ella tiene una panadería que día a día le saca adelante, nos cuenta que además de pan lo que más vende son los pastelillos ya que estos  los envían a vender en otros lugares, para esto tiene dos chicos a quienes le paga un sueldo por esta labor, también entrega estos productos en un colegio y una escuela de la localidad, con lo cual asegura buenas ventas más que todo de lunes a viernes cuando hay clases, lleva más de 5 años dedicada a esta labor la cual le deja lo necesario para salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear comprar harina, azúcar, levadura, huevos y varios ingredientes necesarios para elaborar sus productos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4  ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para que su esposo realice las entregas de sus productos.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Progresistas” (Progressive Women) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as “La Sultana del Café” because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine, and for the warm-heartedness of its people. 

This is where Guadalupe, age 33, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has two children, ages 11 and 6.  The children go to elementary and secondary school.  Her husband is a driver.

She has a bakery that gets her ahead day to day.  She tells us that in addition to bread, the things that she the most are the pastries.  This is because she sends them to be sold in other locations.  She has two boys that she pays to do this work.  

She also delivers these products to a local high school and to a local elementary school.  This assures her of good sales, especially on Mondays through Fridays when there are classes.  She has been doing this work for over five years.  It gives her what she needs in order to get ahead.

She will use this loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, and various other ingredients that she needs to make her products.

She has been in her communal bank for four cycles.  She likes it because the loans are quick and do not have so many requirements.

Her dream is to buy a car so that her husband can deliver her products.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and eggs, etc.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres De Excelencia Group

texts.es:
Doña Isabel es la tesorera de Banco Mujer Mujeres de Excelencia, un con amplia trayectoria y muy buena conducta de pago. 
Ella es una mujer joven, de 30 años, agricultora, y madre de 2 hijos menores de edad, vive con su compañero desde hace más de 11 años, y ambos trabajan en la siembra de cultivos para llevar el sustento a su familia, siendo este es el único medio de ingresos que perciben.  Siembran varios cultivos como plátano, camote, papa, maíz y otros productos. 
Este es el cuarto crédito que solicita y los anteriores han sido una herramienta muy importante para su microempresa familiar. Su meta es darle los estudios a sus hijos y que lleguen a ser profesionales, así como mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Con Isabel están 8 socias más que van a invertir el crédito en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Isabel is treasurer of the “Mujeres de Excelencia” (Women of Excellence) communal bank.  She has a long history and good payment behavior.

She is a young woman.  She’s 30 years old, a farmer and the mother of two minor children.  She’s lived with her spouse for more than 11 years and both work farming to provide sustenance to their family; this is their only source of income.  They plant various crops like bananas, sweet potatoes, potatoes, corn and other products.

This is her fourth loan request.  The previous ones were a very important tool for her family micro business.  Her goal is to provide schooling for her children so that they can become professionals as well as to improve her family’s quality of life.

There are 8 members with Isabel who will invest the loan in farming and animal husbandry activities.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Zymyrat

texts.ru:
Зымырат 39 лет, замужем, воспитала 6 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Зымырат с 1999 года занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Зымырат имеется 3 коровы, 10 лошадей и 10 овец и 1,0 га орошаемой земли, где она выращивает ячмень. Продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зымырат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Зымырат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Zymyrat is 39 years old, she is married and has raised six children. As a main source of income for her family Zymyrat has been doing field crop cultivation and animal husbandry since 1999, a business which she started with a capital of 10,000 som (KGS). Today her livestock consists of three cows, ten horses and ten sheep as well as 1,0 hectare of arable land where she grows barley. The sale of milk and dairy products brings around 10,000 som a month.

With the goal to further grow her business Zymyrat has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy additional heads of cattle. Zymyrat plans to invest the profit from the loan into further increase of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Siquirritos Group

texts.es:
Doña Virginia es una de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Siquirritos, tiene 48 años, y es madre de 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad, y únicamente el hijo menor vive con ella. Esta madre sola y jefa de hogar siempre se esforzó mucho para sacar adelante a su familia, y llevar el sustento a su hogar.
Actualmente la actividad que desarrolla es la avicultura, cría pollos de engorde para la venta,  el crédito lo va a invertir en compra de los animales y el concentrado. Este es su primer crédito y tiene muchos deseos de superarse, salir adelante, y tener los ingresos necesarios para cuidar su salud, y tener calidad de vida. 
Junto a Doña Virginia están 2 señoras mas que se dedican a actividades comerciales y de servicios.
texts.en:
Virginia is one of the members of the “Siquirritos” communal bank.  She’s 48 years old and the mother of three children, all adults.  Only her youngest son still lives with her.  She’s a single mother and head of household.  She always strove very much to move her family forward and provide sustenance for her home.

She currently raises fowl; she raises chicks to sell and will use the loan to buy the animals and feed concentrate.  This is her first loan and she has a strong wish for self-improvement and to have the income needed to care for her health and to have quality of life.

Two other women appear with Virginia whose activities are commerce and services.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es: Juana Isabel vive junto a sus hijos y su madre, ella tiene un puesto desde hace varios años en el mercado de la localidad donde vende variedad de artículos ollas, manteles, hamacas, cuchillos, entre otros, cuenta con mucha experiencia en éste negocio y es toda una buena vendedora además de ser una persona muy responsable, se ha dado cuenta que ha aumentado la demanda de sus artículos y sabe que no puede decepcionar a los clientes, todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Juana es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo y llena de sueños que desea alcanzar, uno de ellos es ver crecer su negocio y piensa que solo con esfuerzo y dedicación podrá lograr ese éxito es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ollas, hamacas, petates, corbos, etc. Juana Isabel tiene fe que así logrará darle a su familia una vida mas plena.
texts.en:
Juana Isabel lives with her children and her mother.  She’s had a stall in the local market for several years, where she sells a variety of items, such as pots, tablecloths, hammocks, and knives among other things.  She has lots of experience in this business and she’s a good saleswoman and is very responsible.  She realizes that the demand for her items has increased and she knows that she can’t fool the customers.  Everything that she sells is of good quality and she sells at affordable prices, besides she gives excellent service.

Juana is a woman who is very dedicated to her work and is full of dreams.  One of them is to see her business grow and she plans to be successful through her efforts and dedication.  Because of this she decided to request a loan through INTEGRAL.  This will allow her to buy pots, hammocks, mats, etc.  Juana Isabel has faith that she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Nawar

texts.en:
Nawar is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan. She is a mother of four children. 

Nawar is looking to improve her family's living conditions so she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase new furniture for her living room.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her living room

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 44-years-old married woman, a mother of two children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Hanaa is looking to have a loan of 500 JDs so she can expand her project making and selling handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her crafts

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 42 years old and a married woman. She lives in Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan. She is a mother of five children.

Diana is looking to have a loan of 500 JDs so she can improve her home living conditions and buy new furniture.

loans.use: to buy new furniture

loans.name: Nimia Teresita

texts.es: Nimia de 63 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo, que está pensionado,  y tienen 3 hijos en las edades de 32 a 39 años. Ella desde muy joven ha sido muy activa y trabajadora. En su dinamismo aprendió el oficio de panadería cuando se educó en él y hasta hace dos años fabricaba pudines y los vendía en diversas tiendas y a una clientela doméstica entre conocidos, familiares y amigos; así mismo aprendió  a confeccionar ropa y confeccionaba, pero su esposo le recomendó dejar de trabajar en estas actividades  y dedicarse a su hogar por cuestiones de salud, por eso decidió   dejarlos, buscando una actividad en la cual no dejara de producir y pudiera ejercerla mas cómodamente y con mayor flexibilidad. Así fue como se dedicó a la venta de productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, así probó con 3 empresas hasta que eligió una de ellas porque  le gustó su modalidad de trabajo, la cual se adaptaba a su clientela, que ha construido entre sus amistades, familiares, quienes le han referido otros compradores que ha convertido con su estrategia de ventas en sus mejores clientes. Los plazos que Nimia otorga para el pago de sus productos, son de un mes; ella en su negocio trabaja sola y visita permanentemente a sus clientes reales y potenciales para lograr su competitividad comercial. En general no maneja inventarios porque vende todos los productos que solicita, en tanto trabaja sobre pedidos de sus clientes, pero muchas veces le preguntan precisamente por productos que no tiene en el momento  y esto es justamente la razón por la cual está acudiendo a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancía variada de la que mas rota en su negocio, como cosméticos, joyas, bisutería y maquillaje, lo cual hará sobre pedidos y tambien para tener un stock que le permita captar un mayor número de clientes y ganar un poco mas de dinero, pues en ello radica justamente el éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Nimia, 63, lives in the city of Barranquilla with her husband, who is retired.  They have three children, ages 32 to 39.  She has been very active and hardworking since she was very young.

With her energy she learned the trade of baking when she trained in the field.  Up until two years ago she made pudding and sold it in various stores and to home customers, among acquaintances, family members, and friends.  She also learned to make clothing, and she was making clothing, but her husband recommended that, for health reasons, she stop doing this work and dedicate herself to the home.  This is why she decided to leave those jobs, looking for a job in which she could produce and be able to to it more comfortably and with greater flexibility.

This was how she came to sell products through specialized guides or catalogues.  She tried three businesses until she chose one of them because she liked its work method and adapted it to her clientele, which she has built from among her friends and family members, who have referred her to other buyers.  This has turned into her sales strategy with her best customers.  Nimia grants one-month deadlines to pay for her products.  She works alone in her business and permanently visits her actual and potential customers to achieve business competitiveness.

In general she maintains no inventory because she sells all the products she requests and works on customer orders.  But many times they ask her for products she does not have at the moment, and this is the reason she is coming for a Kiva loan, the first financing she has requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it she will buy a variety of merchandise of what most turns over in her business, such as cosmetics, jewelry, costume jewelry, and make-up.  She will sell these on order and also keep some in stock, which will allow her to attract a greater number of customers and earn a little bit more money.  This is where the success of her investment lies.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, jewelry, costume jewelry, and make-up.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: Gloria Elizabeth de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad frijoles, pan, leche, huevos, entre otros ya tiene experiencia en el negocio y es muy conocida en la zona pues todos los productos son de primera calidad y los vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es único siempre se encuentra a la orden de su clientela; Gloria es una mujer emprendedora siempre dispuesta a salir adelante y aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentan, su más grande secreto es la constancia y la dedicación a su labor es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebida etc. Gloria Elizabeth tiene la esperanza que así podrá regalarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gloria Elizabeth is forty six years old and lives with her children in a house she owns. She has a store where she sells basic necessity products such as beans, bread, milk, eggs, and more. She has experience in this business and is very well known in the area. All of her products are of the best quality and she sells them at accessible prices. In addition, her service is unique and she is always at her customers' orders. Gloria is an enterprising woman who is always willing to get ahead and take advantage of the opportunities that come up. Her biggest secret is constancy and dedication to her work. That is why she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to allow her to buy basic grains, snacks, instant products, beverages, etc. Gloria Elizabeth hopes that this way she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, instant products, and beverages.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a fifty-year-old man who is married and has five children.  He has a green grocery business. He has been in the business for six years now. He gets a monthly income of twenty four thousand shillings.

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to add more stock such as tomatoes. With the profits, he plans to construct his house.

In the future he wants to have a prosperous business and support his family.

loans.use: to add more stock of tomatoes.

loans.name: Nanci

texts.en:
Nanci is a conservative woman, so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Nanci is 30 years old and a married woman, a mother of six children. She lives in Baqa'a, Jordan.

Nanci is looking to have a loan of 400 JDs so she can continue to build her house with help of her husband.

loans.use: to continue to build her house

loans.name: Nihad

texts.en:
Nihad is 47 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of seven children. She lives in Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan.

Nihad is looking to have a loan of 800 JDs so she can repair her house and fix it up.

loans.use: to fix up and repair her house

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single woman who has a single child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She sells cashew nuts at the market and has been in this business for the last two years. She also sells coconuts as her other source of livelihood. Asha’s primary customers include retailers from the neighboring towns. 

She joined Yehu to acquire some loans. With the loan of Ksh 40,000, she intends to buy sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is 41 years old and a married woman, a mother of 6 children. She lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.

Faten is looking to have a loan of 500 JDs so she can paint her home and buy new furniture for it.

loans.use: to paint her home and buy new furniture.

loans.name: Najiyah

texts.en:
Najiyah is 39 years old and a married woman,  a mother of nine children. Najiyah is living in Baqa'a, Jordan.

Najiyah is looking to have a loan of 400 JDs, so she can sell spare parts which will make her able to buy a pick-up in the future.

loans.use: to sell spare parts

loans.name: Maria Lizeth

texts.es: La Sra. María Tiene 23 años y es soltera tiene un hijo de la edad de 4 años, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamburguesas desde hace dos años, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicado en una avenida muy concurrida de la ciudad de Cochabamba,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Sra. María utilizara este préstamo para la compra de un carrito nuevo para la venta de hamburguesas, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es  que necesita el dinero, la Sra. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y el de mejorar su negocio cada día, utilizara los beneficios  en seguir mejorando su negocio y su vivienda, su deseo es tener a largo tiempo un restaurante propio, la Sra. María es una persona muy joven con ganas de superación, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan.
texts.en: María is 23 years old and has a 4 year old son. She has made and sold hamburgers for two years. Her sales spot is located on a busy avenue in the city of Cochabamba. This loan is her fist cycle within the institution. María will use the loan to buy a new cart to sell hamburgers. Her reason for asking for this loan is that she needs the money.  María faces challenges in her business such as competition and improving every day. She will use the profits to keep improving at her business and in the long run have her own business. María is a young person who wants to get ahead. She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered.

loans.use: to buy a new cart to sell hamburgers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Natig

texts.ru:
Natig uje 9 let kak imeyet svoy avtoservis gde sam i rabotayet. Natig ochen trudolubiviy i dobriy chelovek. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Natig ranshe jil i rabotal v Absheron regione , no v svazi s ucheboy yego detey on poschital nujnim pereyexat v Baku, no yego avtoservis vse yesho naxoditsya v Absherone. Natig 49 let.

Natig uje vtoroy raz berot iz Kivi ssudu. On ochen blagodaren Kive i Lenderam za to chto oni pomogli yemu v razvitii svoyego biznessa. Seychas on ochen nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti i instrumenti chtobi chinit mashini. 

http://partners.kiva.org/pa2/loan/218267
texts.en:
Natig has been working in his own auto service business for nine years. Natig is a very hardworking and kind man. He is married and has three children. He used to live and work in the Absheron region, but he decided to move to Baku for the education of his children. His auto service business is located in Absheron. Natig is 49 years old.

This is Natig's second loan from Kiva. He is very grateful to Kiva and lenders for helping him in growing of his business. Right now he really needs 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts and tools to repair cars.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools to repair cars.

loans.name: Elmer Balmore

texts.es: Elmer Balmore vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, ya tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura por lo que tiene la experiencia necesaria para sacar adelante el negocio, tiene mucha clientela en la zona pues sus cosechas son las más abundantes y de primera calidad además los precios son accesibles, el servicio es realmente excelente; Elmer es un hombre de sueños, muy trabajador pero sobre todo humilde, el valor para seguir en el camino y llegar al éxito es su más grande secreto, ese valor es el que le ayudo a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz y frijol de la mejor calidad, además de abono y pesticidas, dado que esta por entrar la época de sembrar al ingreso del invierno. Elmer Balmore tiene la capacidad para darle de esta forma a su familia, una vida con mejores oportunidades.
texts.en: Elmer Balmore lives with his life's companion and their children in the house they own. He grows corn and beans. He has been farming for several years and has the necessary experience to get his business ahead. He has a lot of customers in the area because his crops are abundant and of the best quality. He also has accessible prices and excellent service. Elmer is a dreamer and very hardworking but above all he is humble. The courage to keep going forward and reach success is his biggest secret. This courage is what helped him to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to allow him to buy corn and bean seeds of the best quality, as well as fertilizer and pesticides. The planting time is starting with the winter season. Elmer Balmore has the capacity to give his family a better quality of life in this way.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 25 years old. He is married to Maureen and together they have one child. He sells second-hand clothes and has been in the business for the past year.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. He will use the loan amount to purchase stock of skirts and sweaters for his business.

He hopes to establish a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of skirts and sweaters for his business.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en:
Kefa is a conservative woman and is unwilling to upload her photo on the Internet, so the photo is of her uncle. 

Kefa is 31 years old and she is a mother of one child; she lives in Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan. 

Kefa is looking to have a loan of 400 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to improve her house living conditions to be more healthy.

loans.use: to improve her housing living conditons

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a conservative woman and is unwilling to upload her photo to the Internet, so the photo is of her son. 

Mariam is a 45-year-old divorced mother of five; she lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. 

She is looking to have a loan of 600 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to expand her clothing sales business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Nofoz

texts.en:
Nofoz is 41-year-old married woman, a mother of three children. She lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. 

Nofoz is looking to have a loan of 1000 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) with which she can repair her home and fix it to be more comfortable.

loans.use: to repair her home and make it more comfortable

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es:
Imelda  es una mujer que tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente, además  cuenta con 02 hijos que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Imelda vive en  el caserío La Ladrillera del distrito de Cayalti del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 90 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Imelda es la  venta de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, menestras, huevos, leche, aceite, fideos, detergentes, golosinas, bebidas, etc., esta pequeña bodega la tiene instalada en su propio domicilio, donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidel izados; así mismo también esta dedicada a la  crianza de aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Imelda  cuenta con 20 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este  negocio. Su  cónyuge lo apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Imelda se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial (bodega) y a la crianza de animales menores, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de mercadería (abarrotes); y así mismo hacer mejoramiento de su  casa, compra de calaminas  por temporadas de lluvias que se avecinan en el lugar; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Imelda is a 41-year-old woman.  She lives with her partner and has two dependent children in her care.  She lives with her partner and children in her own home.  Imelda tells us that the quality of life of the people in her community is one of subsistence.  The majority of the village's residents are self employed.  They work in commerce and raise livestock.  Some of them also farm.  Imelda lives in the small village of La Ladrillera, in Cayalti district, in Lambayeque department.  The only basic service her home receives is electricity.  She tells us that approximately 90 families in her village live in the same conditions.

Imelda's business activity is selling basic household products such as rice, sugar, mixed veg, eggs, milk, oil, noodles, detergents, candies, drinks, etc.  Her small grocery store is located in her home and this is where she serves her loyal customers.  In addition, she also raises farmyard birds in pens outside her home.  She has 20 years experience in this business which has allowed her to build up a solid customer base.  Her partner supports her in her business activities and they have a good family relationship.

Imelda currently plans to expand her inventory both in her grocery store and her livestock raising business.  These are very profitable businesses in her area.  She is requesting a new loan for 1,500 soles to invest in buying merchandise for her store (groceries).  She will also make some improvements to her home, buying corrugated metal sheets for the approaching rainy season.  Over time, this will allow her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store and to buy corrugated metal sheets for her home

loans.name: Sana'a

texts.en:
Sana'a is 33-year-old married woman, a mother of two children. She lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. 

Sana'a wants a loan of 600 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to improve the living conditions in her home and buy new furniture for it.

loans.use: to improve her house living conditions

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is 31 years old, single, and lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. 

Omar wants a loan of 2000 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to expand his work in his bakery by buying raw materials. Also he wants to improve his store's decorations.

loans.use: to buy raw material for his bakery

loans.name: Jordin Joan

texts.es: Jordin es un joven estudiante de 18 años de edad que estudia. Actualmente cursa el primer ciclo de  la carrera  de Ingeniería en Computación e Informática. Decidió estudiar dicha carrera,  ya que desde el colegio siempre le gusto las computadoras, pues  cuenta con buenas calificaciones, siendo uno de los primeros en su clase. Sus padres son quienes los apoyan con sus estudios. Al culminar su carrera piensa  estudiar un curso de inglés, pues él sabe que de esta manera estará preparado para poder conseguir mejores puestos de trabajo. Su mayor deseo es de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera. El crédito que solicito lo invertirá para sus pagos de pensiones en la Universidad. Jordin agrade a los prestamistas Kiva por el crédito brindado.
texts.en: Jordin, 18, is a young student going to school.  He’s currently in the first cycle studying Computer Sciences.  He decided to study this career because ever since high school he’s liked computers and he has good grades; he’s one of the top students in his class.  His parents support him with his schooling.  When he finishes his career he plans to take an English course because he knows that this way he will be able to get better jobs.  His greatest wish is to finish his career satisfactorily.  The loan he requested is to pay is university tuition costs.  Jordin thanks Kiva lenders for the loan provided.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 28 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Brenda has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Brenda has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics for resale, and will help Brenda to generate greater profits and improve her capital. Brenda hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big shop and a salon. 

Brenda is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Brenda who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Rafael Nicolás

texts.es: Rafael Nicolás vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica cada año al cultivo de maíz, frijol y también a la cosecha de jocote de azucarón, fruta deliciosa y demandada; ya tiene varios años de experiencia en la agricultura y sabe cuándo vendrán las buenas cosechas, se ha hecho de muy buena clientela pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, siempre se comporta muy amable con sus clientes; Rafael es un hombre dedicado a su labor dispuesto a aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se le presentan y mantener el negocio adelante de la competencia, piensa que siempre hay que lograr hasta lo imposible para triunfar, porque lo posible ya es ganancia para su futuro, es así con ese pensamiento que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono y fertilizantes.  Rafael Nicolás tiene fe que así podrá llevar hasta su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Rafael Nicolás lives with his life’s companion and their children in his own house.  He plants corn and beans each year and also harvests “jocote de azucarón” a delicious, highly-sought-after fruit.  He has several years’ experience as a farmer and he knows when good harvests will come.  He has acquired a very good clientele because everything he sells is high quality and he sells it at really accessible prices.  Besides, service is unequalled; he always behaves very kindly toward his customers.

Rafael is a man who is devoted to his work willing to take advantage of all opportunities that present themselves to keep his business one step ahead of the competition.  He feels that there is always something more to accomplish and one has to do the impossible to attain it because that’s an advantage for his future.  It’s with this in mind that he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, manure and fertilizer.  Rafael Nicolás has faith that he will be able to bring economic security home this way.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: La Sra. Wilma  tiene 46 años,  es casada  ella se dedica a la venta de comida  en la localidad de Puerto Rico, ella es cliente antigua de la institución  ya que trabaja mucho tiempo solo con la institución, La Sra. Wilma  va a usar este préstamo para ampliar  su negocio con la compra de mesas y sillas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que no tiene dinero para la compra de mesas y silla a que ella quiere brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes, la Sra. Wilma enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su negocio y seguir  brindado una buena atención a su clientela, la Sra., Wilma es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Wilma, 46, is married and works selling food in the locality of Puerto Rico.  She’s a longstanding client of the institution because she’s been working only with the institution for a long time.  Wilma will use this loan to expand the business with the purchase of tables and chairs.  Her reason for requesting this loan is that she does not have money to buy tables and chairs she need in order to provide more comfort for her customers.  Wilma faces the business challenge of improving her quality of life and will use profits to improve her business and to continue offering good customer service.  Wilma is a very kind, hardworking person who feels happy and grateful for the opportunity she’s being given.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Nèstor

texts.es:
Néstor  es un hombre  que tiene  42 años de edad, de estado civil casado, además  cuenta con 02 hijos que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Néstor  vive en casa propia en el  caserío San Eduardo del distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este distrito viven aproximadamente unas 800  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Néstor es al transporte público de mototaxi el recorrido lo realiza entre las zonas de San Eduardo – Tambogrande y visciversa. Su cónyuge se dedica a la crianza, engorde  y venta de  animales menores como: aves de corral, ganado porcinos y caprinos,  la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; sin embargo se menciona que la comercialización de estos la realiza ya sea en el mercado local y/o ha compradores mayoristas de animales, apoyándole en la canasta familiar; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  de transporte público Néstor cuenta con 9 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. 
Actualmente Néstor esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1500 nuevos soles que será para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo y compra de alimentos balanceados para sus animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Néstor is a 42-year-old man.  He is married and has two dependent children in his care.  He lives with his wife and children in his own home.  Néstor tells us that the quality of life of the people in his community is one of subsistence.  Most of the residents of his village are self employed and work in commerce, agriculture and livestock raising.  Néstor lives in his own home in the small village of San Eduardo, in Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  His home receives the basic service of electricity.  He says that there are approximately 800 families who live in these conditions in his district.

Néstor's business activity is providing a motorcycle taxi service.  He picks up customers between San Eduardo and Tambogrande.  Néstor's wife raises, fattens and sells livestock such as farmyard birds, cattle, pigs and goats.  She raises these animals in pens outside their home.  Néstor tells us that she sells these animals either in the local market or to people who buy animals wholesale.  In this way she supports him in providing for the family.  We must point out that Néstor has nine years experience in the public transportation business.  He has gained and maintained a customer base for this business.

Néstor is currently requesting a new loan for 1,500 soles which he will use to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle.  He will also buy nutritionally-balanced feed for his animals.  This is a very profitable business in his area.  Over time, this will allow him to continue improving his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi and to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for his animals

loans.name: Verónica Raquel

texts.es: Verónica Raquel tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando.
