Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que hace todo lo que este a su alcance para darles lo necesario. Ella se dedica a la elaboración  y venta de variedad de pan dulce y francés.  Tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y con algunos clientes fijos los cuales cada día la prefieren más. La ubicación del negocio es bastante estratégico además vale la pena mencionar que no existe mucha competencia,  razón por la cual es  una de las mas preferidas de la zona en cuanto a venta de pan. Su sueño ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones a las que ella ha tenido por lo que cada día se levanta muy temprano para poder sacar los ingresos necesarios para llevar a su casa el pan de cada día y además desea mantener activo su negocio por mucho más tiempo ya que este es su principal fuente de ingresos.  En base a lo anterior a tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar este credito ya que desea invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios ( harina, azúcar, leche, margarina, colorantes, etc.) para la elaboración del delicioso  pan. Todo esto  lo hace con el objetivo de seguir manteniendo su negocio activo y dando el mejor servicio posible ya que piensa que solo de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño de dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Verónica Raquel, 35, lives in her own house with her life’s companion and their two children who are studying.  For her, the most important thing is her family and it’s for them that she does everything within her reach to give them what they need.

She manufactures a variety of sweet and French breads.  She’s been in this line of work for several years so has quite a bit of experience and some regular customers who every day prefer her more.  The business is located quite strategically and it’s worth mentioning that there isn’t much competition which makes her one of the favorites in the zone when it comes to bread.  Her dream is to see her children in better conditions than she has had which is why she rises very early every day to earn the income necessary to earn her home’s daily bread.  She also wants to maintain the business active for many more years because it’s her main source of income.

Based on the above, she’s decided to approach this institution to request this loan because she wants to invest in the business purchasing necessary supplies (flour, sugar, milk, margarine, food coloring, etc.) to make the delicious bread.  She does all this with the goal of keeping her business active giving the best possible customer service because she believes that this is the only way of making her dream of improving her family’s living conditions a reality.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk, margarine, food coloring, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es: Gloria Isabel tiene cuarenta y seis años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por su  compañero de vida tres hijos y dos nietos. Ella se dedica  a la agricultura, principalmente a la siembra de maíz. Esta actividad la realiza  junto a su esposo y es así como logran llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.  La señora Gloria es una mujer increíble ya que se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora, carismática y responsable.  Tiene 7 años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que  conoce muy bien la manera de hacer esta activada. Cada año realiza esta actividad de la cual vende una parte de su cosecha y la otra la deja para consumo. Es así como poco a poco va saliendo adelante y dando a su familia el alimento básico. Vive en condiciones muy humildes junto con su familia, esto la hace agarrar mas fuerzas para seguir luchando por un futuro diferente. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en los insumos agrícolas (semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc.) y para el pago de mano obra  ya que al inicio de cada año tiene que contratar a ciertas personas para que le echen la mano en la siembra. Es así como  se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Espera que  este año la cosecha sea favorable y logre cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Gloria Isabel is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her family group consisting of her spouse, three children and two grandchildren.  She’s a farmer, primarily of corn.  She does this activity with her husband and this is how they manage to earn their home’s daily bread.  

Gloria is an incredible woman because she’s noted for being very hardworking, charismatic and responsible.  Every year she carries out this activity and she sells part of the harvest and the rest is for home consumption providing her family with basic nourishment.  She lives with her family in very humble conditions which motivates her to find the strength to continue striving toward a different future.

She’s made the decision to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in farm supplies (seeds, manure, insecticide, etc.) and to pay labor costs because at the beginning of each year she has to hire certain persons to help her with the crops.  This is how she earns her livelihood and provides her home’s daily bread.  She hopes that this year the harvest will be good and she will reach her dream.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan José de 56 años de edad, habita en casa de su  propiedad junto con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura, es decir a la siembra de los principales granos básicos como maíz y frijoles. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad toda su vida y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad con las demás personas. Debido a que la temporada para la siembra se aproxima ha tomado la decisión de comenzar a prepararse para la llegada de esa fecha. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este credito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante ya que es la única forma que conoce y hace para lograr tener acceso a una fuente de ingresos.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda y su arduo trabajo logrará su sueño de lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan José, 56, lives in his own house with his life companion and their children.  He’s a farmer.  That is to say he grows the main basic grains like corn and beans.  He’s been in this activity his entire life and this is how he earns his daily bread.  He is a hardworking, responsible man who is very well known in the zone for his big heart and his kindness towards others.  

Because planting season is approaching he decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, etc.  What he most wants is an abundant harvest because this is the only thing he knows and does to access a source of income.  He trusts in God that with His help and his hard work he will reach his dream of improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Billiah

texts.en:
Billiah is a 48-year-old widow who supports her three children, ages 22, 18 and 11. She owns a cereals shop, and she also sells eggs, a business she started 14 years ago. She earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase five bags of beans and two bags of rice to sell. The profit she earns from it will help her pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes to be a wholesaler and build her own home one day. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase 10 crates of eggs, five bags of beans and two bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Nderagakura Group

texts.fr:
Mathias fait partie du groupe Nderagakura et   habite à Gitega. Il  a  40 ans et est marié à Beatrice, cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants, âgés de 3  à  15 ans, dont  4 étudient à l’école primaire

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (riz, farine, haricot,…) depuis  10 ans.

Il est à son dix-septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (riz, farine, haricot,…),à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Les gains du commerce va servir à améliorer la vie de la famille, payer les soins de santé, supporter les frais de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mathias belongs to group Nderagakura and lives in Gitega. He is 40 years old and married to Beatrice, a farmer. Together they have six children aged three to fifteen ; four of them attend primary school.
He has been retailing groceries (rice, flour, beans…) for ten years. He is on his seventeenth loan with Turame. With his Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and purchase many items for his store (rice, flour, beans…), which he will resell to earn more.
Profit from his business will be used to better the family’s living conditions, to pay for healthcare, and to face the children’s school fees.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase many articles for his shop (rice, flour, beans...) to resell to earn more.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es: Fidelina de 44 años de edad,  habita en casa de  su propiedad junto con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de diferentes platos típicos como: yuca frita, elotes, enchiladas, pasteles, papas fritas, etc. Es muy conocida en la zona por sus deliciosos platillos y por su arduo trabajo que día a día realiza.   Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honesta y muy responsable.  Además gracias a su carisma ha sabido ganarse la confianza de muchas personas en la zona donde ella habita.  Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener su negocio activo por mucho tiempo, el cual está ubicado en su hogar de habitación.  Lo que más desea es que su familia goce de mejores condiciones a las que actualmente tiene. Todo esto la motiva a seguir trabajando duramente para dar a su familia lo mejor.  Teniendo en cuenta lo anterior ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: yuca, papas, repollo, tomates, elotes, aceite, etc. para preparar los deliciosos platos típicos que cada día ofrece a sus clientes,  ya que su objetivo es mejorar el servicio que ofrece a sus clientes de tal forma que esto permita mantener y atraer nuevos clientes.  Espera mejorar sus ganancias y de esta forma poder ofrecer a su querida familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fidelina, 44, lives in her own house with her life companion and their children.  She sells various traditional dishes like fried manioc, corn on the cob, enchiladas, cakes, fried potatoes, etc.  She’s very well known in the zone because of her delicious dishes and for the hard work she does every day.  She’s characterized by being a hardworking, honest, very responsible woman.  Also, because of her charisma she’s succeeded in keeping her business active for a long time; it’s located in her house.  What she wants most is that her family enjoys better conditions than they presently have.  All 
of this motivates her to continue working hard to give her family the best.

Keeping the above in mind, she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in her business buying necessary ingredients like manioc, potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, corn on the cob, oil, etc. to make the delicious dishes she prepares for her customers since her objective is to improve  service to her customers to such an extent that she will retain them and attract new ones.  She hopes to improve her profits in order to offer her beloved family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manioc, potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage, corn on the cob, oil, etc.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario tiene 50 años y es casada con 4 hijos que son mayores e independientes, ella se dedica a l venta de suplementos naturales y dietéticos desde hace ya varios años, siendo también promotora y teniendo gente a su cargo que trabaja también con los mismos productos,  ella ofrece sus productos en oficinas en distintas zonas visitando domicilio por domicilio, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Sra. Rosario va a usar este préstamo para compra de mas productos naturales,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que le falto dinero para realizar la compra en cantidad ya que tiene pedidos que entrega, la Sra. Rosario enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar su clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario, 50, is married and has four children who are all independent adults.  She has sold natural and weight-loss supplements for several years now.  She’s also a team leader and has people under her who also work with the same products.  She sells her wares in various offices in several zones and also visiting house to house.  

This loan is her first sequence within the institution.  Rosario will use this loan to buy more natural products.  Her reason for requesting the loan is that she did not have enough money to buy the entire amount to fill all her pending orders.  The business challenge that Rosario faces is increasing her clientele and she’s going to use her profits to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more natural diet products.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa tiene 30 años y es soltera con un  hijo que tiene la edad de tres años ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir  ella confecciona ropa (blusas de cholita) que se encuentran en zona Canal Pata, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rosa va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una maquina recta y compra de tela para la confección de prendas de vestir,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesita una maquina nueva para realizar prendas de mejor calidad, la Sra. Rosa enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el no tener un puesto en el cual pueda exponer sus prendas de vestir, ya que ella entrega a distintos mercados de la zona y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de otra  máquina de coser, su deseo es poder tener una tienda donde ofrecer sus prendas de vestir y tener variedad de mercadería que vender.
texts.en: Rosa is 30 years old.  She is the single mother of a three-year-old son and her business is making clothing.  She makes traditional blouses in Canal Pata district.  This is her first loan with the institution.  Rosa will use this loan to buy a single-needle sewing machine and fabric for making clothing.  She is requesting this loan because she needs a new machine in order to make better quality clothing.  Rosa faces challenges in her business such as not having a place to display her items of clothing.  Instead, she delivers her clothing to different markets in the area.  She will use her profits to buy an additional sewing machine.  Her wish is to have a store where she can sell her clothing and to have a variety of other merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy a single-needle sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman, aged 40 years old, and she is blessed with three children, aged 17, 13 and 9 years old.  She practices dairy farming in their farm in a Kapsabet location and supplies the fresh milk to the local residents as well as to the dairy plant.  She has been in business for a period of 7 years earning a monthly income of about Kshs 8,000.  

She is now servicing her first term loan from KADET LTD of Kshs 30,000 and wishes to use this amount to purchase a dairy cow and dairy feeds.  The profits earned will be used to educate her children. Her dream is to expand her dairy farm.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow and dairy feeds.

loans.name: Nafuu

texts.en:
Nafuu is married to a driver and has six children, four of whom are attending school. She has been operating a café for the last 12 years, and aspires to open a hotel in future. Her other sources of income include earnings from her husband. Nafuu joined Yehu because they care for their clients. Most of her customers are her neighbors. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. 

With the Ksh 40,000, she plans to purchase wheat flour, rice, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a single lady aged 43 years old and a mother to one child, aged 21 years old.  She offers Mpesa (mobile money transfer) services in the Kapsabet area. Her business has been in operation for a period of one and one-half years, earning a monthly income of about Kenya shillings 15,000.  

She is servicing her first term loan of Kenya shillings 30,000 from KADET LTD, and she intends to use this amount to add more of the Mpesa business float.  The amount she plows back in the business will be used to repay the loan and add more float. 

She hopes to prosper in business and in life.

loans.use: To increase her mpesa business float

loans.name: Giringoga Group

texts.fr:
Isidonie fait partie du groupe Giringoga  et habite à Kayanza.Elle  a  28 ans et est mariée à Oscar, un tailleur. Ensemble ils ont 4enfants, âgés de 4 à 11 ans, dont 2 étudient  à l’ école primaire.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 orphelins qui étudient à l’école primaire.

Elle fait le commerce de maïs  depuis  4ans. 

Elle est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  maïs à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter un vélo  de transport qui peut contribuer à  la ration alimentaire les jours où elle n’a pas fait le commerce de maïs.
texts.en:
Isidonie belongs to group Giringoga and lives in Kayanza. She is 28 years old and married to Oscar, a tailor. Together they have four children aged four to eleven; two of them attend primary school. She has two orphans in her care, who study in primary school.
She has been retailing corn for four years. She is on her eighth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan granted her, she will increase her capital and purchase a lot of corn to resell and earn more.
In the coming years, she would like to purchase a carrier bike, which can contribute to earning enough food on days when she cannot trade corn.

loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase a lot of corn to resell to earn more.

loans.name: Cristian Wilfredo

texts.es:
Cristian  tiene 31 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde la edad de 10 años, fue su papá quien le enseño. Siembra maíz desde hace 20 años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos quienes le ayudan a trabajar en la siembra.

Cristian se levanta a ordeñar a las 4:00 a.m., alimenta a sus animales, luego los lleva al terreno y comienza a trabajar durante toda la mañana y regresa a la casa a las 3:00 p.m. con su familia a descansar.  

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas en la ciudad, camina hasta la parada de autobús un kilómetro y tarda media hora en el autobús para luego regresar a su casa. 

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar semilla, abono y para arar la tierra.  Con el préstamo comprara todos los insumos necesarios para sembrar y obtener una buena cosecha que le genere bastantes ingresos para el sustento de su familia. 

Cristian desea comprar una carreta para transportar la cosecha hacia su vivienda con mayor facilidad, ya que paga mucho por el transporte a otra persona y quiere ahorrarse ese dinero.
texts.en:
Cristian, 31, has a spouse and three children.  He’s been working in agriculture since the age of 10; his father taught him.  He’s been growing corn for the last 20 years.  He lives with his wife and three children who help him to work the crops.

Cristian rises at 4am to milk the cows, feed his animals and then takes them to the field and starts to work; he works all morning returning home at 3pm with his family to rest.

To buy farm supplies in the city he walks one kilometer to the bus stop and then takes a half-hour bus ride to then return home.

He is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy seeds, manure and to till the soil.  With the loan he’ll be able to buy all the farm supplies needed to plant and to obtain a good harvest that will generate enough income to sustain his family.

Cristian wants to buy a cart to transport his harvest to his house more easily because he pays another person quite a lot to transport it and he wants to save that money.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure and to till the soil.

loans.name: Mirella Carolina

texts.es:
Mirella  es una mujer que tiene 29  años de edad, de estado civil  casado, además  cuenta con 03 hijos  que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Mirella vive en  el caserío Monte Azul del distrito de La Matanza del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 50 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Mirella  es la crianza y venta de Ovinos, porcinos, caprinos ,aves de corral y colmenas de abejas, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Mirella  cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona, así mismo se menciona que su producción de miel, polen, propoleo lo comercializa en las tiendas naturistas de la ciudad de Piura; Así mismo su cónyuge trabaja en su chacra donde tiene instalado  1.0 has de cultivo de leguminosas lo cual presenta buen estado fenològico y le apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Mirella se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza , venta de animales y comercialización de miel de abeja, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados y compra de foliares, bioestimulantes, pesticidas y pago de jornales para su cultivo; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Mirella, 29, is married and has three minor children in her care.   She lives with her spouse and children in her own house.  It’s noted that the quality of life in the community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers in commerce and animal husbandry; some of them also farm.  

Mirella lives in the Monte Azul settlement in La Matanza District in Piura Department.  The only utility she has is electricity.  It’s also noted that in this settlement approximately 50 families live under these conditions.

Mirella’s economic activity is raising sheep, pigs, goats and barnyard fowl to sell; she also has bee hives.  She raises these animals in corrals outside her house.  It’s notable that Mirella has five years’ experience in this line of work which has led to her having a regular clientele for her business.  She sells her animals to wholesalers in the zone.  She also mentioned that she sells the honey, pollen and propolis to health stores in the city of Piura.  Her spouse works in his fields where he has one hectare planted with legumes which are developing properly.  He helps her very much with all the activities she undertakes there being a very good family relationship between them.

Currently, Mirella has decided to increase her inventory with respect to the animals she raises and sells as well as the honey sales because this is a very profitable activity in the zone.  Because of this she’s asking for a new, 1500 new sol, loan to buy animal feed, leaf fertilizers, bio-stimulants, pesticide and to pay day laborers for her crops which in time will allow her to gradually improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, farm supplies and to pay day laborers.

loans.name: Abraham Kipleting

texts.en:
Abraham paid his previous loan well and in good time. He has requested a loan worth KES 100,000 to purchase two dairy cows.

The anticipated profit will help him pay school fees for his children as well as save some. He hopes to have a profitable business. This is his third loan.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: José Salomon

texts.es:
José tiene 55 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que era muy pequeño, fue su papá quien le enseño. Siembra maíz desde hace 45 años, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos quienes le ayudan a trabajar en la siembra.

Él comienza sus actividades a las 4:30 a.m., se levanta a ordeñar sus vacas, luego los lleva al terreno que esta a unos dos kilómetros de su vivienda. Posteriormente se dirige junto con su familia a trabajar 28,000 metros cuadrados de terreno hasta las 3:00 p.m. y después se retira a descansar. 

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas tiene que caminar un kilómetro hasta llegar a la parada de autobús para luego regresar a su casa a pie con las compras. 

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar los insumos agrícolas, para sembrar y obtener una buena cosecha. Con el préstamo comprara todos los insumos necesarios para sembrar, sin tener que vender sus animales para comprar los insumos. Al obtener una buena cosecha podrá adquirir más vacas lo que permitirá obtener mejores ingresos por la venta de leche. 

José desea construir su vivienda de ladrillo, por que en la que vive es de adobe y se moja en el invierno lo que afecta su salud y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 55, has a spouse and two children.  He’s been working in agriculture since he was little; his father taught him.  He’s been growing corn for 45 years.  He lives with his wife and two children who help him work his crops.

He starts his activities at 4:30am.  He gets up to milk his cows and then takes them to his field that’s about two kilometers from his house.  He then heads out with his family to work the 28,000 square meters of land until 3pm when he goes back home to rest.  In order to buy the supplies he needs he has to walk for one kilometer to reach the bus stop to then return home on foot with his purchases.

He requested a loan from Fundación Campo to buy farm supplies to plant and obtain a good harvest.  With the loan he will buy all the necessary supplies to plant without having to sell off any of his animals in order to buy the supplies.  Upon obtaining a good harvest he will be able to acquire more cows which will make it possible for him to obtain higher income from the sale of milk.

José wants to build his house out of bricks because his current house is made of adobe and it gets wet in the winter affecting his and his family’s health.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Soeun is 33 years old and married, living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She devotes herself to her rice farming business along with her spouse. She has been managing this business for more than 10 years and she has obtained enough experience to carry out her plan and make a good harvest over the year. For additional income, she also produces and sells sugar palm after she gets enough palm juice from local villagers. Soeun has 2 single children who always get involved in this business in addition to their classes to help their mother.

She is now asking for a loan of KHR 1,500,000 to add to her capital to buy extra farmland to expand her present business. Soeun hopes to make a fruitful harvest and earn a good living condition through using the loan. In the future, Soeun will continually support her two children’s education until they can obtain a degree, so they might have a good job someday.

loans.use: to buy extra farmland to expand her present business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 32 years old, from Naivasha and is married to Lucy. They have a son who is three years old. 

Nelson has a quarry business that he has been doing for the past seven years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, to enable him to buy building materials to complete his house and settle his family. 

He hopes to be a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 30 years old, married to Elizabeth and blessed with four children aged eight, seven, five and two years respectively. He keeps poultry and operates a boda boda for additional income. He ventured into poultry keeping three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 13,000. 

He has requested a loan worth KES 45,000 to purchase 100 hens for sale at KES 450 each. His profit will help him purchase more chickens to raise and sell. His dream is to purchase a piece of land and build his own house.

He also dreams of owning a motorbike in his future house as well as educating his children. This is his second loan.

loans.use: To purchase 100 chickens

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman with one child who is in school. She lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water. Mary operates a tailoring business and has been in this business for the last two years. She sells her goods in a shop, and she describes seasonality to be her major challenge. She only depends on her tailoring business, with no any other source of income. Mary joined Yehu to get financial support, and says that she normally spends more on food over the month. She plans to use the loan of Ksh 10000 to purchase some clothing materials.

loans.use: to purchase some clothing materials.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor  es un hombre que tiene 49  años de edad, de estado civil  casado, además  cuenta con 03 hijos  que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Héctor vive en  el caserío Los Peches del distrito de Mochumì del  departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 150 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Héctor es la crianza y venta de Ovinos, porcinos, caprinos ,aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Héctor cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; él vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  1.5 has de cultivo de arroz lo cual presenta buen estado fenològico y su cónyuge también le apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Héctor se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 3000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados y compra de Fertilizantes, foliares, bioestimulantes, pesticidas y pago de jornales para su cultivo; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor, 49, is married and has three minor children in his care.  He lives with his wife and children in his own house.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life in his community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers in commerce and animal husbandry; some of them also farm.  

Héctor lives in the Los Peches settlement in Mochumí District in Lambayeque Department; he only has electricity.  It’s also mentioned that in this settlement approximately 150 families live under these conditions.

Héctor’s commercial activity is raising sheep, pigs, goats and barnyard fowl to sell.  He raises the animals in corrals away from his house.  It should be noted that Héctor has 10 years’ experience which has led to the establishment of a regular clientele for his business.  He sells his animals to wholesalers in the zone.  He also has a 1.5 hectare parcel of farmland planted with rice which is developing properly.  His spouse helps him with all the activities he carries out for there is a good family relationship between the two of them.

Currently Héctor has decided to increase inventory with respect to the animals he raises and sells because this is a very profitable activity in the zone.  Because of this he’s asked for a new 3000 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed, fertilizer, leaf fertilizer, bio-stimulants and pesticide and to pay day laborers for the crops which in time will allow him to gradually improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, fertilizer, pesticide and to pay day laborers.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene como actividad la venta de periódicos y revistas, su puesto esta ubicado en la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz,  el tiene un anaquel que está ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico, el esta todas las mañanas desde las 7.oo de la mañana hora en la que  compra los periódicos y los vende hasta terminar que es aproximadamente hasta las 14.00 de  la tarde, sus hijos son ya mayores y dos de ellos se dedican también a la venta de periódicos, sus hijos están estudiando en la universidad y el deseo del Sr. Roberto tiene el sueño de que sus hijos salgan profesionales y ejercer su profesión, el  les ayuda con todo lo que puede y les da muchos consejos para su vida más adelante, el crédito será invertido en la compra de libros y revistas para vender, ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien por eso quiere seguir vendiendo revistas y por este motivo solicito el crédito, el Sr. Roberto se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Roberto’s activity is selling newspapers and magazines.  His stand is centrally located in the city of La Paz.  He has a stand located in a very strategic spot.  He’s there every morning from 7am when he buys the newspapers and sells them until he runs out at approximately 2pm.  

His children are all older now and two of them also work selling newspapers.  His children are attending university and Roberto’s dream is that his children become professionals and can practice their professions.  He helps them every way he can and gives them advice for life later on.  

He will use the loan to buy books and magazines to sell because he did very well with his previous loan and this is why he wants to continue selling magazines and this is why he requested the loan.  Roberto feels happy and grateful for the opportunity he’s being given.

loans.use: to buy magazines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To puchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Joel Kang'ali

texts.en:
Joel is still selling fruits and vegetables in his green grocery business. He is still getting the same amount of profit and is happy about his business.

He is currently applying for his second loan after he successfully finished paying for the previous loan. He would want to purchase more crates of oranges, pears, mangoes and watermelons to meet his customers’ demands. The anticipated profits will aid him in repaying his loan. He hopes to expand his business into a bigger one.

loans.use: To purchase produce

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio believes that patience and hard work will enable him to improve his status of living and give his family a better life. He is now 45 years old and has two school-aged children. To earn a living, he cultivates their farm lots by planting corn and vegetables to sell. He planned to increase his production and income to supplement his family's needs and to finance the education of his children. 

Due to insufficient capital, Rogelio is asking for an additional capital of PHP15,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for the expenses incurred for planting corn. Through this loan he believes that he will be able to expand his plantation and he is hoping that he will be having a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for the expenses incurred for planting corn.

loans.name: Momo

texts.en:
Momo is a woman who has seven children, all adults and therefore not attending school. She operates a rental house and a food stall, and dreams of opening a hotel in the future. Her primary customers for the food stall are her neighbors. Price fluctuation is her major challenge. 

Momo decided to join Yehu to get access to some loans. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. With the loan of KES10,000 she intends to purchase rice, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 59 years old, married to Lilian and blessed with eight children between the ages of 24 and 36 years. He is a dairy farmer, selling the milk produced from his dairy cattle to his customers. He ventured into this business three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 38,000. 

David has requested for a loan worth KES 40,000 to purchase animal feeds. The anticipated profit from his business will help him to educate his children and he will save the remaining amount. 

He dreams of buying houses and renting them. This is his third loan.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds.

loans.name: Mboje

texts.en:
Mboje is a widowed woman who has six children, none of whom attends school. She operates a fish selling business, selling her fish from home. She has been in this business for the past 10 years and her goal is to open a charcoal business in the future. 

Mboje owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her primary customers are her neighbors and she describes the high cost of goods such as cooking oil to be a challenge to her business. With the KES 30,000, she will be able to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Gordon is 47 years old, married to Joyce and blessed with two children aged 18 and 15 years respectively. He owns a bookshop, a business he started one year ago and which earns him KES 30,000 per month. 

He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase textbooks to sell. The profit he makes will be plowed back into his business.

His dream is to own a big bookshop. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase textbooks to sell.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu es una mujer de 46 años de edad, conviviente y con 3 hijos dependientes a su cargo, Vive  en casa  propia  con su cónyuge y  sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Palmo II  del  distrito de Cayalti provincia de Chiclayo, y cuenta con servicio de luz, agua, el lugar es una comunidad  de aproximadamente 90 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Marilu es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leches, condimentos, etc. además muy aparte ofrece servicios musicales. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años aproximadamente,  y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Así mismo lo apoyan sus hijos  y cónyuge en esta actividad.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 1800 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en  la compra de accesorios musicales para ofrecer un mejor servicio musical a sus clientes, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Marilu is a 46-year-old woman who is in a common-law relationship and has three dependent children under her care. She lives in her own home with her husband and children. They reside in the village of Palmo II in the District of Cayalti in Chiclayo Province. The services they receive include running water and electricity. This place is a community that has approximately 90 families.

Marilu sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, condiments, and other products. In addition, she offers musical services. Marilu has been in business for approximately 10 years and learned this trade from parents. She is known for being a perfectionist in her work. Her children and her husband help her with her business.

The loan of amount of 1,800 PEN that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of musical accessories so that she can provide better music services to her customers. This will allow her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy music accessories.

loans.name: Flor Marìa

texts.es:
Flor  es una mujer que tiene 47  años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente, además  cuenta con 02 hijos  que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Flor vive en  el caserío Nueva Esperanza del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 100 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Flor es la crianza y venta de Ovinos, caprinos y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Flor cuenta con 8 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; él vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  0.5 has de cultivo de Limón lo cual presenta buen estado fenològico; y su cónyuge es profesor y también le apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Flor se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados y compra de Fertilizantes para su cultivo; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Flor, 47, has a spouse and two minor children in her care.  She lives with her spouse and children in her own house.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life in her community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers in commerce and animal husbandry; some of them also farm.  

Flor lives in the Nueva Esperanza settlement in Tambogrande District in Piura Department.  The only basic utility she has is electricity.  It’s also mentioned that in this settlement about 100 families live under the same conditions.

Flor’s commercial activity is raising sheep, goats and barnyard fowl to sell.  She raises these animals in corrals outside her house.  It should be pointed out that Flor has 8 years’ experience in this line of work which has allowed her to secure a regular clientele for her business.  She sells her animals to wholesalers in the zone.  She also has a 0.5 hectare plot of farmland planted with lemons that are developing properly.  Her spouse is a teacher and also helps her very much with all the activities she undertakes there being a good family relationship between the two of them.

Flor is currently thinking about expanding her animal inventory because this is a very profitable activity in the zone and this is why she’s asking for a new loan in the amount of 1500 new soles which will be used to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and fertilizer for her crops which will in time lead to gradual improvement of her and her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mantillitas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento MANTILLITAS  está compuesto por ocho integrantes, seis mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es La Sra. Flora, ella   tiene 37 años y es madre soltera con 4 hijos que son de las edades de  12, 8, 4 y 1 años, ella se dedica  a la venta  de frutas por cantidad en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la  zona 25 de Julio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Sra. Flora utilizara  este préstamo  para la  compra de frutas de temporada por mayor, como sandia, mandarina y naranja para surtir su puesto de venta,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital. La Sra. Flora enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su puesto de venta ampliarlo para así tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, y va a utilizar los beneficios en aumentar su  capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Mantillitas” communal bank has 8 members, six women and two men.  The bank president is Flora.  She’s 37 years old and a single mother of four children who are 12, 8, 4 and 1 year old.  She sells fruit in quantity in her fruit stand located in the 25 de Julio zone.  This loan is her first sequence within the institution.

Flora will use the loan to buy seasonal fruit like watermelon, mandarins and oranges at wholesale to stock her stand.  Her reason for requesting the loan is lack of capital.  The business challenge Flora faces is to improve her stand, to expand it, in order to have more products to offer her customers.  She will use profits to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Mwanjuma

texts.en:
Mwanjuma, a married woman with one child who is enrolled in school, has been selling cashew nuts at the market for the last two years. Earnings from her spouse are the family's other source of income. Mwanjuma describes seasonality as a major challenge, and says that food is her biggest monthly expense. She lives in a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mwanjuma, who joined Yehu to receive access to loans to expand her business, is requesting Ksh 30000 to purchase more sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Running a small store is the business of Ligaya, age 56 and married. From her business, she has been able to meet the family's daily consumption for meals and bills at home. She had been in the business for five years. The couple has three children, but they live separately from their parents. Ligaya would like to sell more merchandise and she is asking for this loan to buy cooking oil, vinegars, biscuits, candies and soaps to sell in her store. She is asking for PHP10,000. 

Someday, Ligaya would like to keep ensuring good profits from the business in order to save funds use in times of emergencies. She and her husband are getting weak and old.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, vinegars, biscuits, candies and soaps to sell in her store.

loans.name: Zaldie

texts.en:
Zaldie is very responsible in generating income for his family. He is married and has one infant child. He owns a motorcycle, with which he provides transportation services as source of his income. His passengers are mostly people at the village where they live. He has been doing this business for over two years now. He usually earns PHP5,000 each month. He is now borrowing a loan of PHP15,000 to pay for franchise renewal and to buy tires and gasoline for the motorcycle. 

Zaldie would like to earn consistent profits from the business and keep ensuring safe travel for his passengers. He wants to be able to earn funds for his family's future expenses.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and to buy tires and gasoline for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 38 years old, married to Kenneth and blessed with three children aged 15, 10 and 5 years respectively.  She sells fuel and charcoal, a business she has been doing for the past two years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested for her first loan from KADET  KES 30,000 to purchase 20 bags of charcoal, 40 litres of paraffin, and 5 cartons of engine and petrol oil. The profit she earns will help her educate her children. Her dream is to prosper in her business.

loans.use: To purchase 20 bags of charcoal, 40 litres of paraffin, and 5 cartons of engine and petrol oil

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат – 48 лет. Она вдова, имеет 4 детей. Она портниха, занимается шитьём национальной женской одежды у себя дома. Опыт в этой деятельности более 16 лет. Она очень умело вышивает национальную вышивку (попур). Старшая дочь Шарофат уже замужем и живет отдельно. Она каждый день приходит помогать матери, так как Шарофат имеет очень много постоянных клиентов и нуждается в помощи дочери. Шарофат обратилась за кредитом в нашу организацию. На полученный кредит хочет приобрести машинку для вышивания. Она хочет получить кредит в размере 1000 долларов для расширения своего бизнеса и надеется на вашу помощь, так как ей нужно воспитывать остальных детей, дать им образование.
texts.en: Sharofat is a 48 year old widow with 4 kids. She is a seamstress with over 16 years of experience. She makes traditional women's clothes at her home. She is very skilled in traditional embroidery(popur).Her oldest daughter is married and lives separately. She comes almost every day to help out her mother, because Sharofat has a lot of regular customers and needs her daughter's help. Sharofat asked for a loan to buy a sewing machine for embroidery. She wants to get a loan of $1000 in order to expand her business and thus be able to raise her other children and give them education.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for embroidery

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: La Sra. Aurora tiene 27 años y es soltera con un hijo que es de la edad de seis meses, ella se dedica a la venta de periódicos y  distribución de los mismos de manera ambulante va por la distintas zonas con su motocicleta ya esto le permite realizar un trabajo rápido. Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Aurora va a usar este préstamo para  mantenimiento y reparación de su motocicleta ya que está presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite realizar un buen trabajo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para agilizar más su trabajo con la reparación de su motocicleta, la Sra. Aurora  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar su clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Aurora, 27, is single and has a six month old son.  She sells newspapers and distributes them in an ambulatory fashion throughout various zones on her motorcycle which allows her to do her work quickly.  

This loan is her first sequence within the institution and Aurora will use it to service and repair her motorcycle since it’s having some mechanical problems that keep her from doing good work.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to make her work more efficient by repairing her motorcycle.  

The business challenge that Aurora faces is to increase her clientele.  She will use the profits to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to repair and service her motorcycle.

loans.name: Norma Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. Norma tiene 59 años de edad es cliente antigua de Emprender, ella se dedica a la venta de papelería, material de escritorio, adornos, regalos y otros objetos como tarjetas, libros etc. Ella vende variedad de productos según a la temporada, tiene ubicado su bazar librería en la zona de San Miguel un lugar muy concurrido de la zona Sur, ella vive en casa familiar con sus hermanos, quienes se colaboran en sus actividades, ella solicita el crédito para proveerse de mercadería con la compra de adornos y material escolar para su librería – bazar ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien ya que por la ubicación del negocio tiene una buena venta y es una persona que cumple con sus pagos, es responsable y trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Norma, 59, is a long-standing Emprender client.  She sells stationery supplies, office supplies, decorations, gifts and other objects like greeting cards, books, etc.  She sells a variety of goods according to the season.  Her store is located in the San Miguel zone, a very busy area in the south sector. 

She lives in the family home with her siblings who help her with her activities.  She’s asking for the loan to stock up on merchandise buying decorations and school supplies for her shop because with her previous loan she did very well because due to her shop’s location sales are very good and she’s a person who makes her payments.  She’s responsible and hardworking and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy decorations and school supplies.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 26 years old and he is single. He sells goats and he has been in this business for 2 years. His business is open from 5 am to 6 pm each day and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Jean Damascene has requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more goats for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future. He will be able to reinvest profits into his business and he will be able to buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Cynthia Jerotich

texts.en: Cynthia is 37 years old, married to David and blessed with three children aged 12, 10 and 6 years. Cynthia owns a salon, a business she started five years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. She also runs a retail shop alongside the salon. She wants to purchase a dryer and has requested a loan of KES 30,000. Her profits will aid in paying to educate her children. She hopes to live a comfortable life with her family. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer for her salon business.

loans.name: Hesborn

texts.en:
Hesborn is still in the timber business though his monthly income has been reduced to Kenya shillings 14,000 due to the stringent rules that have been imposed by the government on felling trees and not planting others. 

He has currently applied for his second loan which he will use to buy more timber for resale and part of the money will be used for transportation purposes. He hopes to work hard and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase trees for timber.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 26 years old and a married lady blessed with two children aged five and two years old.  She buys green tea leaves from the local farmers and supplies them direct to the factory.  She has been in the business for the past four years earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.  

She is now requesting her third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD after she paid her previous loan successfully and wishes to use this loan to purchase bags of green tea leaves from the local farmers for resale.  

The profits will be used to repay the loan and in the future she wishes to own her own tea estate.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh tea leaves from the local farmers for resale

loans.name: Grupo Coral Group

texts.es:
LAS CHICAS DEL GRUPO CORAL ES UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO DE CREDITUYO ES SU TERECER CICLO, EL GRUPO LLEVA ESES NOMBRE YA QUE A LA MAYORIA DE LAS INTEGRANTES LE GUSTAN LOS CORALES. ESTE GRUPO ESTA UBICADO A EL ESTE DE LA CIUDAD DE MONTEREY  Y ESTA FORMADO POR 6 INTEGRANTES. 

NANCY ES UN DE LAS INTEGRANTES DE EL GRUPO, TIENE 40AÑOS Y ES MADRE SOLTERA CON 3 HIJOS DE 17,8 Y 2 AÑOS DE EDAD. SU HIJO DE 17 AÑOS TRABAJA Y ESTUDIA PARA AYUDARLA CON LOS GASTOS DE LA FAMILIA. ANTERIORMENTE, LA SEÑORA NANCY TRABAJABA COMO EMPLEADA EN UNA COMPAÑIA DE COSMETICOS, PERO HACE UN AÑO DECIDIÓ EMPRENDER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO EN BUSCA DE MEJORES INGRESOS. AHORA NANCY ES DUEÑA DE UN PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO EN DONDE VENDE ROPA Y ACCESORIOS PARA DAMA EN LOS MERCADOS RODANTES ALREDEDOR DE SU COLONIA. CON SU PRESTAMO, NANCY QUIERE COMPRAR MAS ROPA Y ACCSESORIOS PARA TENER UN PUESTO CON MAS VARIEDAD. SU META A LARGO PLAZO ES PONER UNA BOUTIQUE EN CENTRO COMERCIAL Y TAMBIEN ASPIRA A COMPRARSE UN AUTOMOVIL PARA AYUDARSE A TRANSPORTAR SU MERCANCIA Y LLEVAR A SUS HIJOS A LA ESCUELA.
texts.en:
“Las Chicas del Grupo Coral” is a Credituyo solidarity group in its third cycle.  The group is called that because most of the members like corals.  This group is located in the east of the city of Monterrey and it has six members.

Nancy is one of the group members.  She’s 40 years old and a single mother of three children who are 17, 8 and 2 years old.  Her 17 year old son works and studies to help with family expenses.  Nancy used to work as an employee in a cosmetics firm but a year ago decided to start her own business aiming at earning better income.  Now, Nancy owns a small business where she sells clothes and women’s accessories in the various street markets in her neighborhood.  

With her loan Nancy wants to buy more clothes and accessories in order to have more variety in her stand.  Her long-term goal is to open a boutique in a shopping center.  She also hopes to buy a car to help her transport her merchandise and to take her children to school.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Ruperto

texts.en:
Ruperto is 35 years old, married and has two children. His spouse is a house keeper. Ruperto patiently provides motorcycle transportation services, for the people in his village, from Mondays to Saturdays. Sundays serve as a rest day for him and he spend it with his family. 

He is asking for a loan of PHP27,000 to use for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He would like to ensure safe travel for his passengers. He will buy tires and gasoline. The other part of the loan will be used to repair existing vehicle troubles and for maintenance.

With good profits, Ruperto will able to pay his children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy tires, gasoline and for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a business-oriented person. Aside from her hog raising business, she is also making sweets to sell that add up her income. She is making tamarind candy, purple jam, and peanut butters. She had been in the food production sales for almost two years now. 

Mirasol is now 38 years old and had two children who attend school.

Mirasol would like to keep producing delicious sweets and increase her earnings. She is now asking for a loan of PHP22,000 to buy skimmed milk, sugars, and plastic wrappers for use in her food production sales. She is also hoping for good growth and nutrition for her hogs. 

She will be very happy to achieve financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy skimmed milk, sugars, and plastic wrappers used in her food production sales.

loans.name: Joyce Jendeka

texts.en: Joyce has requested for her second loan, worth KES 70,000, to purchase more fruits and polythene bags to sell. The anticipated profits will aid her venture into other businesses. She hopes to create job opportunities to the youths.

loans.use: to buy different sizes of polythene bags.

loans.name: Maricely Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maricely  es una mujer que tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente, además  cuenta con 01 hijo que es menor de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijo en casa de sus padres . Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Maricely vive en  el  distrito de La Matanza del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, agua y desagüe; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 500 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica  Maricely es la  venta de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, menestras, huevos, leche, aceite, fideos, detergentes, golosinas, bebidas, etc., esta pequeña bodega la tiene instalada en el  domicilio de sus padres, donde atiende a sus clientes ya Fidel izados; así mismo también esta dedicada a la  crianza de aves de corral, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Maricely  cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este  negocio. Su  cónyuge es agricultor y se dedica a la siembra de leguminosas y plátano, así mismo también  lo apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Maricely se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su establecimiento comercial (bodega) y a la crianza de animales menores, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 2000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de mercadería (abarrotes);  lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Maricely, 28, has a spouse and a minor son in her care.  She lives with her spouse and son in her parents’ house.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life in her community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers in commerce and animal husbandry; some of them also farm. 

Maricely lives in the La Matanza District in Piura Department.  The basic utilities she has are electricity, water and drainage.  It’s also mentioned that in this settlement approximately 500 families live under these conditions.

The commercial activity Maricely carries out is selling basic staple items like rice, sugar, vegetables, eggs, milk, oil, noodles, detergent, snacks, soft-drinks, etc.  This small store is located in her parents’ house where she tends to her regular customers.  

She also raises barnyard fowl in corrals away from her house.  It’s worth mentioning that Maricely has four years’ experience in this line of work which has allowed her to retain her regular clientele in this business.  Her spouse is a farmer and he grows legumes and bananas.  He supports her in all the activities she undertakes for there is a good family relationship between the two of them.

Maricely has proposed to expand her inventory with reference to her store and with the animals she raises because this is a very profitable activity in her zone.  Because of this she’s asking for a new loan in the amount of 2000 new soles to buy merchandise (groceries) that will allow her to gradually improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Hezbon

texts.en:
Hezbon is 53 years old, married, and blessed with six children. To earn a living, he runs an electrical shop. He has been in this business for four years, and he grew his business with a previous loan from Faulu Kenya. He has also managed to pay school fees for his children.

Hezbon hopes to further grow his business and expand his premises in the future. He has requested 50,000 KES to buy sockets and bulbs.

loans.use: to buy sockets and bulbs.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is married and 25 years old. She is blessed with one four-year-old child. She owns a salon and has been in operation for seven years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES.  

After successfully repaying her previous loans, Maureen is now requesting a fifth loan, at 60,000 KES, from KADET LTD. She wishes to use this amount to purchase hair braids, hair treatments, weaves, a blow dryer, and a drying machine.  

The profits will be used to repay the loan and reinvest in the business. She hopes to prosper in business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 24 years old and single. She has a tailoring business in Olkalau town and has operated it for 2 years. She makes clothes for both men and women. Her business has been very profitable.

This will be her 3rd loan, having repaid her all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use this loan amount, of Kenya shillings 40,000(KES), to buy more sewing material and different types of sewing thread for use in her business.

In the future, Beatrice hopes to expand her business and open other tailoring shops in other towns to make more income.

loans.use: to buy more material and sewing thread.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
This is Gliceria, 61, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Policarpio, her business partner, and a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gliceria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells RTW products for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gliceria hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of 'Ready To Wear' merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah sells dried maize in Olkalau town. He is 31 years old, married to Felista, a farmer, and they have two children.

This will be Jeremiah's second loan, after paying his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan amount to buy more stock of dried maize for resale.

In the future, Jeremiah hopes to grow his business and to buy a pick-up for transporting and supplying maize to the market in Olkalau and other towns.

loans.use: to buy more maize stock.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 53 years old, a single mother of five children aged 29, 27, 25, 24 and 22 years. She is in the business of selling cereals, which she started 20 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

Miriam has requested for KES 30,000 to purchase bags of maize and beans to sell. Her profit will help her to educate her children. She hopes to live a comfortable life. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha has been a cash crop farmer in Olkalou town now for the last 10 years. She is 39 years old and a single mother of 6 children. She was introduced to KADET by one of the existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use this loan amount of Kenya shillings 20,000 to buy fertilizers and potato seeds for use in her farm during this planting season. She also plans to buy a water pump for use on her farm.

In the future, Martha hopes to expand her farming by planting more cash crops and thereby make more income. This will help to provide a good education for her children as well as improving the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and potato seeds.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
María  es una mujer que tiene 41  años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente, además  cuenta con 02 hijos  que son menores de edad a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. María vive en  el caserío José Olaya del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven aproximadamente unas 150 familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica María es la crianza y venta de Ovinos (cuenta con 100  animales) y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad María cuenta con 7 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  1.0  has de cultivo de Limón lo cual presenta buen estado fenològicor y también le apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente María se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 3000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceados y arreglo de corrales para sus animales; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
María, 41, has a spouse and two minor children in her care.  She lives with her spouse and children in her own house.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life in her community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers in commerce and animal husbandry and some of them also work in agriculture.  

María lives in the José Ayala settlement in Tambogrande District in Piura Department.  The only utility she has is electricity.  It’s also mentioned that in this settlement approximately 150 families live under these conditions.

The commercial activity that María carries out is raising and selling sheep (she has 100 animals) and barnyard fowl.  She raises these animals in corrals away from her house.  It’s worth noting that María has 7 years’ experience in this line of work which has led to her retaining her established regular clientele in this business.  She sells her animals to wholesalers in the area.  Her spouse works in his fields where he has 1 hectare of lemons in production that are developing well.  He support her very much in all the activities she carries out for there is a good family relationship between the two of them.

María plans to increase her inventory of animals because this is a very profitable activity in her zone.  Because of this she’s asking for a new loan in the amount of 3000 new soles to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and to repair the corrals for her animals which in time will allow her to gradually improve her standard of living with her family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and to repair the corrals.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 30-year-old businessman who is married with two children, aged four and two years. He has been running a green grocery for the past five years. He uses his monthly income of 9,000 KES to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced to the company by a staff member. Samuel will use the loan to purchase fruits and vegetables. With the anticipated profit from the loan, he intends to boost his business. 

His future hopes include sending his children to university.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en:
Banzragch is a-34-year-old married guy who has 4 children and lives with his family in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

Banzragch runs a taxi business, full day, and his spouse operates a seasonal fruit selling business. Her business continues from May 1st to October 30th.  Their last year’s business income was used for house recovery.  

Thus, Banzragch is requesting a 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase a variety of fruits to sell in his wife’s small sales stall.   

Banzragch is very trusted and a repeat Kiva client. This picture was captured on the 2nd of May.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 34 years old. She is married to Macharia and together they have one child. She sells cabbages and has been in the business for the past 12 years.

This is her first term loan in KADET after she was introduced by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of cabbages for resale.

She hopes to build a house for her family and to give her son a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase stock.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been doing farming in Olkalou town for 5 years. He plants potatoes for resale and it has been profitable. He is 28 years old and married to Elizabeth who is also a farmer. They have two children. 

This will be his first loan amount and Peter plans to buy fertilizer and potato seeds for planting on his farm. He also plans to buy a water pump.

In the future, Peter hopes to improve his farming business and make more income. He hopes to be able to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and potato seeds.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 38 years old, married, and blessed with five children, aged 19, 16, 13, 8 and 1 year old. She has been in the tailoring business for seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 38,000. 

Sarah has requested for an asset loan worth KES 61,700 to purchase a 43 inch Samsung television for another line of business where she can be screening movies for pay. The profit she earns will boost the business. 

Her dream is to one day open a micro financial institution.

loans.use: to purchase a 43 inch Samsung television set for a new line of business.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru:
Гульмире 40 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. Гульмира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2003 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 6,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Гульмиры  имеется 3 дойной коровы, 2 лошади и 25 овец. Прибыль с продажи молока составляет около 4,000 сом в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец.  Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 40 years old, married, and raising four children. To provide a primary source of income for her family, she has been working in animal husbandry since 2003, starting her business with an initial amount of 6,000 som (KGS). Today, Gulmira's farming business consists of 3 dairy cows, 2 horses, and 25 sheep.  Profits from the sale of milk bring her close to 4,000 som per month.

In order to further expand her business, Gulmira has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep. She is planning to invest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Saruni

texts.en:
Saruni is 40 years old, married, and supports a family of 12. He farms wheat and raises sheep, and this has been his business for the last 17 years. His monthly income is 50,000 KES. 

He has applied for a sixth loan, at 70,000 KES, from KADET LTD. He plans to use the funds to buy sheep for fattening and future resale. The anticipated profits will be reinvested in the business. 

His future plans include educating his children and attaining financial success.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening.
